Fossickers Tourist Park offers a wide range of accommodation to suit couples, families, campers and group bookings looking for a quite and relaxing setting with little or as much as you want to do. Accommodation options include our Luxury range of ensuite cabins, standard cabins, powered sites with a view over the Peel River and surrounding farmland. Fossickers Tourist Parks Friendly staff prides itself on ensuring all accommodation and facilities are kept meticulously clean. Fossickers' Tourist Park is ideally located on the banks of the Peel River in the tranquil surrounds of historic Nundle. Accommodation includes self-contained en suite cabins, powered sites with grassed and slab sites with plenty of trees for shade. Facilities include a camp kitchen, barbecue area, fire pit, tennis courts and amenities block. Fossickers' Tourist Park is only a short walk to all the attractions of Nundle. Reception Hours are from 9.00am to 5.30pm. Outside of these hours please use the night bell located to the right of the door at reception. Pets are not allowed in our cabins but are allowed on our sites at Managers Discretion and should be on leads at all times and arent allowed in the camp kitchen or barbecue areas. Fossickers' Tourist Park also provided Free WiFi.

properties.name: Fort Grey Campground
properties.description: Fort Grey campground is a great place to take a break on your NSW outback tour. Set amongst sweeping sand dunes and suitable for caravans and motorhomes, its the ideal base to explore the western part of the park.After being cooped up in your vehicle, youre bound to want to stretch your legs a little. There are some marked day walks close to the campground, including the walk across Lake Pinaroo to Sturts tree available when the lake is dry. You can also explore the ruins of the Old Fort Grey homestead or explore the area by bicycle.Cameron Corner, where the borders of NSW, Queensland and South Australia meet and the Dingo Fence extends as far as you can see is a good daytrip from Fort Grey. Theres a store so you can refresh supplies and fuel if need be. The campground is also close to one end of Middle Road if you feel like a day of 4WD touring.As you cook up your dinner on the barbecue, look out for red and western grey kangaroos dusk-grazing around the campground. Theres no need to set your alarm clock when youre staying at Fort Grey, the dawn chorus will take care of that; its a lovely way to start the day.

properties.name: Emu Lake Campground
properties.description: Emu Lake campground makes a beautiful base for exploring Kinchega National Park. Close to the facilities at the Shearers Quarters where there are hot showers and bore water and amid the stunning colours of the sandy plains, youll have a true bush adventure. Spot emus, visit the historic Kinchega Woolshed and take a thousand snaps of the sunsets and birdlife.

properties.name: Deniliquin Riverside Caravan Park
properties.description: Located on the banks of the Edward River (a branch of the mighty Murray), backing onto a red gum forest and only 5 minutes’ walk into the CBD. We have absolute river front standard and ensuite powered sites all with their own TV aerial and 4 acres non powered bush camping where we allow open fires.

properties.name: Darling River Campground
properties.description: If you like to wake up to water views, then pitch your tent at Darling River campground. The picturesque Darling River, on the eastern edge of Kinchega National Park, is famous for birdwatching, wildlife and stunning wildflower displays.As you set up camp, take a moment to soak in the tranquil vibe of this idyllic riverside campground but dont be fooled; its bursting with life. Flocks of pink and black cockatoos nest in tree hollows whilst egrets and black kites patrol the waters. Not to be outdone, cheeky little finches hop through the scrub.After a day exploring, cool off with a swim in the river before preparing a barbecue feast. On a warm night you might hear the mocking call of a perons tree frog, which sounds like laughter or a creaky door. Tumble into your sleeping bag to be soothed to sleep by the sound of the river flowing past.

properties.name: Coombadjha Campground
properties.description: Set up camp in beautiful rainforest surrounds just a short walk from your car at Coombadjha campground. This easily accessed rainforest retreat makes an excellent base for a couple of days exploring the World Heritage delights of Washpool National Park.After youve set up your tent, stretch your legs along the short and easy Coombadjha nature stroll or spend the day discovering the beautiful 8.5km Washpool walk, a circuit that climbs through rainforest and dry forest before descending to cross Coombadjha creek. Youll see rare giant red cedar, coachwood, crabapple, figs and lilly pillies, a special feature of this walk. There are also many places for quiet contemplation along the way, like the pretty Summit falls.Coombadjha campground is a wonderful location for rainforest ambles and spotting wildlife. On warmer days, youll relish cooling off in Coombadjha creeks natural swimming pool.

properties.name: Cattai Campground
properties.description: Cattai campground is a great place for a weekend getaway with family or friends and a good place to stop with your campervan on a driving tour.Once youve picked the perfect campsite and pitched your tent, its time to start exploring. Kids will love the wide open space that is great for bike riding, playing and running, plus the campground is right near the Hawkesbury River, meaning fishing, canoeing and kayaking opportunities are all nearby. Theres also the historic Cattai Homestead, a short walk or drive from campground. Its an important part of Australian history so be sure to check it out.Youll probably be woken by the call of birds in the morning, and you may see a kangaroo peeking at you through the bushland on a morning walk to the lookout over Hawkesbury River.

properties.name: Camp Wambelong
properties.description: Set on the banks of the tranquil Wambelong Creek with spectacular views of Belougery Split Rock, Camp Wambelong is the perfect spot to unwind and immerse yourself in nature. It's an ideal base for you to explore the network of walking and bike riding trails of the Warrumbungles.With three walking tracks starting right here, youll be spoilt for choice. Pack a backpack and head off to enjoy the sights along Belougery Split Rock circuit, Burbie Canyon walking track, or Mount Exmouth walking track.Or simply sit back and enjoy the tranquillity of this remote camping spot. Keep your eyes out for a group of passing kangaroos or wallabies and listen carefully for the sounds of pobblebonk frogs set amongst the chorus of birdsong. You could even try your luck fishing or yabbying in the nearby creek.Take a virtual tour of Camp Wambelong captured with Google Street View Trekker.

properties.name: Camp Walaay
properties.description: Ever dreamed of running workshops among the gum trees? Specifically designed for large groups, from 20 to 180 people, Camp Walaay is a campground that's ideal for school groups, conferences and educational workshops in the heart of Warrumbungle National Park. The adjacent classrooms at Warrumbungle Environmental Education Centre facility make it a great location for specific activities with an educational, environmental, or cultural focus.When class is finished, theres a range of nearby walking tracks to enjoy. At night, after a barbecue feast, everyone can gather around the campfire for singalongs and stories, or stargaze together. If you hear a rustle in the darkness, it might be a curious yellow-footed marsupial mouse.Take a virtual tour of Camp Walaay captured with Google Street View Trekker.

properties.name: Brambles Green Campground
properties.description: Brambles Green campground is one of Myall Lakes National Parks boat accessible campgrounds, so its an ideal overnight stop for kayakers and canoeists paddling the lower Myall River. The campground also makes a good stop for hikers on the Mungo walking track. Its a small and secluded with a flat grassy area beside the river where you can pitch your tent or set up your bivvy.The campground is fairly basic, so youll have to bring all your equipment and supplies with you. There are wood barbecues but youll need to bring your own wood.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Emerald Beach
properties.description:
Emerald Beach, where the beach is your front yard, and the bush is your backyard. There’s hours of entertainment for the kids (and let’s be honest, the adults too) at Discovery Parks – Emerald Beach

Discovery Parks - Emerald Beach is an ideal destination for nature lovers and camping enthusiasts. The park is perfectly positioned to offer easy access to the pristine sands of Emerald Beach and the surrounding natural landscapes. Whether you're traveling with a caravan, motorhome, or tent, this park provides excellent camping facilities that cater to all types of campers, ensuring a comfortable and memorable stay.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Dubbo
properties.description:
Just 2 minutes from Taronga Western Plains Zoo, Discovery Parks – Dubbo has 700 furry-friends as neighbours.

Discovery Parks - Orana Dubbo provides a range of comfortable accommodation options, including modern cabins and well-maintained camping sites. The park's location in Dubbo offers guests easy access to local attractions and services. Whether you're visiting for a short stay or a longer vacation, the park provides a welcoming environment with all the necessary amenities.

properties.name: Banksia Green Campground
properties.description: Banksia Green is a paradise for beach goers and lake lovers alike. Nestled behind the dunes in the southern section of Myall Lakes National Park, its a great spot for a family holiday. Theres plenty of space for caravans and camper trailers so you dont have to do without your creature comforts.Dont forget your swimmers and the fishing gear, as its only a short walk to the beach. If the surf is too rough, head in the other direction for the peaceful foreshores of Bombah Broadwater. If you enjoy a bush walk, step out on Mungo Brush Rainforest loop and Tamboi walking track.As the shadows lengthen, stoke up the fire, barbecue the catch of the day over the flames and tuck into a feast. Settle in under the stars and be gently soothed to sleep by the sound of the waves.

properties.name: Apsley Falls Campground
properties.description: When the modern world gets too much, you know its time to load up the campervan and head for the hills. Apsley Falls campground, on the western edge of Oxley Wild Rivers National Park, is your ticket to serenity. This unique bush site, in northern NSW, is a world away from the city crowds. Its the perfect bush stop on a driving holiday and a great base for walking and birdwatching.Pitch your tent among a forest of stringybarks and white gums. As you settle in for your stay, keep an eye out for grey kangaroos and wallabies that often drop by for a visit. Make sure you bring your binoculars to spot some of the abundant birdlife in the area including crimson rosellas, red wattlebirds and thornbills.Once youve set up camp, its time to explore the park. Take nearby Apsley Gorge Rim walking track, a short loop walk packed with scenic views of the rugged Apsley Gorge and main falls. If youve still got energy to burn, venture onto Oxley walking track, which traces the northern rim of the Apsley Gorge for spectacular views of both the main and lower falls.After a day of exploring, head back to the campsite for a barbecue feast. If youre keen to see some wildlife after the sun sets, grab a torch; you may be lucky enough to see a platypus at dusk, or the elusive spotted-tailed quoll after night falls.

properties.name: Abercrombie Caves Campground
properties.description: Looking to get back to nature, but still want the luxury of a hot shower after a day of adventure? Abercrombie Caves campground is for you.The first thing youll notice when you arrive here is the tranquil creek running through the camping area, with its clear waters and shady surrounds. Find yourself a grassy spot anywhere alongside the creek and pitch a tent or park your caravan.Join one of the tours at Abercrombie Caves and be amazed at the incredible formations or check out the magnificent waterfall on Grove Creek Falls walking track.Then head back to your campsite, throw a steak on the barbecue and enjoy the relaxing sounds of the nearby waters. As the sun sets, listen closely to natures orchestra, and keep your torch handy to spy possums in the trees or a wombat waddling past.

properties.name: Dead Horse Gully Campground
properties.description: Camp among the massive granite boulders of Sturt National Park - a place that has to be seen to be believed.Located near the town of Tibooburra, an Aboriginal word meaning a €˜place of heaps of rocks, Dead Horse Gully is surrounded by huge granite boulders that look like a pile of giant marbles. Theyve been in this place for thousands of years and with the Sturts desert peas growing around them; provide a dramatic and beautiful backdrop for a great outback camping experience.Its a well-equipped campground, with free barbecues and picnic tables that are perfect for cooking up an outback feast on, and Tibooburra is nearby so you can pick up some supplies or enjoy a meal in town.

properties.name: Black Rocks Campground
properties.description:
Set behind the dunes amongst tuckeroo and banksia trees, Black Rocks Campground is perfectly positioned right by Ten Mile Beach and near Jerusalem Creek. 

Not far from Evans Head, it is a great place for a family camping holiday, with campsites for caravans, camper trailers and motorhomes.

Getting to the beach is easy along the short walking track that leads you north along creek banks and through wetlands to the mouth of the ocean. Jerusalem Creek paddle route offers excellent opportunities for paddling. You can launch your canoe or kayak from the pontoon and camp the night at Jerusalem Creek or return to the main campground. 

Go at dawn or dusk to increase your chances of spotting animals and birds.In the evening, enjoy a tasty dinner at one of the picnic tables located throughout the campground.

Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ, toilets and carparks. Bring your own firewood and it is encouraged to bring gas or fuel stoves. 

Mobile phone coverage is limited. 

Bookings can be made in advance.

properties.name: Freemans Campground
properties.description:
Get the whole family together for a relaxing camping escape on the beautiful central coast of NSW.Set in the heart of Munmorah State Conservation Area and nestled in bushland, this grassy, landscaped campground has ample space with designated sites for caravans and trailers as well as spots for tent camping. Many sites are shaded by the branches of established trees, and there are covered barbecue areas. 

The long, sandy stretch of Birdie Beach is just a short walk from the campground, a leisurely walk along the beach is a great start to the day. Fantastic fishing and surfing spots as well as bushwalks are also close at hand. And if you're there during the winter months, you might just see whales as they make their way along the coast.Take a virtual tour of Freemans campground captured with Google Street View Trekker.

properties.name: Blackheath Glen Reserve
properties.description: Driving to this reserve from Blackheath is magic but the road is steep, narrow, and full of sharp corners. It may not be suitable for bigger rigs. The campsite has flat spots scattered in the bush either side of a stream. River rocks have been used to make fire pits. There is one metal barbecue pit, some picnic tables (some of which are sheltered) and a wheelchair accessible non-flush toilet.

properties.name: Yarrangobilly Village Campground
properties.description: Yarrangobilly Village campground is ideal for a touring holiday of Kosciuszko National Park and offers a great base for walking, fishing, as well as exploring the historic and natural wonders in the northern precinct of the park. This picturesque riverside camping spot is located beside historic Cotterills Cottage, the oldest building in Kosciuszko National Park.Set among grassy woodlands, just off the highway, it has easy parking for caravans and trailers. The campground is just off Snowy Mountains Highway, 7.5km north of the Yarrangobilly Caves entrance road.Set on the banks of meandering Yarrangabilly River, try your hand at fishing or enjoy a leisurely picnic. You might spot a few eastern grey kangaroos grazing or relaxing in the shade.

properties.name: Wyanbene Campground
properties.description: Its a small campground with 6 sites located near Wyanbene caves. It has a toilet and a wood barbecue (please bring your own firewood). Access to the caves is by permit only. If you want to visit the caves, please contact Narooma office before you arrive to arrange cave access.Bookings: Bookings are required. Book online or call the National Parks Contact Centre on 1300 072 757. Rates and availability display when making an online booking.Where: 676 Wyanbene Road, Wyanbene, NSW, 2622 in Deua National Park.

properties.name: Thredbo Diggings Campground
properties.description:
You want mountain views, a river setting, and a peaceful spot among the snow gums? Thredbo Diggings campground is definitely the site for you.During summer, lots of families and fishermen enjoy this place by Thredbo River. 

The former like to ride the Thredbo Valley track, walk riverside Bullocks track, or cool off in the in the water. The latter arent too fond of all that splashing but try to hook brown and rainbow trout with a spot of fly fishing. 

For hardcore skiers, who are also very well-prepared, Thredbo Diggings campground is a short drive to the ski fields at Thredbo Alpine Village and the ski tube to Perisher.

Thredbo Diggings campground is also a short drive to Ngarigo campground as well as local attractions including Wild Brumby Schnapps Distillery, Lake Crackenback Resort and Bullocks Hut.

properties.name: Sans Souci Parking
properties.description:
Car park on the side of the road in Sans Souci.  Parking restrictions apply check signage for details.
No overnight camping allowed

properties.name: Timbery's Cultural Bush Walk
properties.description: Experience a Welcome to Country with traditional smoking ceremony before embarking on a cultural bush walk to learn about native foods, medicines, tools, land and sea management including traditional fire practices. Witness a cultural performance at the conclusion of tour.

properties.name: Gaagal Yuludarla Tour
properties.description: Take a leisurely walk up onto the headland and take in the breathtaking view of Gaagal Wanggaan (Beach South) from the viewing platform and smell the fresh salt air. Gain insights into the Gumbaynggirr people’s deep, spiritual connection to the beautiful Dunggirr julum (Koala mountain) also known as Yarriabini. Experience a Welcome to Country, smoking ceremony, creation stories, bush food demonstrations, storytelling and traditional hunting techniques.

properties.name: Western Plains Tourist Park Dubbo
properties.description: Located in the Dubbo City Centre, you’ll find this Dubbo holiday and caravan park the perfect base to explore the wonders of our vibrant regional city. Choose to stay in a comfortable cabin with all the essentials, or enjoy the great outdoors on a caravan site or a campsite. Discover historic attractions like the Old Dubbo Goal, visit the locals at Taronga Western Plans Zoo, and enjoy great restaurants and cafes right on your doorstep.

properties.name: Junee Tourist Park
properties.description: Junee Tourist Park offers a range of accommodation in Junee to suit couples, groups or families. Relax in our peaceful environment &enjoy our modern facilities. Stretch your legs for a short walk to many shops, cafes, & craft shops. Park facilities include 2 bedrooms self-contained cabins, powered/non-powered campsites, laundry, & a camp kitchen.

properties.name: Jenolan Holiday Park
properties.description: Jenolan Holiday Park offers a range of accommodation in Oberon to suit couples, groups or families. Relax in our peaceful environment and enjoy our modern facilities. Stretch your legs for a short walk to many shops, cafes and craft shops. Ideally located a short drive away from Bathurst or the Central Blue Mountains Region.

properties.name: Bulahdelah Lions Park
properties.description:
This is a pleasant, free campsite next to the Myall River. There are rubbish and recycling bins, free sheltered gas barbecues, and sheltered picnic tables. There is a boat jetty and ramp. The toilets are a five-minute walk away over the bridge and have disabled access. The nearest coffee shop is also over the bridge and only five minutes away. 

Overnight stays are permitted for fully self-contained recreational vehicles, for a maximum period of 72 hours.  Whilst there is no charge for camping overnight, the Lions Club has a donation box in place if you wish to leave a donation.

There is a dump station five minutes away in the Bulahdelah showground. Although the site is free, donations are welcome. 

Max stay: 72hrs.

properties.name: Katoomba Falls Tourist Park
properties.description:
Katoomba Falls Tourist Park: Your Blue Mountains Escape 

In the scenic Blue Mountains, Katoomba Falls Tourist Park offers a tranquil haven for nature enthusiasts seeking a memorable escape. 

Ideal for: 
-Nature lovers: Explore the awe-inspiring Blue Mountains National Park, teeming with hiking trails, waterfalls, and breathtaking lookouts. 
-Families: Enjoy a family-friendly atmosphere with ample space for relaxation and recreation. 

Situated in Katoomba, New South Wales, just a short distance from the heart of town and iconic landmarks like the Three Sisters.

properties.name: Uloola Falls Campground
properties.description:
Who would have thought you could be so close to the city and yet so far from civilisation? 

Uloola Falls campground in Royal National Park is a great nature getaway, especially if you're looking for things to do near Sydney.For a relaxing start to your weekend escape, catch the train. 

Dont forget your hiking boots because this campground is reached via the long Uloola walking track or the medium difficulty Karloo walking track. If youre particularly adventurous, you can cycle there on your mountain bike from Waterfall.

Passing through heathlands, you'll be bathed in colour by the wildflower displays in spring. Keep an eye out for the gymea lily with its single stem and vibrant red flower.Once you arrive, set up camp beside picturesque Uloola Falls and sleep under the stars. 

Your only distraction here will be the splash of the waterfall as it hits the rock pool below.Take a virtual tour of Uloola Falls campground captured with Google Street View Trekker.

properties.name: Warigala Badha Ben's Walk
properties.description:
Begin with a Welcome to Country by Traditional Owner and Elder Uncle Sonny Simms, along with his son Matt Simms. Be guided through our cultural path visiting our significant Aboriginal sites and participating in bush tucker knowledge.

You will hear ancient stories that have connected us to country since the very first sunrise. The journey will finish with a traditional dance performance to celebrate and give thanks to our old people.

Come share this ancient experience with us.

properties.name: The Rocks Aboriginal Dreaming Tour - Illi Langi
properties.description: Drawing upon knowledge populated from the oldest ecologists, conservationists, wildlife carers, botanists, astronomers, climatologists and marine biologists on the Earth today. Your Aboriginal guides, will explain how this ancient wisdom continues to reveal itself within the English settlement of The Rocks. See Bligh and Barney Reserve and hear the Dreamtime origins including creation stories and the connection between Aboriginal saltwater people and seasonal food sustainability.

properties.name: Sand Boarding Quad Bike Tour with Aboriginal Culture
properties.description: Live the adventure! Sand Dune Adventures promises you a quad riding experience like no other. We are the only tour company that has access to the highest sand dunes on Stockton Beach. In this extended, Aboriginal cultural tour you dig for fresh water, learn about Bush resources, ride past ancient camp sites (middens) and sand board down one of the largest sand dunes on the beach. Tailored to meet your needs and experience.

properties.name: Giingan Tours
properties.description: The Giingan Experience is about Gumbaynggirr people, language and culture.

properties.name: Sand Dune Adventures - 1.5 Hour Aboriginal Culture And Sand Boarding Quad Bike Tour
properties.description: Ten-minute quad bike induction followed by 30 minute learning about the Worimi people. Sandboarding and quad bike riding on Stockton Beach. Includes motorcycle helmet and hi-vis vest.

properties.name: Australian Museum - Waranara First Nations Tour
properties.description:
Journey through the cultures, history and objects of this land’s First Peoples. 

A member of our First Nations team will guide you through the First Australians Galleries, Bayala Nura and Garrigarrang, weaving in personal stories of their own country, culture and experiences.

properties.name: Australian Reptile Park
properties.description:
The Australian Reptile Park is Australia’s original hands-on zoo. Home to over 2,000 animals and located in a natural bush setting on the scenic Central Coast of New South Wales.
Cuddle up to koalas, kangaroos, quokkas and dingoes or test your bravery and hold a massive python!
Learn about the lifesaving work the Park does through its antivenom program and important conservation work saving Australia’s wildlife through the charity Aussie Ark.

Only 60 minutes from Sydney or Newcastle, the Australian Reptile Park is a centrepiece attraction of the Central Coast. Look out for Australia’s first “Big Thing” – Ploddy the dinosaur, visible just before the Gosford exit heading north on the M1.

properties.name: StayKCC (Katoomba Christian Convention)
properties.description: Our Campground has hot showers and free, fast and unlimited WiFi! Please visit our website for info

properties.name: Tomerong Rest Area - Free Camping in State Forest
properties.description: 4x4 recommend, no facilities, phone reception good

properties.name: Roses Park
properties.description: Grassy camp area next to Bellinger River. Toilets, sheltered and unsheltered picnic tables and bins available. Some shade from trees. 15km SE of Dorrigo. Signposted. Max stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Woody Head Campground
properties.description:
Woody Head Campground provides a range of camping options, from tent sites and caravan spots to cozy cabins. Explore the surrounding rainforest, teeming with birdlife, or cast a line from the nearby boat ramp. 

Families will love the sheltered lagoon, perfect for a safe and relaxing swim.

properties.name: Gum Hole Campground
properties.description: Enjoy relaxed and easy camping in incredibly lush, tranquil surroundings at Gum Hole campground and picnic area. Its a fantastic spot thats perfect for picnics by the river, with plenty of space for the kids to run around. Take your 4WD for this riverside camping experience.From here, you have direct access to Namoi River and all the adventures and activities it offers, be it swimming and paddling in the water, fishing for your dinner, canoeing through the rapids, or simply soaking up the sights and sounds of the local wildlife.

properties.name: Sapphire Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Sapphire Beach Holiday Park is absolute beachfront on beautiful Sapphire Beach with its clear water, surf and white sand.

properties.name: Dalmorton Campground
properties.description: This spacious campground in Guy Fawkes River State Conservation Area is located near the historic town of Dalmorton, which was once a thriving gold-mining town during a short-lived boom.A quiet campground thats rarely full, Dalmorton campground has a large mown area that is suitable for group camping or a game of soccer or rugby. There are also logs placed around the fireplaces, encouraging people to sit and share stories whilst enjoying the warmth of the fire on cool evenings.The campground is on the edge of Boyd River, making it a perfect place to stay if youd like to while away some holiday time swimming, canoeing or fishing.At dawn or dusk, see if you can spot the red-necked wallabies around the grounds, or the platypus in the river. At night, brush-tailed possums sometimes visit the campground, and you may hear the sounds of purebred dingoes howling from the surrounding hills.

properties.name: Broken Head Holiday Park
properties.description:
Broken Head Holiday Park offers guests large, well maintained sites to cater for all tent and caravan shapes and sizes. Site locations provide quick access to all amenities and leisure activities.

All of our guests enjoy free access to our wi-fi wireless internet service within the Park

***let management know you found them on Campermate****

properties.name: Garden of Eden
properties.description: Garden of Eden Caravan Park is a quiet family park set amongst shady trees
properties.fees: Powered Site $33/$37/$66, Unpowered Camp Site $26/$28/$54; Extra adult $15-$19; Extra child $10-$12 per night per person, depending on the season

properties.name: Numgarry Rest Area
properties.description: 8km north of Kiama southbound access only. Toilet facilities and covered picnic table

properties.name: Crestview Tourist Park
properties.description: Crestview is a quiet landscaped tourist park.

properties.name: Bulahdelah North Golf Club Rest Area
properties.description:
Although this campsite is next to the Pacific Highway, it is pleasant enough with some shade if a little noisy. There are rubbish bins and a single toilet without disability access behind the golf club. 

You are welcome to use the golf club showers from Wednesday to Sunday when the club is open.The club restaurant is open from Wednesday to Sunday between 12:00 and 2:00 and 5:00 and 8:30. But mind the dress code (see the photo for information on the dress code)!

Self contained vehicles only.

properties.name: Suffolk Beachfront Holiday Park
properties.description:
Escape the crowds and discover Suffolk Beachfront Holiday Park, a tranquil haven ideally situated in Suffolk Park, just a 10-minute drive from the heart of Byron Bay. 

Relax in idyllic surrounds with absolute beachfront location on Tallow Beach and family friendly atmosphere with spacious powered campsites

properties.name: Mullumbimby Rugby League Club
properties.description: Caravan Park with good bathroom facilities and basic Camp Kitchen

properties.name: Canton Beach Holiday Park
properties.description:
Canton Beach Holiday Park is the perfect place for your next relaxing holiday.

This campground features laundry facilities, tour / ticket assistance, and a convenience store. Free WiFi in public areas and free self parking are also provided. Additionally there are BBQ’s and picnic areas.

Just a few streets from Main Road, Toukley, Canton Beach offers its visitors a vast array of flora and fauna native to the Central Coast. Go trekking through the national parkland that surrounds the holiday park and marvel at the stunning lake system.

properties.name: Bendeela Camping and Recreation Area
properties.description:
Bendeela is a popular camping and recreation area, about 150 kilometres south of Sydney. 

With its wide-open spaces and lush setting on the banks of the Kangaroo River, it's the perfect spot to relax and get back to nature. 

Popular activities include swimming, canoeing, fishing and wildlife spotting.

Campers must have a booking via the website.

properties.name: Kurri Kurri Free Camp
properties.description: Free camping ground, just off the hunter expressway in Kurri Kurri. Close to local pubs, aldi, coles, fuel.

properties.name: Sydney Tourist Park
properties.description:
Sydney Tourist Park is a 3 star park and our sites can accommodate caravans, motor homes, campervans, camper trailers and tents. Drive thru sites are suitable for large rigs.

Sydney Tourist Park is located in the beautiful Sutherland Shire and is surrounded by many of the activities and attractions that Miranda has to offer.

properties.name: Merewether Ocean Bath
properties.description: Best ocean pool in NSW. Such a fabulous place to swim with 100m width & 50m laned area.

properties.name: Bull's Camp Reserve
properties.description:
**Day Use only**

Nice rest area on the way to or from Katoomba. We've had reports that camping is no longer allowed here. Please check before settling for the night!

properties.name: Blackheath Glen Tourist Park
properties.description:
Blackheath Glen Tourist Park: Escape to the Blue Mountains. 

Amidst the picturesque Blue Mountains, Blackheath Glen Tourist Park offers a tranquil escape for nature lovers. 

Unwind and Explore. 
Choose from a variety of camping options or cozy cabins, perfect for a relaxing getaway or an adventurous exploration of the surrounding wilderness. 

A short stroll to the charming village of Blackheath with its cafes, shops, and vibrant community.

properties.name: Jervis Bay Holiday Park
properties.description: Jervis Bay Caravan Park is a well maintained, unspoilt, privately owned park

properties.name: Bulli Beach Tourist Park
properties.description: At Bulli Beach Tourist Park, invigorate yourself with a quick dip before breakfast.

properties.name: Wombeyan Caves Campground
properties.description:
Love the idea of sleeping in the great outdoors but like the convenience of amenities at your fingertips? Thats exactly what youll find at the Wombeyan Caves campground.

This large campground is perfect for caravans and motor homes, and offers easy access for people using wheelchairs. Your campsite will be close to all the attractions in the park, and theres a communal kitchen, as well as fire places so you can toast marshmallows. You're bound to welcome a hot shower at the end of a hard days exploring.

properties.name: Mullumbimby Showground
properties.description: Mullumbimby Showground provides a camping area with powered and unpowered sites. Facilities include toilets, showers, bins and dump point. Cash only payment must be paid on arrival. Pets are permitted on a lead. Fires are not allowed. Enquires can be made by phone to the caretaker.

properties.name: Ponto Falls Camping
properties.description: Lovely secluded camping area on the banks of the Macquarie River. There is a single toilet and rubbish bins. Road to get there is mostly sealed but could be difficult when wet. Turnoff is 9 km N of Wellington, on the W side of the Mitchell Hwy.

properties.name: Tweed Holiday Parks Fingal Head
properties.description: Tweed Holiday Parks Fingal Head is quiet and secluded, with the ocean and kilometres of white sandy beach right at your doorstep.

properties.name: Holiday Haven White Sands
properties.description: Holiday Haven White Sands

properties.name: Shoalhaven Caravan Village
properties.description: Shoalhaven Caravan Village is located on the banks of the Shoalhaven River, near the village of Terara.

properties.name: Wine Country Tourist Park
properties.description: Looking for quiet, clean and tidy caravan park in Hunter Valley Wine Country?

properties.name: Budgewoi Holiday Park
properties.description: The lakeside haven that is Budgewoi, has something to offer travellers

properties.name: Lake Wallace (Wang Dam)
properties.description: This large and grassy area with fantastic facilities, incl. A dump point, hot showers, toilets, and children's playground, is located on the bank of the lake. It offers scenic views and many water sports activities, such as swimming, canoeing, sailing and fishing. Powerboats, tents and camper trailers are not allowed at Lake Wallance. 48hrs maximum stay.

properties.name: Wooyung Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Wooyung Beach Holiday Park.

properties.name: Carcoar Dam Camp Area
properties.description: Free grassy camping spot next to Carcoar River. Lovely area with toilets, cold showers, picnic tables, bins and BBQs available. You can also boat in the river, as well as swim and fish. Located on Coarcoar Dam Rd, 12km SW of Blayney.

properties.name: Murphys Glen campsite
properties.description:
Free campsite at the end of a 5km gravel road. Road could be difficult for 2 wheels vehicle but OK if the weather is dry. 
Big space with toilet and fireplace.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Eden
properties.description:
If you're after a getaway that's a little off the beaten path but still packed with wow factor, Discovery Parks – Eden is your spot. With a water park, pool, and pump track, the kids won’t know the meaning of "bored"—there’s always something exciting happening.

For nature lovers, Beowa National Park is a dream come true. Whether you're up for the challenging Light to Light Walk or just a short trek, the stunning views are sure to impress. If you're visiting between May and November, keep an eye out for majestic whales making a splash along the coast.

History buffs will love the Eden Killer Whale Museum, where you can learn all about the legendary creatures that sometimes grace the bay.

Whether you prefer the comfort of a cozy cabin or the great outdoors on a grassy powered site, Discovery Parks – Eden offers a variety of experiences. The only challenge? Deciding what to do first!

properties.name: Blue Lagoon Beach Resort
properties.description:
Dive into paradise at Blue Lagoon Beach Resort, idyllically situated on the Central Coast of New South Wales, Australia. Offering a beachfront location on scenic Shelly Beach, Blue Lagoon Beach Resort boasts stunning ocean views and direct access to the calming waters. 

Choose from a range of comfortable accommodations, including cabins and caravan sites, all designed to suit your needs. While unwinding at the resort, indulge in world-class amenities like the sparkling outdoor heated pool, spa complex, and tennis courts. Escape the everyday and create lasting memories at Blue Lagoon Beach Resort, your perfect Central Coast getaway.

properties.name: Holiday Haven Lake Tabourie
properties.description: Holiday Haven Lake Tabourie

properties.name: Holiday Haven Huskisson Beach
properties.description: Holiday Haven Huskisson Beach is the place for you.

properties.name: Wallacia Caravan Park
properties.description: Caravan Park near Blue Mountains. Powered and unpowered sites. Clean toilets and showers. Washing machine and dryer available. BBQ area and picnic tables also available.
properties.fees: $40 for a powered site per night

properties.name: Bredbo Inn Hotel
properties.description:
If you are travelling with a caravan or you are camping, the rear of the hotel has grassed space available for caravans and campers with Ladies and Gents toilets and showers available for use inside the hotel. Availability of this area is not always guaranteed especially in peak season times so it is best to phone ahead.

Powered sites and plumbing not available

properties.name: Dunleith Tourist Park
properties.description: Beautiful Absolute Waterfront Location

properties.name: Bar Beach
properties.description: Bar Beach is an inner city suburb of Newcastle, New South Wales, Australia, located 1.6 km southwest of Newcastle's central business district. The suburb is named for the beach that extends along its eastern border. The beach is home to the Cooks Hill Surf Life Saving Club as well as a lovely walk to the ANZAC memorial.

properties.name: Swansea Lakeside Holiday Park
properties.description: Swansea Lakeside Holiday Park is on the shores of Lake Macquarie.

properties.name: Narrabri Big Sky Caravan Park
properties.description:
Narrabri Big Sky Caravan Park is the ideal starting point for exploring everything the Narrabri Shire has to offer. Bushwalking, bird watching and water sports along with amazing natural wonders such as caves, hot bore baths and beautiful Mount Kaputar are popular with our guests. Whether you are hungy for adventure, or just want to relax and enjoy the sights, there's something to see and do for guests of all ages in Narrabri!
For the convenience of our guests, we provide a free BBQ area within our fully appointed camp kitchen. Our amenities are always clean and fresh and we offer full laundry facilities on-site as well.

properties.name: Murrurundi Caravan Park
properties.description:
Murrurundi Caravan Park is surrounded by breathtaking mountainous scenery - nestled at the base of the Liverpool range and the Great Dividing Range. Our location offers all sorts of sites, each designed with your convenience in mind. We cater for single travellers, couples and families, so there’s no reason to delay. Make your next booking today!

Our caravan park is conveniently situated an hour away from Tamworth and two and half hours from Newcastle on the New England Highway. In fact, we provide the perfect resting place before you hit The Big Smoke or the country music capital.

properties.name: Goulburn South Caravan Park
properties.description: Nearby in Goulburn and the surrounding highlands, there are plenty of activities to interest and entertain visitors of all ages.

properties.name: Coolah Caravan Park
properties.description: Coolah Caravan Park is situated in a picturesque setting with magnificent trees and the Coolaburragundy River along one boundary. The Park is known for its warmth, friendliness and peaceful atmosphere.

properties.name: Canobolas Caravan Park
properties.description: Canobolas Caravan Park is made up of 58 powered sites for vans and campervans, 22 unpowered tent sites, and 10 cabins.

properties.name: Johns River Community Hall and Recreation Reserve
properties.description: This newly opened, spacious and grassy rest area with good amenities is located in town. It is also home to many events, like markets and auctions. There is a great bush walk starting at the back and the site is suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Sandy Point Reserve
properties.description:
Large parking area at the S end of Hay, near Murrumbidgee River. Flush toilets, sheltered picnic tables and BBQs here. 

Entry via Brunker St. Use entry from Water St if you're in a large vehicle.

properties.name: Kiama North Rest Area
properties.description: This is a highway rest area located 5km N of Kiama. Disabled toilet, picnic table and rubbish bin facilities provided. Northbound entry only.

properties.name: Mt York Reserve
properties.description: A free campground mostly used by climbers. There are pit toilets and picnic tables, as well as nice lookouts around.

properties.name: Murphys Glen campground
properties.description: When it's time to swap the noise of the city for the sounds of the bush, pack up the car and head for Blue Mountains National Park. Rustic Murphys Glen campground, only a short drive from Sydney, is the perfect getaway for independent campers who like to escape the city for a weekend.Pitch the tent among the tall forest of blue gums and towering turpentines that surround this campsite. There's space for family and friends at this spacious campground. When you're ready to explore, a short walking track will take you through the turpentine and blue gum forests back up to Bedford Road.As the shadows lengthen, cook up a feast around the campfire and enjoy the sounds of the local nightlife with possums, sugar gliders and bats making a delightful racket.Take a virtual tour of Murphys Glen campground captured with Google Street View Trekker.

properties.name: Coraki Caravan Park
properties.description: The Richmond Valley’s landscape is diverse

properties.name: Tingha Gems Caravan Park
properties.description:
Tingha Gems Caravan Park is in the hamlet of Tingha, around 25km south of Inverell, known as the birthplace of tin mining in Australia.
Some of the best Quartz Crystal fossicking in Australia can be found at Tingha.
Park Manager Shaun conducts guided field trips for park guests as well as providing maps and equipment.
Gemstones/Old Wares/Visitor Info/Free WiFi are all available at our Office.

properties.name: Coral Tree Lodge Tourist Park
properties.description: Coral Tree Lodge is located 15kms east of Nowra

properties.name: West Wyalong Caravan Park
properties.description: The West Wyalong Caravan Park offers affordable accommodation in West Wyalong, New South Wales. Enjoy the excellent facilities, friendly atmosphere and first class service of this peaceful caravan park. The Park is ideal for a relaxed family or group holiday, and as a convenient stopover point.

properties.name: Queen Street Uralla Caravan Park
properties.description: The Uralla Caravan Park is located one block from the highway in a quiet area by the creek. It is a short stroll from the town centre and the Bowling Club. There are self contained ensuite cabins which sleep up to five people, and there are powered and unpowered grass camping sites.

properties.name: Nowra Showground
properties.description: There are a variety of sites available at Nowra Showground including meeting rooms for groups of 10 to 200, outdoor grassed areas as well as stables and camping facilities. Dogs allowed. There are no showers on-site for campers. Horse and cattle stables are available

properties.name: Lightning Ridge Holiday Park
properties.description:
WELCOME TO LIGHTNING RIDGE HOLIDAY PARK

The Lightning Ridge Holiday Park is one of the original caravan parks in Lightning Ridge located right in the centre of town. It’s just off the main roads so it’s very quiet, and within walking distance to a range of shops, galleries, cafes and the Lightning Ridge Bowling Club. The park is located next to the Aquatic Theme Park and Indoor Olympic Diving heated pool.

The Lightning Ridge Holiday Park offers a range of powered and unpowered caravan/camper sites, which cater for the largest of rigs and we are one of the only parks in town who have grassed tent sites.

properties.name: Cowra Van Park
properties.description: The Cowra Van Park is situated on the banks of the Lachlan River and is centrally located within a easy stroll of the main street, restaurants, pubs, clubs, supermarkets and attractions. The Park provides a variety of grassed and concrete slab sites both powered and unpowered, ensuite cabins with riverside camping available

properties.name: Brooms Head Holiday Park
properties.description:
Brooms Head really is a hidden treasure - its a beach hideaway that’s as perfect as anything you could imagine. The beaches are perfect for surfers, fishermen and families and the views from the headland are truly breathtaking.

The park is abs beachfront - you can’t get closer - with spacious hilltop cabins, beachfront camping and van sites and a friendly community atmosphere.

properties.name: Boomerang Way Tourist Park
properties.description: Boomerang Way Tourist Park

properties.name: Banana Coast Caravan Park
properties.description: Nestled amongst lush rain forest plants

properties.name: Cobargo Hotel Parking
properties.description: Sunny, north facing sealed parking. $10 per day for shower and toilet use. Friendly staff.

properties.name: Tenterfield Showground
properties.description: GPS is for entrance to showgrounds, dump poin is inside

properties.name: Flynns Beach Caravan Park
properties.description: Flynns Beach Caravan Park

properties.name: Nimbin Showgrounds
properties.description: Lovely relaxed atmosphere. Caretaker on site.  Nightly fee is $10pp. Clean amenities and Hot showers. Plenty of room. Dog friendly.

properties.name: Lilydale Camping Park
properties.description: Riverside camping area with no designated sites next to the the Lilydale Bridge. There is a toilet and fires are permitted (unless otherwise stated)

properties.name: Gateway Lifestyle Birubi Beach
properties.description: Gateway Lifestyle Birubi Beach is located at Anna Bay in the beautiful Port Stephens region.

properties.name: Barbour Park Rest Area
properties.description: Barbour Park is ideally situated in the township of Gunning next to the picturesque Meadow Creek. Barbour Park allows for free camping or a stopover for a maximum of two nights. Facilities include hot showers, toilets and free barbecues all within a short stroll to the two great cafes, hotel and specialty shops.

properties.name: Taree Service Centre
properties.description: Large rest area located by Caltex petrol station. There are toilets and showers and a big choice of fast food options. It can get quite noisy due to the non-stop traffic and trucks pulling in and out of the rest area.

properties.name: Wheogo Park
properties.description: Free rest stop at a park in Forbes, on the banks of the lake. Rubbish bins are the only facility, but it is a nice spot for fishing. Some shade from trees. Located on Junction St. Max stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Old Ford Reserve
properties.description: Shady rest area on the N side of Megalong Creek. Large grassy and sealed rest area with toilet and rubbsh bins available. Also a nice spot for swimming. Located on Megalong Valley Rd, 15km S of Blackheath. Signposted. Max stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Gundagai City Rest Stop
properties.description: Camp area in Gundagai, over the Yarri Bridge. For self-contained vehicles only. Maximum stay: 48h. No facilities, take your rubbish with you.

properties.name: Grey Gum Cafe
properties.description: Free camping at the cafe, suitable for tents, caravans and campervans. Toilets, showers, rubbish bins, tables and laundry facilities here. You have to pay for showers. You can also grab a bite to eat at the cafe.  Located on Putty Rd, 90km SW of Singleton. First 48hrs free, after that you have to pay a fee.

properties.name: Coledale Beach Camping Reserve
properties.description: Coledale beach camping reserve is a small and unique campsite.

properties.name: Coopernook Forest Park Camp Area
properties.description: This is a really nice campground. There is a large, well-mown grassy area that has plenty of open and shaded camping areas. There are non-flush toilets with disability access and rainwater tap. There is one sheltered picnic table. Open fires are permitted. You may stay for up to six weeks.

properties.name: Fossickers Rest Tourist Park
properties.description: Fossickers Rest Tourist Park is situated in a quiet location, away from all main roads.

properties.name: Mystery Bay Beach Campground
properties.description:
Mystery Bay campground fronts the ocean and is one of the few natural camping areas remaining on NSW’s south coast. It is only a short distance off the Princes Highway, but could be a million miles from anywhere.

The area is quite large with generous camp sites scattered throughout the native bush of mainly spotted gums, with acacias and banksias closer to the spectacular cliff headlands and small beaches.

There are cold showers, water taps and pit toilets.  All sites are unpowered, plenty of room for a boat, caravan or camper.

properties.name: Dorrigo Mountain Holiday Park
properties.description: Dorrigo Mountain Holiday Park at the gateway to the beautiful Dorrigo Plateau, surrounded by Heritage Listed National Parks is your destination where the mountains reach the sky. Scenic countryside views surround our landscaped park. Grassy campgrounds, shady trees and birdlife abounds. Enjoy a barbeque, sit and watch the sunset, or just relax in the shade taking in the views.

properties.name: Gulgong Tourist Park
properties.description: The Gulgong Tourist Park

properties.name: Durras Lake North Holiday Park
properties.description:
Just 20 minutes north of Batemans Bay, this holiday park is the perfect spot for your NSW South Coast holiday.  Whether you need a self contained cottage or cabin accommodation, or prefer to set up a campsite in the bushland camping ground, Durras North is the ideal location. Nestled in between Durras Lake and Durras Beach, it is surrounded by the Murramarang National Park and Batemans Marine Park. Perfect for swimming, surfing, fishing, kayaking, walking or just relaxing on the beach.

Durras North has the worlds only Kangaroo Guarantee. If you don’t see Kangaroos, you get a full refund – guaranteed! Other than Kangaroos, a wide range of other Australian wildlife may be seen including Parrots, Kookaburras, Possums, Dolphins and more.

properties.name: Holiday Haven Burrill Lake
properties.description: Holiday Haven Burrill Lake

properties.name: Holiday Haven Bendalong
properties.description: Holiday Haven Bendalong is the ideal location to escape it all.

properties.name: Holiday Haven Culburra Beach
properties.description: Holiday Haven Culburra Beach

properties.name: Holiday Haven Shoalhaven Heads
properties.description: Holiday Haven Shoalhaven Heads is bordered by Seven Mile Beach and the Shoalhaven River

properties.name: Khancoban Lakeside Caravan Park
properties.description: We are a pet friendly Caravan Park, located on over 6 acres of land with magnificent lake and snowy mountains views! Our picturesque location makes for an an ideal central base accommodation to explore Kosciuszko National Park and the surrounding high county region. Surrounded by stunning natures display there is much to see and do all year round.

properties.name: Coolac Cabins and Camping
properties.description: Located just 1.5 hours from Canberra, 1 hour from Wagga Wagga and 3.5 hours from Sydney, our 90 acre property is in close proximity to the towns of Tumut, Gundagai and Cootamundra. Enjoy the Murrumbidgee River just a short distance away, sit by our campfire under the stars or just take in the wildlife that rural NSW has to offer!

properties.name: Mullaway Beach Van & Holiday Park
properties.description: Mullaway Beach Tourist and Van park is nestled behing the dunes with paperparks offering plenty of shade, and a short walk to the beach.

properties.name: Hallidays Point Caravan Park
properties.description: Halliday’s Point Caravan Park is a family orientated Park. Catering for Caravans and Camping.
properties.town: Old Bar - Manning Point - Red Head

properties.name: Woolgoolga Headland Lookout
properties.description:
Woolgoolga Beach and Headland offer an exceptional setting for a day of family fun and exploration. This picturesque destination stands out as the ultimate spot for a memorable day out in the Coffs Region. 

Venturing here promises the most remarkable whale-watching experience in the entire Coffs Region, especially during the months from May to October. Woolgoolga Beach and Headland also cater to a variety of other activities, ensuring there's something for everyone to enjoy.

properties.name: Brolgaroo Caravan Park
properties.description: Great small park, clubs and town within walking distance. Suitable for large rigs ( limited sites). Nice grassy sites sparkling pool spotless amenities managers Reg and Di are very helpful. This is one park you will return to. Weekly rates available by prior arrangement

properties.name: Temora Free Camp
properties.description: Non-powered parking for caravans and RVs on sealed roadways.

properties.name: CMCA Nyngan Van Park
properties.description: Relax and unwind at CMCA Nyngan Van Park NSW. Affordable rates, beautiful surroundings and amenities for a comfortable stay. Book your site today!

properties.name: Dunbogan Caravan Park
properties.description: Dunbogan Caravan Park is in the heart of Dunbogan, on the Camden Haven River, on the Mid North Coast of NSW.  You have pristine waterways, swimming beaches, and nature walks at your fingertips. Enjoy your peaceful stay with us under the breathtaking view of North Brother Mountain.

properties.name: Lake Lyell Recreation Park
properties.description:
Lake Lyell is situated on the outskirts of Lithgow approximately 2 and a half hours from Sydney. It was originally built in 1982 by Delta Electricity for the Mount Piper and Wallerawang Power Stations. The capacity is 34500MI, surface area 238ha, with the maximum water depth at 38m.

Facilities include kiosk, boat ramp, amenities block with hot showers, toilets, disabled toilet, covered BBQ area, kayak hire, picnic benches, park, designated swimming area, powered and non-powered camping sites suitable for vans, tents, camping trailers, caravans and motorhomes.

properties.name: Lantern Apartments
properties.description: The Lantern Thredbo Apartments are located in the heart of Thredbo VIllage.  With  spectacular mountain views, full kitchens, laundries all the comforts of home  including free wifi  the Lantern is a great choice for a Thredbo stop over.
properties.fees: From $145 to  $450 per night depending on the length of stay and apartment size

properties.name: Urunga Waters
properties.description:
This park is perfect for families, overnight stays and travellers of all ages. We hope you enjoy your holiday whether it be a short stay or a getaway Urunga Waters Tourist Park is the ideal place for you to visit. Stop and take the time out to absorb the surroundings and great atmosphere. 
Come stay relax and enjoy!

properties.name: Gilgandra Caravan Park
properties.description:
Welcome to Gilgandra Caravan Park in Central NSW. Enjoy and relax in our park land setting. Our shady park offers drive through powered and unpowered sites for overnight or longer stays as well as a selection of cabins with differing layouts.

Powered sites are large and shady with town water and sullage. All sites are drive through with easy access so you can stay hitched for an easy departure. Some sites have slabs.
Unpowered Sites are level and shady. Sites are close to the amenities and next to the camp kitchen with includes BBQ, microwave, toaster and kettle.
properties.fees: Powered Sites	$33.00	Unpowered Sites	$25.00Extra Adult$10.00	Extra child $7.00

properties.name: Glenwood Tourist Park and Motel
properties.description: Glenwood Tourist Park is a relaxed friendly park set in tranquil grounds with a sparkling pool, minutes away from Grafton.

properties.name: Gundagai Cabins & Tourist Park
properties.description: Home of the famous Undercover Drive Through Caravan Sites.

properties.name: Finley Lakeside Caravan Park
properties.description: Our park behind the council swimming pool has direct access to the lake for Fishing, Kayaks, and Sailing.

properties.name: Bushlands Tourist Park
properties.description: Bushlands Tourist Park (also known as Windeyer Caravan Park) lies beside the rich gold bearing Long Creek in the historic village of Windeyer, in the picturesque hills of Central West NSW. Situated on six acres, visitors can relax under leafy shade trees in this tranquil grassy haven and enjoy watching the abundant bird life and local native animals.

properties.name: Mudgee Riverside Caravan & Tourist Park
properties.description: Whatever you need - a tent site down by the river, caravan site or self cater, self contained cedar cabins or villa, Riverside is an ideal base while you discover the delights of the Mudgee Region.

properties.name: Laniakea Rainforest Camping
properties.description:
Laniakea is a rainforest camping ground set right on the edge of the world heritage Nightcap National Park. Each camp site is privately set in the forest.
The road in can be a little bumpy and two wheel drives towing a trailer may find it a little slippery in particularly wet conditions.
Laniakea has an amazing variety of wildlife and this combined with the peace and tranquility of the forest makes for an unforgettable stay.
Please BYO your own water needs for drinking and for use in the provided camp shower.
Please also take all your rubbish with you as Laniakea does not have a rubbish service.

Rules:

Please don't make a camp fire until you have talked to staff as sometimes there is a total fire ban in affect. Also please don't collect wood from the environment other than 2-3cm max diameter thickness kinderling, solid chunk sustainable collected firewood is available for purchase. Please please dont feed the wildlife, its not fun having a Goanna trying to get into your tent at 3am for desert. :-P Please talk to staff before going on a walk as Nightcap national park is huge and if you get lost we may never find you.

properties.name: Young Tourist Park
properties.description: Our well-maintained and friendly campground is conveniently located

properties.name: Tiona Holiday Park
properties.description: Tiona Holiday Park

properties.name: Dorrigo Showgrounds
properties.description: Basic show ground camping for self contained vehicles. Please contact the Dorrigo Ray White office to book in. Powered and unpowered sites available. $10-$25 per vehicle per night.

properties.name: Sandbar Caravan Park
properties.description: Sandbar Caravan Park

properties.name: Coachstop Caravan Park
properties.description: We offer affordable comfort in our well kept cabins and drive thru sites.

properties.name: Sunrise Caravan Park
properties.description: Sunrise Caravan Park is a family operated tourist park that is located in the heart of a rural sugar cane farming community. Our Prices for accommodation are well suited for Backpackers and families on a Budget. Evans Head is only a short 10 minute drive away and only 25 minutes from Ballina.
properties.fees: Tent Site (low) $20 (high) $25; Powered Sites (low) $25 (high) $35 per night for 1-2 ppl, extra person $5.50

properties.name: Riverside Caravan Park
properties.description: Set on the edge of the beautiful Hastings River at Port Macquarie, the Aquatic @ Port Macquarie Complex offers the very best in location and Leisure. Perfect for your next family holiday! Features include: Resort Style Pool, BBQ area, Children's playground, Jetty and Boat Ramp, WIFI (Charges apply). Café Onsite Open Breakfast and Lunch.
properties.fees: Powered Site (off season) $30.00 (high season) $40.00 per night 1-2 people

properties.name: Lawrence Tavern
properties.description: Ask the ladies behind the bar about camping at the back of the pub. Lovely meals inside and cosy atmosphere. Facilities basic, but all right.

properties.name: Symbio Wildlife Park
properties.description:
Book your tickets online here to visit the Symbio Wildlife Park in South Sydney to meet and interact with Australian and exotic animals! Just 40 minutes drive from Sydney Airport- Symbio Wildlife Park has 16 acres of manicured gardens and spacious grounds that are home to native Koalas, Kangaroos, Alligators, a range of reptiles and exotic Cheetahs, Lemurs, Red Pandas, Meerkats and small Monkeys.

Cuddle up to a Koala, hold an Alligator or snake (additional cost), hand feed and pat kangaroos in the Kangaroo Walk-Through Area, head to the Barn to feed and interact with all your farmyard favourites, or attend one of several interactive wildlife shows throughout the day.

If you have children, then make sure you bring their Swimmers during the warmer months as Symbio has just opened a brand new Splash Park, complete with Dump Buckets, Water Squirters, Snake Water Tunnel, Fountains and so much more.

Symbio Wildlife Park is the ideal day trip from Sydney with plenty of outdoor green spaces and areas for picnics, has a Splash Park and large Playground along with being just a few minutes drive from the gorgeous Beaches, the Royal National Park, the famous Bald Hill Look-out and Sea-Cliff Bridge.

Purchase your Sydney Symbio Wildlife Park entrance tickets online here.

​It's​ just a short walk from the main street of Rylstone, making it very easy to go and enjoy the small town shopping atmosphere, with a Butcher, Baker, Service Station, IGA, Foodworks, Home, Timber & Hardware, The Lollipop Shop, Pubs and Clubs, a Veterinarian Surgery, Cafes and many other interesting shops that might just tickle your fancy!

A short drive from the many natural beauties in the area such as Fern Tree Gully, Glen Davis, Dunns Swamp, Glen Alice, The Capertee Valley and the Bylong Valley​​​.

We have Camp Kitchen and Laundromat Facilities available as well as 29 sites, most of which have power. Some with drive through access, plenty of room for large vans and motorhomes.

The Rainforest Gateway Caravan Park is located at the junction of Grady's and Cedargetters Creek on the Lions Road in the Border Ranges of Northern New South Wales, with an abundance of unique bird species, large old growth trees and a strict policy for peace and quiet. 
The Park features grassy powered sites, access to Grady’s Creek, great views with an amenities block with hot showers, basins, flush toilets and laundry. Comfortable holiday units also available and a cottage. There are camp sites, (powered & unpowered) and an on site caravan. You will need to bring your own sheets and towels (though other bedding is supplied) and because of it’s remoteness, bring ALL you own food supplies.

NO EFTPOS available so please have cash for payments.
AS THE PARK IS OWNED/MANAGED BY A SEMI-RETIRED COUPLE, WHO TRAVEL A LOT THEMSELVES
properties.fees: Unpowered sites $28 family; powered $30 family; 1 x onsite caravan $35 per family; Units (sleeps 5) $60; Cottage (sleeps 5) $70

properties.name: Coolah Tops National Park Camping

Gazetted as a National Park in 1996, Coolah Tops covers 12,117 hectares on a narrow plateau of the Liverpool Ranges. The area is very scenic, boasting several waterfalls and lookouts offering spectacular views over the adjacent plains.

properties.name: Colour City Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Colour City Caravan Park, located next to the historic Orange Showground, is in walking distance from the CBD. The park offers a range of accommodation options to suit travellers. We have powered sites, some with easy drive through access sites.

Our park is a beautiful, well-maintained recreational area surrounded by lush trees and lovely amenities. We are proud to offer pet-friendly accommodation, with the requirement that all pets be kept on a leash at all times and not permitted in any of our cabins or amenities.

For those seeking a cozy home-away-from-home, we have a stunning three-bedroom cottage available. Additionally, we have 15 fully self-contained cabins for your comfort and convenience.

Come and enjoy a relaxing stay with us at the Colour City Caravan Park!

properties.name: Cockatoo Island Camping

Cockatoo Island camping is a world first - a waterfront campsite in the midst of a city. It is a campsite on a national heritage-listed island in the middle of the world's most beautiful harbour.

properties.name: Cobar Caravan Park and Motel

From here it is just a short drive to beaches, shopping centres, and Tweed clubs.

They offer full service to the casual camper, caravanner, day skier, or those requiring a weekend getaway.

A little over an hour drive from the centre of Sydney.

properties.name: Canton Beach Waterfront Tourist Park

Situated on the Mid North Coast of New South Wales, 380 km’s north of Sydney, 580 km’s south of Brisbane, Breckenridge Farmstay is an enlightening, educational and fun experience for the entire family.

Breckenridge Farmstay is a 100 acre working farm with cattle, chickens, bird aviaries and an abundance of wildlife. For those of you who love the outdoors check out our golf driving range, swimming pool, BBQ area, children’s playground, feed the animals, and warm up areas for sporting groups.

Breckenridge Farmstay is an ideal place to stay and experience a working farm, as a short getaway or as a base to access the many activities and tourism attractions available to visitors in the region.
