properties.description: Situated on the picturesque Murray River

properties.name: Binacrombi
properties.description: Situated on the Abercrombie River

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Harrington Beach
properties.description:
Nestled near kilometres of pristine and secluded surf breaks and spectacular beaches sits Discovery Parks, Harrington. Here is a perfect coastal getaway and fisherman’s paradise all year round. 

To experience our region’s natural beauty, look no further: the Crowdy Bay National Park is right next door with lookouts, walking tracks, picnic spots and native wildlife.

With our park just under an hour from Port Macquarie and a half hour from Diamond Head, the region is a bountiful place to explore.

properties.name: Belmont Lakeside Holiday Park
properties.description: Experience the breathtaking views and relaxing island-like atmosphere.

properties.name: Bellinger River Tourist Park
properties.description: Bellinger River Tourist Park offers a variety of accommodation options to suit your holiday needs with powered and unpowered caravan and camping sites and waterfront sites accommodating all types of camper trailers, caravans and motor homes

properties.name: Bellhaven Caravan Park
properties.description: With it's relaxing atmosphere and prime highway location, you'll soon discover why Bellhaven Caravan Park has everything you'll need, any time of year.

properties.name: Barham Caravan & Tourist Park
properties.description: Nestled beside the Murray River in a natural bushland setting

properties.name: Balranald Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Balranald Caravan Park is situated on the banks of the Murrumbidgee River with an entrance easily accessible from the Sturt Highway in Balranald at the eastern end of town. 

The Caravan Park has deluxe, standard and basic cabins as well as drive through grass powered caravan sites and spacious grassed camp site.

properties.name: Ballina Waterfront Village & Tourist Park
properties.description: Ballina Waterfront Village

properties.name: Avalon River Retreat
properties.description: Rest body and soul at Avalon River Retreat - a peaceful oasis on the banks of the Ellenborough River. Get away from the rat race and relax in their beautiful cedar self-contained cabin overlooking the main river flat, where cows, alpacas and horses forage and roam.

properties.name: Artisans Park
properties.description:
Set high overlooking the back of the Blue Mountains is one of Australia's most unique farm stays a genuine red 1949 London double decker bus. This bus has featured on Better Homes and Gardens television in 2013 and in many magazines shoots. 
Artisans Park is just a three-hour drive from Sydney over the Blue Mountains and, at 1000 metres, experiences winter snow and mild summers.

properties.name: Ariah Park Camping Ground
properties.description: Just 34 kilometres west of Temora, Ariah Park Camping Ground is situated in a quiet picturesque area.

properties.name: South Coast Retreat
properties.description: South Coast Retreat at Greenwell Point NSW is an idyllic holiday spot just 2 hours from both Sydney and Canberra. Our retreat is situated on over an acre of landscaped grounds overlooking the tip of Greenwell Point. There are exceptional experiences awaiting you right on our doorstep.

properties.name: Albury All Seasons Tourist Park
properties.description: Albury All Seasons Tourist Park, situated on Wagga Road (old hume highway) only 1km to Lavington shopping complex.

properties.name: Airport Tourist Park
properties.description:
The Airport Tourist Park offers self-contained cabins, caravans, powered and unpowered sites catering for all accommodation needs and budgets, ensuring a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Whether your visit is for business, leisure or you're a grey nomad they'd love to see you soon!

properties.name: Myall River Camp
properties.description: Clean riverside campsite with basic facilities (pit toilet). Swimming and fishing can be done in the area. Onsite caretakers will come around to collect camp fees.

properties.name: Boorowa Caravan Park
properties.description: The Boorowa Caravan Park offers relaxing, shaded, riverside camping centrally located to the towns’ shops. Facilities include an amenities block with communal showers, barbecue facilities and a public telephone. Advanced booking is recommended during festival dates.

properties.name: Outback View Holiday Park
properties.description:
Outback View Broken Hill Caravan Park  is located 3km n the east side of town, where the town meets the outback with splendid views of the sunrise and sunset.  Quite and relaxing location where you can listen to the sounds of the native birds, may even see a Lizards, Kangaroos and Emus.  We have all types of accommodation to suit all types of guests.  Caravan, Motor Homes, Campervan, tents, swags and camper trailers.
Unpowered, Powered and Private Ensuite Sites.

properties.name: Batlow Caravan Park
properties.description: Batlow Caravan Park is situated conveniently along the banks of Reedy Creek, a short distance from the town centre. Powered and un-powered sites are available. Call for current rates and bookings.

properties.name: Barraba Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Barraba Caravan Park is set on 3.1 acres located on the Fossicker's Way. The Park is bounded by the Manilla River and is located directly opposite the Barraba Bowling Club.

At Barraba Caravan Park there are many sites available which are designed to accommodate caravans, campers, mobile homes and even buses. A number of our powered sites are "drive-thru" sites, which makes parking your van or camper a breeze.

properties.name: Mann River Caravan Park
properties.description:
Visit Mann River Caravan Park, for perfect rest and tranquillity. Soak up the mountain and river atmosphere of Jackadgery. 



Mann River Caravan Park has the closest accommodation to some of Australia's most famous and beautiful National Parks.

properties.name: Dunedoo Caravan Park
properties.description: Dunedoo Caravan Park offers onsite vans, cabins, powered and unpowered grassy campsites with clean amenities, as well as easy laundry access. The caravan park is located 600 metres west of Dunedoo town centre on the Golden Highway, where you can enjoy a picnic under the mature trees in the lovely landscaped recreation area of OL Milling Park. It features a safe playground area, with a sheltered barbecue and amenities.

properties.name: Delegate Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Delegate Caravan Park is located in a quiet riverside location at the Bill Jeffrey's Memorial Park and is just a pleasant stroll from town. 

The facilities on offer include a clean amenities block, playground equipment and picnic area. 

Watch the platypus or read a book by the river and enjoy the peace and...

properties.name: Hume Park Tourist Resort
properties.description: Hume Park Tourist Resort is a beautiful family orientated tourist park and ski resort on the Murrumbidgee River, nestled at the top of Burrinjuck Dam with barbecue and picnic facilities for day visitors, and a well-maintained camping ground for those who want to stay longer. There are three on site, fully self-conta...

properties.name: Broadwater Stopover Tourist Park
properties.description:
Often voted the best value for money, and earning a fabulous reputation for it's cleanliness and the warm welcome you receive when visiting. Set in one of the most beautiful parts of Australia with never ending lush green grass.

Experience the peacefulness of the Koala Sanctuary walking tracks, adjoining the tourist park. You may even see a koala or two.

A range of fully self-contained modern Deluxe En Suite and Standard Cabins are available.

Also available are shady grass or concrete powered sites (some drive through).

Swimming pool, barbecues, very clean amenities, and disabled facilities.

properties.name: Tyndale Tourist Park & Roadhouse
properties.description: Located off the Pacific Highway
properties.fees: powered sites are $30/night for up to 2 people (extra persons are $6.00/person/night) and unpowered sites are $25.00/night for up to 2 persons (extra persons are $6.00/person/night)

properties.name: Cudgegong Waters Caravan Park
properties.description: Located on the edge of Windamere Dam, Cudgegong Waters Caravan Park offers a great campsite for those who love outdoor water activities.  Local attractions include swimming, fishing, waterskiing, and canoeing.  Powered campsites are suitable for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and campervans. There are also cabins for hire. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, picnic area, drinking water and dump point. There is a restaurant, kiosk, petrol and groceries available. During the peak season it is advised to make a booking.

properties.name: Glenreagh Recreation Reserve
properties.description: Located on the Orara Way, Glenreagh Recreation Reserve offers powered and unpowered sites for tents and caravans. Facilities are limited. On site there are toilets, showers, picnic tables and drinking water.

properties.name: Bungendore Showground
properties.description: Bungendore showground camping area offers casual camping with powered sites for caravans and tents. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, mobile phone coverage, and drinking water. 14 day maximum stay. There is a caretaker on site to collect camping fees.

properties.name: Bombala Caravan Park
properties.description: Located beside the beautiful Bombala River

properties.name: Ashford Caravan Park
properties.description: Ashford Caravan Park is located in NSW. It is a well maintained camping site with 24 camping areas suitable for tents, caravans and motorhomes. There are powered sites available. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities, toilets, showers, drinking water and access to a swimming pool.

properties.name: Bigga Recreation Ground
properties.description:
Bigga Recreation Ground is located between Goulburn and Cowra, near the foreshores of Grabine Lakeside State Park, on the north-eastern shores of Lake Wyangla Dam. It is situated in the centre of a small, quiet country village. 

The recreation ground has flat, unpowered sites, and drive through camp sites. Plenty of shady trees to sit under. Amenities include disabled toilet and hot showers. 

Sites are available with up to three nights free. The General Store is open seven days per week for groceries, fuel, newspapers, takeaway food and much more.

The Federal Hotel is open seven days offering counter meals and cold beer on tap and a bottle shop. 

The Golf Club is open Friday and Saturday nights offering snack bar, cold beer, internet access, nine hole golf course, tennis and much more.

properties.name: Jugiong Memorial Park
properties.description: From the highway, take the Jugiong exit then follow the rest area signs. Area with picnic tables on grass, BBQ, kids playground, toilets and rubbish bins. Large camping area into the park. Drinkable water and dump station available. No dogs allowed. Maximum stay 7days, donations appreciated.

properties.name: Budderoo National Park Camping
properties.description: This is a beautiful National Park tent only camping site (six sites, with a maximum of five people per site) about 10 minutes drive from Carrington Falls. Camping is by reservation only, telephone 48877270 or visit the Fitzroy Falls visitors Center. National park fees apply: $10 for the first two adults 16 years and older, $3 for 5 to 15-year-old children and under five-year-olds are free. There is a two-week maximum stay. See http://www.nationalparks.nsw.gov.au/camping-and-accommodation There are level tent sites spread amongst shady trees, each with a picnic table. There are non-flush toilets with a disability access and ramp and non-potable hand washing water, and one large sheltered picnic table.

properties.name: Mudgee Showground
properties.description: This is a little campsite in the showground. $29 with power. There are good showers with toilets but no disability access nearby, rubbish and recycling and the dump station next to the toilet block.

properties.name: Premer Lions Park Camping
properties.description: A donation ($7) is requested to stay at this well set up camping place. There is a flat grassy area amongst shaded trees. There are rubbish bins, sheltered picnic tables, barbecue pits, water and flush toilets (one with wheelchair access). Power is available for $12 per night.

properties.name: The Hamptons Free Caravan Parking
properties.description: Camp behind the pub. This is a simple grassy area without facilities other than those of the pub. It is free but powered sites cost $15, showers are $5.

properties.name: Dalys Clearing Campground Belanglo State Forest
properties.description: Camp Area in the Belanglo State Forest. From Hwy quit on Belanglo rd for 4km, then turn on Dalys Rd for 900m. Large areas with many trees. There are toilets and few picnic tables.  No bins, take your rubbish with you.

properties.name: Tuena Camping and Picnic Ground
properties.description:
The Tuena Camping and Picnic Ground  is a lovely flat spot along the babbling creek in the Historic village of Tuena. The camping and picnic grounds include an amenities block, barbecue, potable water, covered tables and is pet friendly.

Tuena is an old gold mining town. Fossickers still try their luck in Tuena creek or at the Abercrombie River a short drive to the north.

Pop into the local Parsons General Store for payment for your overnight stay and for information about fossicking. The Goldfields Inn is closed but it is the oldest Wattle and Daub pub in Australia.
properties.fees: Pricing: $5.00 to $10.00. Subject to change and availability

properties.name: Scrubby Creek Forest Picnic Area  (Possibly Closed)
properties.description: Dirt road in, slippery when wet, SC and non-SC. Toilets, covered picnic tables and fireplaces. Clean water from tap.

properties.name: Molong Showgrounds
properties.description: Check in with camp host.

properties.name: Tweed Holiday Parks Kingscliff Beach
properties.description: Tweed Holiday Parks Kingscliff Beach is situated absolute beachfront in the heart of Kingscliff, just metres from an array of cafes, boutique stores, and the iconic Kingscliff Beach Hotel.

properties.name: Milparinka Heritage Walk
properties.description: A walk around the outback township of Milparinka reveals many of its secrets. The ruins of former homes, shops, bus stops, hotels, churches, and schools in Milparinka are a reminder of the town's past as a thriving community in the 1880s and 1890s. They also tell the story of the harshness of the outback environment and the challenges that the early settlers faced.

properties.name: Tweed Holiday Parks Kingscliff North
properties.description: Small and friendly, Tweed Holiday Parks Kingscliff North is the perfect cosy beachfront holiday destination .

properties.name: The Sporties Mini Golf
properties.description: This brand new mini golf course in Barooga will challenge and entertain. Pick up some clubs at the club house and see who can take out the podium!

properties.name: Town Beach
properties.description: A short walk from Tocumwal is a spectacular river beach, grab a coffee from The Fifth Daughter or The Wall Cafe in town and then make your way down to Town Beach with a picnic to laze the day away.

properties.name: CMCA RV Park Temora
properties.description: Affordable RV camping in Temora!  Level sites, water, dump point, firepit, and friendly caretaker. Pet-friendly too

properties.name: Gulpa Retreat Tourist Park
properties.description:
Gulpa Retreat Tourist Park: Your Nature Escape in Mathoura, NSW. 

Escape the hustle and bustle and reconnect with nature at Gulpa Retreat Tourist Park, a peaceful getaway in Mathoura, NSW.  This scenic park offers a variety of accommodation options to suit your needs, from deluxe cabins and powered caravan sites to a glamping tent.

Unwind in comfort and style in our deluxe cabins.  Perfect for families or groups, offering spacious interiors and balconies with stunning views.
Powered caravan sites: Ideal for those travelling with their own caravan or RV.
Glamping tents experience the best of both worlds with a touch of luxury in a fully-equipped tent.

Enjoy the park's tranquil location, surrounded by lush greenery and abundant birdlife.
Take a leisurely bush walk or go fishing in the nearby Gulpa Creek.
Explore the wonders of the Murray Valley National Park, located right on the park's doorstep.

Make use of the park's clean and well-maintained amenities, including camp kitchen, showers, and toilets.
Enjoy the peace and quiet of the park's surrounds, perfect for a relaxing escape.

properties.name: The Coleambally Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Coleambally Caravan Park your Tranquil Escape in Coleambally, NSW.

Experience the serenity of Coleambally at The Coleambally Caravan Park. Our park is a perfect stopover for budget-conscious travelers seeking a comfortable and relaxing escape in the heart of the Riverina region.

We offer a variety of powered and unpowered sites to suit all needs and budgets. Whether you're travelling by caravan, trailer, tent or campervan, we have the perfect spot for you to set up camp and unwind amidst the beauty of nature.

properties.name: The Palms at Avoca
properties.description:
Escape to a Subtropical Paradise at The Palms at Avoca.

Amongst palm trees and vibrant gardens on the Central Coast of NSW, The Palms at Avoca offers a idyllic family-friendly retreat just a 5-minute drive from stunning Avoca Beach.

Choose from a variety of self-contained cabin styles, including two-bedroom cabanas and villas, or the modern Le Chateau, perfect for couples.  Unwind by the resort-style swimming pools, relax in the heated spa, or have fun with the kids at the playground.  In the evenings, gather around the BBQ area for a delicious cookout under the stars.

properties.name: Bindara Station
properties.description:
Experience Outback Hospitality at Bindara on the Darling.

Escape the ordinary and discover Bindara on the Darling, a unique outback farmstay experience nestled on the banks of the Darling River in outback NSW, Australia.

Located between Menindee and Pooncarie, ideally situated for exploring Mungo, Kinchega and Mootwingee National Parks, Bindara offers a genuine taste of country life.

Your hosts, the Arnold family, invite you to unwind and experience the beauty of the outback. Explore the historic homestead and surrounds, abundant birdlife and native wildlife. Canoe the Darling River, go fishing or yabbying, or simply relax and soak up the serenity of the outback landscape.

Bindara on the Darling offers comfortable accommodation options including cottages, shearers’ quarters and campsites, all nestled on the picturesque riverbank.  Enjoy delicious meals featuring fresh, local produce, much of it grown on the property itself.

For an unforgettable outback adventure, look no further than Bindara on the Darling.

properties.name: River Haven Tourist Park
properties.description:
River Haven Tourist Park: Your Perfect Escape in Tomakin, New South Wales

Relax and unwind at River Haven Tourist Park, a family-friendly caravan park ideally situated in Tomakin, New South Wales. Close to the pristine beaches of Broulee and Batemans Bay, our park offers a tranquil escape ideal for both short getaways and extended stays.

Unwind by the idyllic shores of the Clyde River or explore the natural wonders of nearby national parks and attractions. Whether you prefer camping under the stars or enjoying the comfort of our cabins, River Haven Tourist Park caters to all tastes and budgets.

Our park boasts a range of amenities to make your stay enjoyable, including a sparkling swimming pool, spacious RV sites, pet-friendly accommodation, a camp kitchen, BBQ facilities, a children's playground, and more.

properties.name: Venice Caravan Park
properties.description:
Escape to Venice Caravan Park in Hartley, NSW

Venice Caravan Park is your perfect escape in Hartley, a charming village located near Lithgow in the Blue Mountains region of New South Wales. Whether you’re seeking a relaxing weekend getaway or an extended adventure, our park offers a range of powered and unpowered campsites to suit all budgets and camping styles.

Unwind amidst scenic surrounds and enjoy the comfort of our amenities, including spacious drive-through sites, modern camp kitchens, clean amenities blocks, and laundry facilities.  Venice Caravan Park is also pet-friendly, so your furry companions can join in on the fun.

properties.name: Red Tree Theatre
properties.description:
The Red Tree Theatre offers the Central Coast community a creative, flexible space to present performances, speakers and ideas. 

Over the past three years, the venue has become a popular destination for community members, with over 10,000 visitors annually. It is a welcoming, relaxed space where people can come together to share their interests and passions, address community issues, and foster creativity.

properties.name: Lucky Country Leisure Park
properties.description: Set in tranquil surroundings, this peaceful, leafy park is centrally located  400m from the CBD with Byron Bay, Nimbin, Lennox Head and more within 40 mins drive. Affordable, relaxing with continued improvement as we recover from the devastating floods

properties.name: Goolgowi Caravan Parks
properties.description: Council run caravan park offers powered and unpowered sites contact the council or service man’s club for payment and codes

properties.name: Murrumbidgee Valley Campgrounds
properties.description: Bookings are required. Book online or call the National Parks Contact Centre on 1300 072757. You can only set up camp in the designated campground.

properties.name: Beach Campground
properties.description: Beach campground is a secluded camping area on the river. Accessible only by water, its a tranquil setting far away from the crowds with a lovely, postcard-perfect beach. It makes for a picturesque picnic spot, and a remote riverside setting to pitch a tent for the night.Pull up your kayak or canoe, anchor your boat, and find a spot under the trees. Wander down to the sandy beach and enjoy a refreshing swim in the calm waters of the river. Or spread a blanket and relax with a good book while you watch the kids play in the water.Throw in a fishing line, relax and continue to take in the beautiful surroundings. You might catch a glimpse of a sea eagle in the distance, or a group of waterbirds by the shoreline.After a peaceful nights rest by the river, head home feeling refreshed and recharged.

properties.name: Four Mile Trail Campground - Eucumbene River
properties.description:
Camp on the crystal clear waters of Eucumbene Rver, surrounded by granite boulders and snowgrass. 

You can discover stunning sub-alpine landscapes, enjoy wildlife encounters or take a walk along one of the many tracks and trails in northern Kosciuszko National Park.

There's no winter road access between the June and October long weekends and it is a 2WD, dry weather only access or 4WD wet weather access. Extreme weather conditions can sometimes result in road closures.

There are no toilet, picnic tables or other facilities at this campground.

Bookings are required. Book online or call.

properties.name: Sandy Beach Campground
properties.description: Tucked away on the bend of a sweeping river beach, Sandy Beach campground is a popular spot for Riverina locals to fish, swim and boat on the weekend. With great facilities and easy access from Leeton and Narrandera, stay a couple of days exploring Murrumbidgee Valley National Park.Theres a boat ramp at Markeys Beach where you can launch your boat and enjoy the river from a different perspective. Look up to see koalas resting against the trunks of the majestic river red gums and spot the bright greens and yellows of the threatened superb parrot as it darts between the trees. At dusk, relax by the campfire as wallabies, kangaroos and emus come down to the river to drink.If youre looking for a bit of adventure, go 4WDing or mountain biking along Forest Drive. This scenic 16km journey is a great way to explore the park and there are plenty of spots to fish, swim and enjoy a picnic along the way. At the end of the drive youll find Turkey Flat trail which is a cycling trail that loops through the habitats of native woodland and wetland birds.

properties.name: Halls Peak Campground And Picnic Area
properties.description: If you really love getting as far away as possible from civilisation, then Halls Peak campground and picnic area is about as rugged and remote as you can get. Accessed on a dirt track that will test your driving skills, youll arrive deep in the heart of the wild gorge country of New England.If youre lucky you might have the place to yourself, with your only neighbours the wallabies and bandicoots. Cook your catch over a woodfire barbecue and then settle in for an evening round the campfire.When youre not relaxing, theres plenty to keep you active; swimming, fishing and canoeing will get you into the wilderness frame of mind, and youll soon forget what stress feels like.

properties.name: Illaroo Group Camping Area
properties.description: Illaroo group camping area, which offers simple and convenient online booking, is the ideal campground for groups of 16 to 35 looking for an exclusive camping experience. A gated area with easy pin code access means that all youll need to remember when heading to the beach is your surfboard, sunscreen and snacks for breaks between waves.Perfect for families and friends, Illaroo group camping area is a great place to meet for an affordable coastal holiday near Grafton.  Youll want to pack boogie boards, surfboards and your swimmers as theyll all be put to good use here. Make sure you take your fishing rod to catch your dinner from the beach, which you can cook up on your own gas barbecue.Wooli and Grafton are nearby, so if youve not managed to make the catch of the day, you can venture into town to stock up on supplies.If youd like to stay in the general area of Illaroo campground, check out the Illaroo campground page.

properties.name: Deniliquin Visitor Information Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: The Oyster Shed
properties.description:
Relax and enjoy farm fresh oysters, great local produce and the best river views around at The Oyster Shed. 

The Tweed coast is famous for seafood, and 'The Shed' offers a menu that features local favourites as well as seasonal specials.

Also serving up cold beers, a hand-picked selection of wines, and a fresh take on classic cocktails.

properties.name: Tumut Valley Holiday Park
properties.description:
Tumut Valley Holiday Park is a quiet, leafy, relaxed family park overlooking lush farmland and the Tumut River. Tumut is situated at the northern end of the Snowy Mountains, and is particularly attractive during the autumn when the thousands of poplars and deciduous trees erupt into rich colours.

The park has 76 sites and all but 20 of these are powered. The park is pet friendly. Resident Managers are Mary and Ron.

properties.name: BridgeClimb Sydney
properties.description: BridgeClimb Sydney is an iconic Australian experience that takes you on a journey to the top of the nation's most famous and celebrated structure, the Sydney Harbour Bridge. As you ascend to the Summit of the world's largest steel arch, you'll experience breathtaking moments, spectacular 360-degree views, and fascinating facts from expert Climb Leaders into the engineering and cultural history of this world-famous icon, while keeping you safe and entertained along the way.

properties.name: Stonepine Ridge
properties.description: Beautiful and private camping spots by the river, in the bush and with some beautiful views.  Your accommodation is a modern space with a separate shower, toilet and wash basin. The bedroom is separate from the sitting and dining area, and there is a small kitchen area that provides you with all the essentials.  We also offer pet friendly camping on select areas of the property.

properties.name: Tall Timbers Caravan Park Kempsey
properties.description:
Tall Timbers Kempsey caravan park is in a beautiful natural park setting with lots of open space and large trees. We have multiple spacious overnight lots including budget cabins & caravans for short and long term stays. Lynn and Kevin are our very friendly staff who will meet you on arrival and look after you while you stay.
Opposite the golf course and a stones throw to Slim Dusty Centre. Crescent Head beach is only 15 minutes away and 30 minutes from South West Rocks and Smokey Cape Light House.

properties.name: Sunset Caravan Park Woolgoolga
properties.description:
Sunset Caravan Park Woolgoolga: Your Relaxing Escape on the NSW Coast.

Escape to Sunset Caravan Park Woolgoolga, a peaceful retreat nestled between Woolgoolga Creek and the charming town center. Our park offers a variety of comfortable accommodation options, from powered and unpowered caravan sites to cozy cabins and spacious holiday units.

Relax and unwind in our sparkling swimming pool, surrounded by landscaped gardens. Enjoy a family BBQ in our camp kitchen, or take a short stroll to Woolgoolga's pristine beaches, patrolled for your safety. Explore the town's vibrant cafes, shops, and award-winning restaurants, all within easy walking distance.

Sunset Caravan Park Woolgoolga is your perfect base for exploring the beauty of the NSW North Coast.

properties.name: Merriwa Caravan Park
properties.description: Small site in the town of Merriwa lovely back drop of the river a small walk into town for a meal. Brand new toilets and laundry for campers. Power and water great for our stop over.

properties.name: Crosslands Reserve
properties.description:
Tent camping that must be booked.  It is also important to note that it is not suitable for caravans, trailers or camper vans and that all vehicle types are not permitted within the camping site area.

Great for Picnicking and barbeques and bushwalking

properties.name: Kianinny Bush Cottages
properties.description: Set on 100 acres of natural terrain 3kms from Tathra beach

properties.name: Iluka Riverside Holiday Park
properties.description:
The tiny coastal village of Iluka is a tranquil hideaway surrounded by the magnificent Clarence River, vast, unspoilt beaches and the World Heritage listed Yuragir National Park. t’s a peaceful and secluded haven for fishermen, surfers, nature lovers and families.

Iluka Riverside Tourist Park is on the banks of the river, right in the heart of Iluka. You can fish from the Park’s pontoon – or anywhere along the the Park’s long river frontage.

Fresh seafood abounds and you can whip up a feast in the camp kitchen or cook the day’s catch on the Park’s riverside BBQ’s.

properties.name: Blayney & Villages Tourist Park

Lake St Clair Campgrounds: Picturesque Getaway in Singleton, NSW 
Nestled amidst the foothills of Mount Royal National Park, Lake St Clair Campgrounds offers an idyllic escape in Singleton, New South Wales.

properties.name: Norah Head Lighthouse
properties.description:
Norah Head Lighthouse is a working lighthouse located on Norah Head, a headland on the Central Coast of New South Wales, Australia. It is the last lighthouse of the James Barnet style to be built, and the last staffed lighthouse constructed in New South Wales.

The lighthouse was built between 1901 and 1903, and was designed by Charles Assinder Harding. It is a 28-metre-tall (92 ft) tower made of sandstone and brick. The lighthouse's light is visible for 22 nautical miles (41 km).

Norah Head Lighthouse is an important navigation aid for ships travelling between Sydney and Newcastle. It is also a popular tourist destination, and visitors can climb the tower to enjoy stunning views of the coastline. The lighthouse is also home to a small museum that tells the story of the lighthouse and its keepers.

The lighthouse is located in a scenic reserve, and there are a number of walking trails that wind their way through the bush to the lighthouse. The reserve is also home to a variety of wildlife, including wallabies, kangaroos, and kookaburras.

Coin operated washers and dryers are located in the laundry. There is a large camp kitchen which contains 2 gas barbeques ($1 coin operated), large tables and sinks with hot water for washing up. We allow small campfires (subject to fire bans), wood must either be brought with you (clean and de-nailed) or purchased from the office. You must not collect wood out of our park. 

All guests must register and pay at the office on arrival. There is a 10kph speed limit throughout the whole park and an excessive noise curfew of 10.30pm every night.

Please Note:
No Generators; No Bucks weekends or large parties. 

We reserve the right not to take large group bookings.

The beautiful Darlington Point Riverside Caravan Park features spacious cabins as well as plenty of large grassy drive through sites, as well as powered and tent sites suited for everyone. 

The location right on the Murrumbidgee River has a boat ramp for your boat, a sandy beach for swimming and canoeing and walking

properties.name: Cundle Flat Farm
properties.description: Cundle Flat Farm offers riverside camping

properties.name: Forbes Caravan & Cabin Park
properties.description: Set on over three acres of lawn, our park offers quiet and pleasant surroundings and is close to all your needs within walking distance to the town centre. There are clean amenities, a well equipped laundry, large flat sites, and very comfortable cabins with air conditioning.

properties.name: Corynnia Station
properties.description:
Corynnia Station is a busy working station and pet friendly destination on the edge of the great Australian outback near Hay and halfway between Sydney and Adelaide. 

Charming and authentic 1940s guest cottages and new six bedroom lodge are set within stunning homestead gardens.

properties.name: Corrimal Beach Tourist Park
properties.description: Guests of Corrimal Beach

properties.name: Copi Hollow Caravan Park
properties.description:
Copi Hollow Caravan Park is located 15 kilometres west of Menidee and on the shores of Copi Hollow.

There are three on site cabins, shaded powered and unpowered sites. There are clean and modern facilities. There is a boat ramp and barbecues for the guests to use. Ice and gas is also available.

properties.name: Colonial Tweed Holiday and Home Park
properties.description:
Colonial Tweed Holiday and Home Park is a small, boutique park providing friendly personal service. The park is well located, with excellent accommodation and facilities at very competitive rates. 

The Colonial Tweed is located on the southern bank of the Tweed River, just a few minutes drive from Coolangatta beach.
properties.fees: Pricing: $32.00 to $170.00. Subject to change and availability

properties.name: Laurieton Lakefront Caravan Park & Lifestyle Village
properties.description:
Christmas Cove Caravan Park is situated at beautiful Laurieton, just south of Port Macquarie on the Mid North Coast of NSW. 

Unwind and enjoy a break in the relaxing and quiet natural bushland setting, with absolute water frontage to Queen's Lake which is a refuge for black swans.

properties.name: Caseys Beach Holiday Park
properties.description:
Caseys Beach Holiday Park at Batehaven, in the Batemans Bay area of the NSW South Coast. The park features direct beach access to the calm peaceful waters of beautiful Caseys Beach. We are only 2 hours from Canberra and 4 hours from Sydney.

Park facilities include a camp kitchen, BBQs, laundry facilities, swimming pool and children's playground. Our accommodation suits every budget and holiday requirement offering 3 styles of accommodation from our park and courtyard cabins to our two-bedroom villas. All fully self-contained.

properties.name: Camp Cypress
properties.description:
Camp Cypress, in north-western NSW, is located at Baradine, gateway to the vast and intriguing forest of The Pilliga.

Camp Cypress is an ideal base for anyone seeking an escape into the Australian bush. Enjoy bushwalks, scenic forest drives and discover hidden gems like the weatherworn caves. The Pilliga is a birdwatcher’s paradise. Follow some of Baradine’s well-marked Bird Routes and you could spot flocks of glossy black cockatoos coming in to drink at the Salt Caves Dam at sundown.

Spanning over 3,000 sq.kms, the Pilliga Forest constitutes the largest continuous remnant of semi-arid woodland in temperate New South Wales, Australia. The forest contains at least 300 native animal species, and more than 230 species of birds; with at least 22 endangered animal species including the Glossy Black Cockatoo, Squirrel Glider, Koala, Pilliga Mouse and Rufous Bettong. There are at least 900 plant species including many threatened plant species.

properties.name: Calypso Yamba Holiday Park
properties.description:
Laid-back Yamba has stunning beaches, a vast river with great fishing, surfing, sailing and more. It has a vibrant and colourful town centre with fabulous restaurants and cafés and great resort style shopping.

Calypso Holiday Park is on the riverfront, right in the heart of town. It offers riverfront cabins, camp and van sites all within easy walking distance of Yamba’s many eateries and attractions.

The Park has a pool, playground, pontoon, and laundry. Internet is available, and the office provides a full range of quality visitor information.

properties.name: Bushy Tail Caravan Park
properties.description: Bushy Tail Caravan Park is a family park located at Wright's Beach NSW, an hour and half from Wollongong. It was started in the 1960s by the coal miners of the Illawarra.

properties.name: Browns Rocks Caravan Park
properties.description: Browns Rocks Caravan Park is located right on the bank of the Clarence River

properties.name: Brooklyn Camping Ground
properties.description:
Set in the quiet rural area of Urbenville, visit and enjoy the peace and quiet. Advance bookings only must be made. The facility is closed the second weekend of each month. 

No motorbike riding is allowed.

properties.name: Broken Hill Tourist Park
properties.description: The ideal base to experience Broken Hill, Australia's first heritage listed city.

properties.name: Bream Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Positioned between Jervis Bay and St Georges Basin

properties.name: Bimbimbi Riverside Caravan Park
properties.description: Bimbimbi Riverside Caravan Park is located in a scenic, peaceful bush setting.

properties.name: Tocumwal Tourist Park
properties.description: Our 4-star park has a brand new amenities block, large camp kitchen, solar-heated pool, playground, boom-gate security, wireless internet and internet kiosk. We are the closest park to town, within convenient walking distance of the Foreshore, markets, pubs, shops and cafes. Courtesy buses operate to the Toc Golf Club weekends and busy periods.

properties.name: Bendemeer Tourist Park
properties.description: Bendemeer is a lovely village on the New England Highway between Tamworth and Armidale. The Bendemeer Tourist Park is beautifully positioned overlooking the meandering McDonald River, with unobscured views of the Moonbi Ranges.

properties.name: Beds on the Barwon
properties.description:
Scott & Frida welcome you to Beds on the Barwon with luxury cabins and camping facilities located just a few kilometres out of town on the banks of the Barwon river.

Beds on the Barwon have four luxury absolute riverfront cabins, a riverfront caravan and camping ground, hire boat and canoes are also available.

properties.name: Beachcomber Holiday Park
properties.description: A spectacular holiday park nestled between the Eurobodalla National Park, the unspoilt Potato Point beachfront and Lake Tuross.

properties.name: Barcoos Farmstays Bathurst
properties.description: A visit to Barcoos Farmstays Bathurst is all about having interactive fun farm experiences, in comfortable clean accommodation. Children will love collecting fresh eggs, feeding animals, led pony rides, farm tours and draft horse activities.

properties.name: Ball Park Caravan Park
properties.description: Ball Park Caravan Park is a spacious park situated on the banks of the Murray River

properties.name: Avon Caravan Village
properties.description:
The Avon Caravan Village is located in Bargo in the Wollondilly Shire, on the south west outskirts of Sydney, and offers on-site vans, caravan sites and camping sites. 

It's perfect for a stop-off if you are visiting Sydney or are on your way through en route for other destinations

properties.name: Austin Tourist Park
properties.description: Austin Tourist Park

properties.name: Armidale Tourist Park
properties.description:
Armidale Tourist Park is an award-winning inland park situated just minutes from the centre of Armidale, and only a short drive to the wonderful National Parks of the New England region.

Catering to all travellers; perfect for families and groups, caravanners and campers, and they are even pet friendly.

On-site you can entertain at the undercover barbecue area, have a round of tennis, mini golf, table tennis, or pool or get your sweat on in the gym and have a splash in the swimming pool afterwards.

properties.name: Forbes Apex Riverside Tourist Park
properties.description:
Unwind in nature's embrace at Forbes Apex Riverside Tourist Park, a tranquil escape on the banks of the Lachlan River in Forbes, New South Wales. 

Immerse yourself in scenic beauty and reconnect with loved ones at our park. We offer a variety of comfortable accommodation options, from spacious caravan sites and cozy camping spots to modern motel rooms and luxurious riverfront villas. 

Experience the best of the outdoors at Apex Riverside: 
-Camping: Set up your tent or caravan and enjoy the serenity of nature. 
-Fishing: Cast a line in the well-stocked Lachlan River and try your luck catching a Murray cod or a golden perch. 
-Swimming: Take a refreshing dip in our sparkling swimming pool. 
-Relax by the communal fire pit, cook up a delicious meal in the camp kitchen, or explore the surrounding area. Apex Riverside Tourist Park is the perfect base for your Forbes adventure.

properties.name: Anglers Reach Caravan Park
properties.description: At Anglers Reach Caravan Park there is no pretence, just an open willingness to share

properties.name: Alamein Caravan Park
properties.description: Alamein Caravan Park is located in a peaceful, shady, riverside setting

properties.name: Mudgee Valley Park
properties.description: If you’re looking for a true country escape, this is it! Mudgee Valley Park is a short walk to the bustling cafes, restaurants and boutique shops of Mudgee CBD. The park provides a quiet escape with a range of cabins and campsites for all discerning visitors. At Mudgee Valley Park, not only will you be greeted by friendly country hospitality but you’ll also enjoy a range of park features including a swimming pool, playground, and games room. There’s a camp kitchen and BBQ facilities for easy meal preparation, and a convenient kiosk and laundry facilities. The vibrant Mudgee region exudes country charm with a city’s worth of things to do, visit to the beautiful Mudgee region.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Moama West
properties.description:
On the banks of the magnificent Murray River, Discovery Parks - Moama West (A Shady River Holiday Park) is a short drive from the historic town of Echuca-Moama.

At our caravan park you’ll enjoy diverse accommodation choices, natural bushland and lots of facilities for the kids.

Step back in time at the old port of Echuca where you can discover the fascinating world of paddle steamers – and even take a ride! The National Holden Motor Museum and the Great Aussie Beer Shed are essential Aussie experiences. Don’t miss the Echuca-Moama Food and Wine Trail: a journey through local wineries, producers and mouth-watering dining experiences.

properties.name: 4 Post Recreation Park
properties.description: 4 Post Recreation Park is located in a rustic setting of 36 acres on the Edward River, approximately eight kilometres south of Deniliquin. Facilities include a hall for up to 200 people and a full service commercial kitchen that caters for up to 150 people.

properties.name: Diggers Headland Reserve
properties.description: Primitive camping ground

properties.name: Temora Caravan Park
properties.description: Temora Caravan Park is a council- run, centrally located, park with 22 powered caravan sites, and 12 tent sites.

properties.name: Lockhart Caravan Park
properties.description: If you are looking for just the right place to set up camp with your tent or caravan, or wanting to hire a cabin, then the pet friendly Lockhart Caravan Park, set by the banks of Brookong Creek, is the place for you.

properties.name: Parkes Showground
properties.description: Parkes Showground features campsites for RV’s and tents. Call (02) 6862 2580 for updated rates and to make bookings.

properties.name: Nymboida Canoe Centre
properties.description: Nymboida Canoe Centre is pleasantly situated on the banks of Goolang Creek amid 38 acres of glorious natural surroundings.

properties.name: Gloucester Tops Riverside Caravan Park
properties.description: Gloucester Tops Riverside Caravan Park offers powered and unpowered sites with flush toilets, hot showers and laundry facilities in a picturesque setting. An on-site kiosk is available for your convenience. Pets aren’t allowed due to native wildlife. Campfires are allowed.

properties.name: Homebush Hotel Campground

Facilities include barbecues, a camp kitchen, showers, toilets, an open fireplace, TV/ lounge area, and an onsite bar. Call for enquiries and bookings.

properties.name: Victory Park Caravan Park

The caravan park is well located off the Barrier Highway and caters for both caravans and those wanting to pitch a tent.

properties.name: Browns Caravan Park

Tree studded with a park-like atmosphere, Brown's Caravan Park offers budget accommodation with your choice of 14 powered sites. Browns Caravan Park is conveniently located on the Bruxner Highway, within walking distance of the central business district of Casino and offers quiet, neat surroundings.

Overnight cabins and vans are available as well as powered sites and camp sites.

properties.name: Cudal Caravan Park
properties.description: Cudal Caravan Park provides powered and unpowered sites, suitable for tents, and caravans. Facilities include toilets, showers, water, laundry area, and BBQ. Pets are permitted. Bookings can be made by phone.

properties.name: Goat Rock Camping Ground & Tourist Park
properties.description: Goat Rock Camping Ground & Tourist Park offers unpowered camp sites. Facilities include toilets, showers, BBQ and picnic facilities. Local attractions include bushwalking, stargazing, farm animals and birdwatching. Bookings can be made online or by phone.
properties.fees: AUD $7 per person per day or $20 per family.

properties.name: Tibooburra Aboriginal Reserve Campground
properties.description: Tibooburra Aboriginal Reserve Campground provides unpowered sites. Facilities include toilets, gas BBQ, and hot showers. You will need to bring your own firewood. Bookings and keys can be collected at the Tibooburra Aboriginal Land Council.

properties.name: Wellington Valley Caravan Park
properties.description: Wellington Valley Caravan Park is located on the Mitchell Highway and offers 20 powered sites, and 20 unpowered sites, motorhomes and cabins. Facilities include showers, toilets, dump point, kiosk, laundry and BBQs. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Mulga Creek Hotel Caravan Park
properties.description: Mulga Creek Hotel Caravan Park provides powered and non powered sites for tents, caravans and big rigs. Facilities include showers, drinking water, BBQ, picnic tables and public phones.

properties.name: Gogeldrie Riverside Park
properties.description: The grounds of Gogeldrie Weir Park are an ideal camping ground for families.

properties.name: Boggabri Council Caravan Park
properties.description: Boggabri Council Caravan Park offers powered and unpowered as well as 3 on-site cabins.  Each powered site has private facilities. Unpowered sites have a shared bathroom. The cabins include kitchenette, private facilitites, microwave, refrigerator, tea/coffee making facilities and an en-suite.  There is a local swimming pool and shopping centre nearby.

properties.name: Kallara Station
properties.description: Kallara Station offers a range of accomodation, including Lodge rooms and a camping ground.  The Coolabah lodge provides 4 riverside ensuite rooms. The Fisherman's Lodge provides shared rooms. Facilities include toilets, showers, and fireplace. Local attractions include swimming, fishing and walking.

properties.name: East Gresford Showground
properties.description:
East Gresford Showground provides camping in a pleasant location beside the Allyn River. Caretaker collects camping fees in the afternoon.
There are plenty of grassy locations with power outlets and mostly level. Choose from sunny or well shaded spots.

There is a large swimming hole in the river with a path down...

properties.name: Bundarra Caravan Park
properties.description:
Bundarra Caravan Park is situated in the centre of town and offers powered sites as well as camp sites. 

The park provides toilets, showers, barbecue facilities and the river is only a short walk away. 

The caravan park is located off the main highway in a quiet setting, close to the river.

properties.name: Old Bara
properties.description: Old Bara offers bush camping suitable for tents, caravans and campervans. Facilities include drinking water, toilets, campfires, and phone reception. When camp fires allowed, please bring your own firewood. On this private property you can enjoy mountain biking and hiking. Bookings can be made online or phone.

properties.name: Careys Reserve
properties.description: Carey's Reserve at Wee Jasper Reserves offers bush camping suitable for tents, campers, camper trailers, caravans and RVs. Sites are unpowered. Facilities include toilets, and picnic tables. Advanced bookings are not available.

properties.name: Mystery Bay Campground
properties.description:
On the idyllic South Coast of New South Wales, Mystery Bay Campground offers a unique escape for nature enthusiasts. This oceanfront campground boasts stunning scenery, direct beach access, and a laid-back atmosphere, perfect for a camping getaway.

Imagine waking up to the sound of waves crashing and the fresh ocean air. Mystery Bay Campground is surrounded by native Australian bush, offering a true escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

properties.name: Menindee Bridge Caravan Park
properties.description: Menindee Bridge Caravan Park has sites suitable for campers, caravans and motoromes. There are 6 unpowered sites and 25 powered. Bookings can be made in advance via phone.

properties.name: Wadeville Woolies
properties.description:
Wadeville Woolies (formerly the Border Ranges Centre) offers clean modern amenities, spacious and grassy camping and van sites along with single and double rooms with the spectacular views of the southern edge of the Border Ranges National Park. 
Takeaway food, deli goods and grocery's are available for our on site store. We also have a licensed bottle shop.

properties.name: Ungarie Showground
properties.description:
Ungarie Showground is located in Ungarie. 

Sites are suitable for tents, caravans and large rigs. 

Facilities include toilets, showers and water.

Pay by donation.

properties.name: Grafton Greyhound Racing Club Caravan Park
properties.description:
Offering a relaxed and affordable atmosphere, the Grafton Greyhound Racing Club Caravan Park's spacious surrounds provide an ideal venue for your stay. 

Whether it be overnight or weekly, motor home, caravan or tent, there is a site for you. Shower, laundry facilities and a dump point for motor homes are also available

properties.name: Moss Vale Showgrounds
properties.description: Moss Vale Showgrounds is a small camping area with 12 campsites. Facilities include picnic tables, toilets and showers.

properties.name: Warialda Caravan Park
properties.description: The Warialda Caravan Park is conveniently located adjacent to the Warialda Visitor Information Centre, Warialda Pool, sports ground and parks. It features 3 onsite cabins, amenities and laundry which are beautifully kept. The park is only a short, two-block walk to the centre of town where there are shops, cafes, ba...

properties.name: Barrington River Reserve Campground
properties.description:
There is plenty of unshaded space to camp at this reserve. There are new toilets with a washbasin with water for hand washing only. 

There is one rubbish bin and 15 pits along with two sheltered picnic tables. There is access to the river for swimming and pets are welcome. 

The maximum stay is 14 nights: 

- $15 for the first night and $10 thereafter. 
- Pay at the Barrington Store in Barrington.

properties.name: The National Motorcycle Museum Campground
properties.description:
The motorcycle Museum is open seven days a week.

![NT Banner](https://webdata.campermate.com/assets/strapi/Camper_Mate_x_Tourism_NT_Competition_Creative_1_EDM_600x250_Click_Below_d582c5603d.jpg)

[Enter The Competition!](https://campermate.com/ntroadtrip)

properties.name: Temora Showground
properties.description: Current GPS is for showground entrance

properties.name: Forster Holiday Village
properties.description: Situated in the heart of fabulous Forster on the beautiful NSW Mid North coast, only a 1 1/2-hour drive from Newcastle. At Forster Holiday Village, we offer a selection of fully self-contained accommodation styles to create a memorable holiday experience to suit each guest. Our spacious cabins, set amongst pristine gardens in a village setting. Air-conditioned, ceiling fans, fully equipped kitchens and spacious sitting and dining areas. The outdoor areas boast free BBQ's and plenty of shaded alfresco dining or relaxing spaces. Forster Holiday Village also has undercover parking, a heated pool, kids play fort and an in-ground trampoline. Walking distance to beaches, lakes, clubs, pubs, cafes, restaurants.

properties.name: Kiama Blowhole
properties.description:
The Kiama Blowhole is a natural wonder located in the coastal town of Kiama, nestled on a rocky peninsula by a lovely lighthouse.

This impressive geologic feature is a must-visit attraction, known for its spectacular water spouts. As waves rush into a submerged sea cave, water is forced upward through a narrow opening, creating a dramatic plume of seawater that can soar several metres into the air. 

The blowhole is a mesmerizing sight, especially during high tide or when the sea is turbulent. Visitors can enjoy the view from nearby lookouts and explore the surrounding scenic coastline, making it a memorable experience for all.

properties.name: The Bucketts Way Camp n Stay
properties.description: 50 camping sites, shower’s, camp kitchen and toilets .

properties.name: Broken Hill Race Course
properties.description:
Great little campgroung just on the outskirts of broken hill
prices are 20 $ unpowered 30$ powerd

properties.name: Jabour Park
properties.description: Great cheap camp.  Showers and toilets available all for $10 per couple. Heaps of room.  Excellent

properties.name: Tallow Beach
properties.description: This is a lovely beach for swimming, surfing and bird watching. Car Park not free, beautiful spot next to the large beachfront. Plenty boards and relaxing. Cold beach shower, toilets and drinkable water

properties.name: Mamango Camp Ground
properties.description:
Camp on the banks of Murrumbidgee River at Mamanga campground, located near Balranald in Yanga National Park, part of Murrumbidgee Valley National Park. A large, secluded area, Mamanga campground features two sections – one for tent camping and another more open section for caravans and motor homes.

Set up your campsite among the surrounding native bushland and spot animals and birds living in striking river red gums and black box eucalypts. Take a walk along the floodplain and look closely at the trees, many are bark-scarred, and show evidence of the area’s Aboriginal heritage.

Go fishing, swimming, kayaking or canoeing in the river, try mountain biking to one of the park’s great picnic spots or take a self-guided tour through nearby Yanga Woolshed.

properties.name: Bega Show Grounds
properties.description:
Low cost camping with powered and unpowered sites for all size vehicles. Grassy level spots close to town. Very friendly Caretaker "Peter" lives on site.
The camping area is mostly on sloping ground & leveling blocks would be needed for most vans & motorhomes. There are three toilet cubicles &  hot showers in each of the 2 male & female amenity blocks.
A public dump point has been installed.
properties.fees: Powered and unpowered sites $10-$19 per night

properties.name: Clyde View Holiday Park
properties.description:
Clyde View Holiday Park offers a wide variety of villa accommodation situated in beautiful Batemans Bay to suit all budgets for a perfect family holiday or for that weekend escape.

Situated just 3km south of the main centre of Batemans Bay, Clyde View Holiday Park offers wide variety of villa accommodation options, facilities and services, and location makes Clyde View Holiday Park at Batemans Bay the perfect place for the weekend escape or an affordable family holiday. Enjoy swimming, fishing or sailing all within metres from your villa accommodation.

properties.name: Oura Beach Reserve
properties.description: This beautiful and quiet camping area with good facilities is located on the banks of the river. It offers scenic views, walking tracks and fishing and swimming are permitted here. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: McNamara Park
properties.description: Large and safe camping area with good facilities and a selection of sunny or shaded spots. It is located in a park and has an easy access to all the shops and services offered by a small village. It is quiet and situated beside Wollombi Brook. 72hrs limit applies.

properties.name: Cowra Showground
properties.description: Cowra Showground offers powered and non powered sites suitable for tents, caravans and large rigs. Facilities include hot showers, laundry, toilets, bins and mobile phone coverage. Pets are allowed. Fires are not permitted. Bookings are recommended.

properties.name: Wauchope Showgrounds
properties.description: Wauchope Showgrounds provides 21 powered sites. Campground is suitable for tents, camper trailers, campervans and caravans. Facilities include showers, toilets and mobile phone coverage. Pets are allowed.  It is recommended to book in advance as it is a popular choice of campers and sites fill fast.  There is a on site caretaker.
properties.fees: AUD $20/night 2ppl  AUD $10/night for tent, or car

properties.name: Berry Showground
properties.description:
New caretakers. Everyone welcome. Pets welcome. Dogs must be restrained. Close proximity to Berry township, rail to Sydney and beaches 10 mins away on beautiful South Coast. Julia, manager. 
Berry Showground campsite is suitable for tents, trailers or caravan camping. They offer powered and unpowered sites. Facilities include hot showers, dump point, swimming pool, power poles, on-site caretaker, and evening lighting.

properties.name: Bulahdelah Bowling Club
properties.description: Bulahdelah Bowling Club camping area is located adjacent to the bowling club. The campsite is suitable for caravans, camper trailers and motorhomes. There are toilets, showers, meals and hot drinks available from inside the bowling club. Membership fees apply.

properties.name: Bega Valley Lookout Rest Area
properties.description:
Scenic lookout allowing overnight stays. There are no facilities and the surface of the parking area is sloping - best to use van levelers. 

This site is accessible with a narrow and steep road that is easier to manoeuvre from southbound direction.

properties.name: Tamworth Airport Rest Area
properties.description: Two bays available for both SC and non-SC. Toilet facilities available.

properties.name: Jim Johnstone Park
properties.description: Large grassy parking area next to the cricket ground. Toilet facilities available. Overnight only.

properties.name: Gunning Showground
properties.description: Area on Copeland St. At Gunning. Picnic tables, toilets and hot showers, rubbish bins, drinkable water and kids playground are provided. Maximum stay 20h.

properties.name: HQ Camp
properties.description: Large grassy camp area in Wingello State Forest. Toilets and some shade from trees available. Good spot for mountain biking. Located on Forest Rd, 3.5km SW of Wingello.

properties.name: Crooked Creek Picnic Area
properties.description: This campsite is well away from the road on a dirt access road. It is a small, quiet camping spot surrounded by trees and with a creek running along one side. There are sunny and shaded spots to camp on. There is a basic long drop toilet, a sheltered picnic table and an old barbecue pit. There is no water.

properties.name: Joe O'Connor Park
properties.description: Free camping at the sportsground next to Yass River. No facilities, for SC vehicles only. There is a dump point nearby, at the N entrance to town. Max stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Willow Park
properties.description:
Free camping next to the lagoon in central Griffith. This grassy park has toilets, bins, sheltered picnic tables and BBQs available. There is also a dump point. Located on Kookara St. Max stay: 24hrs. 

No tent camping.

properties.name: Sandy Beach Reserve
properties.description: Large, grassy free camping area on the N banks of Murrumbidgee River. There are toilets and picnic tables and it's a nice area for swimming and fishing. There is also a boat ramp here. Located at the E end of Wantabadgery, take dirt road 500m S of River Rd.

properties.name: Frying Pan Creek Camping Area - Chichester State Forest
properties.description: This large and grassy camping area with basic facilities is located on the bank of the Telegherry River in Chichester State Forest, close to Frying Pan Road. It offers scenic views and many walking tracks. Fishing and swimming are permitted here.

properties.name: Araluen Creek Camps
properties.description: Shady free camp area next to the creek. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and bins available. Located on Majors Creek Araluen Rd, 23km S of Braidwood via Araluen Rd.

properties.name: Kingsbury VC Rest Area
properties.description: This is one of the most pleasant rest areas on the stretch as it is a little distance from the highway and screened by a few pine trees. There is a level, sealed camping area with non-flush wheelchair accessible toilets, non-potable hand washing water, three sheltered picnic tables and some rubbish bins. There is also a grassed area in the center of the access loop road in which you can camp.

properties.name: Common Beach
properties.description: Free camping spot at N end of Darlington Point, next to Murrumbidgee River. Picnic tables are the only facility, but it is a nice spot for fishing and boating. Camp area is N of the corner of King St and Ross St.

properties.name: Grong Grong Park
properties.description: Small grassy picnic and camp area in Grong Grong. Toilets, showers, sheltered picnic tables and BBQ facilities here. Donations welcome for upkeep, hand in at store. Located on Junee St, just W of the highway. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Terramungamine Reserve
properties.description: Free camp area on the N bank of Macquarie River. Toilets and picnic tables available and it's a nice area for fishing. Located on dirt road just S of Burroway-Dubbo Rd, 4km W of Brocklehurst.

properties.name: Copeland Reserve Camp Area
properties.description: This is a pleasant free campsite with large grassy area, with a stand of trees hiding a very basic non-flush toilet. There are two sheltered picnic tables, two barbecue pits and a rubbish bin.

properties.name: Badcoe VC Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area just off Federal Hwy. Sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins available. Accessible from both sides of the highway and features a turning circle. 40km NE of Canberra.

properties.name: Wild Bull Camping Area
properties.description: Shady camping area in Mount Boss State Forest next to Wilson River. Picnic shelter and BBQ facilities available, as well as a nice swimming hole. Located off Cobrabald Rd, 17km NW of Bellangry via Hastings Forest Way. Access is via dirt road.

properties.name: Mother of Ducks Lagoon
properties.description: This is a pretty camping site for an overnight stop. There are grassy areas with some shade trees. Some of the sites are by the wetland. The nearby reserve has picnic tables and a large shelter. There are clean toilets with disabled access nearby and an exercise area. There is a nice walk around the wetlands.

properties.name: Swans Creek Crossing Camp Area
properties.description: This is one of the best forestry reserves in the area for camping. There are spacious sites with and without shade, stone fireplaces and old picnic tables, some of which are sheltered. There are non-flash toilets with disability access. Nearby there are river pools for swimming and well marked bush walks. Just before the campsite you will approach a river ford. Turn right just before the ford and drive the few tens of meters to the campsite.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Maidens Inn Moama
properties.description:
The mighty Murray River has a place in the heart of so many Australians. Echuca-Moama, uniquely placed across the borders of NSW and Victoria, is an essential touring holiday stopover. At Discovery Parks - Moama East (formerly Maiden's Inn Holiday Park) you’ll enjoy excellent cabin and caravan accommodation.

The whole family will enjoy exploring the rich history of the old port of Echuca, which has been lovingly restored to its glory days. Take a wander through the charming Century-old buildings, and then enjoy afternoon tea. You must see the Port of Echuca Discovery Centre and the National Holden Motor Museum, the largest one make car museum in Australia.

properties.name: Clarence River Camping Ground
properties.description: Awesome free campground right on the river with heaps of friendly cows. There are many sites about 1/2 are flat and the others are a bit uneven. The toilets are a short walk, pretty clean - just bring toilet paper as the aren’t serviced regularly. There is also a boat ramp.

properties.name: Cobar old reservoir
properties.description: Wet and muddy when raining, mostly flat grounds. Suitable for self-contained and sufficient campers. No facilities, nice free camp spot by the reservoir.

properties.name: Gurley Recreation Ground
properties.description: Lovely spot $15 a night power, hot showers, flush toilets. Honesty box in amenity block

properties.name: Bathurst Showgrounds
properties.description: Large area. Old but clean amenities.  Friendly care takers, walk to town, clean amenities
properties.fees: $30 / night for 2 with power and water.

properties.name: Gulgong Showgrounds
properties.description: Show grounds with good clean showers and toilets power and water cost $16. This is a very well maintained showground with a resident caretaker.

properties.name: Tyalgum Showgrounds Camping
properties.description: Nice, quiet and peaceful place run by a local community. Very simple but okay.Very handy to town and shops. Power is available.

properties.name: Yadboro Flats
properties.description: This remote campsite is located on the bank of the Clyde River. It offers good facilities and fantastic fishing and swimming. This is also a great gateway to many walking and 4WD tracks in the area. Please note that dogs are allowed only in the state forest.

properties.name: Lockyers Head Track campground
properties.description: This spacious and grassy area is located in the Blue Mountains and offers amenities limited to toilets. There are plenty of trees and shade and the views over the valley are spectacular. This is the beginning of one of the most historical walking tracks in this area and it also offers great 4WD and mountain biking trails.

properties.name: Lake Benanee Rest Area
properties.description: This scenic and shaded rest area with great facilities is located beside the lake. It offers fishing, swimming, canoeing and boating (there is a boat ramp). Please do not camp on the edge of the lake, as it is no longer allowed.

properties.name: Wagga Wagga Showgrounds
properties.description: Wagga Wagga Showgrounds have toilets, showers, water, power and free dumping for caravans. Call ahead for bookings.

properties.name: Narrabri Showground
properties.description: Narrabri Showground provides campsites for caravans and campervans. Hot showers and basic amenities included. Powered and unpowered sites available. In a convenient location, walking distance from town centre. Closed during certain events, call for details and bookings.

properties.name: Cassilis War Memorial Park
properties.description: Cassilis War Memorial Park has camping opportunities in a small camping area. Powered sites available. Call and pay the bowling club.

properties.name: Wanderest Travellers Park
properties.description:
Wanderest Travellers Park is a paid caravan park provided as a part of the Richmond Club’s membership. 

The membership is $2 then sites are $30 per site unpowered and $40 a site powered Park facilities include hot showers. Call for bookings and enquiries.

Under Council regulations we can only accept self-contained motorhomes and caravans. Tents and mini camper vans are not allowed at this time.

properties.name: Kempsey Showgrounds
properties.description: Kempsey Showgrounds provides powered and unpowered sites for tents, caravans, camper trailers and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, bins, fireplace and dump point. Pets are permitted. Bookings can be made via phone.
properties.fees: AUD $20 per camp site per night/2ppl

properties.name: Milton Showground
properties.description: Milton Showground provides powered and unpowered sites for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, water and bins. Pets are allowed. Caretaker collects fees.
properties.fees:
AUD $25 per powered site
$20 unpowered site

properties.name: Young Showground
properties.description:
Behind the Young Showground, you are allowed free camping for 24 to 72 hours. Sites are suitable for self-contained caravans and motorhomes. There are no facilities. There is a $15 fee to use the facilities located at the Young Showground. Water is no longer supplied.
 Please note if you are wanting to stay on a paid campsite with power, water, and amenities access, you will need to ring ahead so the caretaker can organise a key for access.   Contact number is below.
properties.fees: Fees are from $20/night including power, $10 without power – $20 refundable key deposit.

properties.name: Cessnock Showground
properties.description: Cessnock Showground offers powered and non-powered sites for tents, camper trailers, campervans and caravans. Facilities include toilet, water, showers, BBQ, and dump point. The campground is closed from February to early March.  Pets are allowed

properties.name: Royal Hotel
properties.description: Royal Hotel Camping area in Mirrool offers picnic tables, toilets, BBQ facilities, showers and 8 powered sites. Meals and drinks are available inside the hotel area.  Campsites are suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers.

properties.name: Bowning Rest Area
properties.description: 500m off motorway, SC and non-SC. Toilets. Seating area with fireplace.

properties.name: Mackay Park Rest Area
properties.description: Small drive-through rest area with good facilities. It is located in the corner of a highway and main road, next to a roundabout. It has dirt level surface and you can picnic on the adjacent grassy area. There is a general store and a service station just on the opposite side, offering meals and other services.

properties.name: East Ben Boyd Forest Rest Area Northbound
properties.description: This overnight drive-through rest area is located just off the highway (for northbound traffic only) and offers good amenities with some shade available. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Bewong Rest Area
properties.description: Shady sealed rest area on Princes Hwy. Sheltered picnic tables, bins and toilets here, but lots of road noise from highway. Opposite a roadhouse where you can eat and get supplies. Also area is shared with trucks. Located 31km S of Nowra.

properties.name: Bonshaw Weir
properties.description: Free camping area just off Bruxner Hwy, on the banks of Dumaresq River. Picnic tables are the only facility, but there is plenty of shade and you can fish and swim in the river.

properties.name: Woolridge Recreation & Fossicking Reserve
properties.description: This is a large area with plenty of space for camping. Shortly after the entrance you can turn to the left or to the right. Both are pleasant camping spots although the site on the right is somewhat larger and next to a beautiful sandy beach on the creek. Both sites have shade from gum trees. There are many old picnic table scattered here and there. There are non-flush toilets that have disabled access, rock five pits, rubbish bins, and a hard-to-spot drinking water supply. After you take the right turn at the entrance the drinking water tap is near a tree on the way from the toilet to the beach. The adjoining Creek has a white sandy beach. Warning! If you go to the left camping area there are two rocks, one on either side of the road with a narrow gap between them. Take care turning the corner particularly if you are towing a caravan.

properties.name: Glen Davis Campground
properties.description: Shady free camping area in Glen Davis. Toilets, hot showers, laundry, picnic table and rubbish facilities available. Located on Warrool St, 35km E of Capertee via Glen Davis Rd. Dirt road.

properties.name: Breamer Park
properties.description: Lovely shady rest area off Summerland Way. Mixture of grass and sealed areas. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables, bins and BBQs available. 27km S of Casino.

properties.name: Goolgowi West Rest Area
properties.description: Free rest area set back from Mid Western Hwy. Picnic tables and rubbish bins, some shade from trees. 1km W of Goolgowi.

properties.name: Barbour Park Gunning
properties.description: Camp area at Gunning, on the pool car park. Follow 'Barbour park' sign. Various areas on gravels and grass. Have some picnic tables, BBQ areas, toilets, rubbish bins. Hot showers are provided into the swimming pool. No fires.Maximum stay: 2 nights.

properties.name: Captains Flat Camp Area
properties.description: Located next to the park on Foxlow St, this free camp area has toilets, picnic tables and bins. A great place to stop for a night, for small vehicles only. Max stay: 24hrs. Donations welcome. No power available.

properties.name: Dubbo South Rest Area
properties.description: Basic stopping area along the highway. Road noises. No toilet facilities. Rubbish bins and sheltered picnic tables available. Suitable for all kinds of vehicles. Level sites, some slots between trees. Ongoing traffic. Okay for overnight if tired. Make sure to leave enough room for long vehicles to pass.

properties.name: FigTree Retreat
properties.description: Relax, Revitalise and restore at FigTree Retreat, 24 minutes from Wagga Wagga. Suitable for caravans or camper vans. Depending on where you would like to set up camp, we have a dedicated glamping area in which we host accommodation bookings in our luxury glamping g tents with amenities, hot tub and sauna including on site massage to soak in some pamper time during your travels. We have Scottish highland cattle, an abundance of wildlife and picturesque views for a hike up the hills. We are only a short drive to Wagga, with many activities to offer in the area.

properties.name: Moruya North Head Campground
properties.description:
Moruya North Head Campground, on the pristine shores of Moruya on the NSW South Coast 
Camp right by the beach: Enjoy stunning ocean views from your tent, campervan or caravan site Explore nearby beaches, go fishing in the Moruya River or ocean, or try your hand at surfing and snorkelling.

Experience the beauty of Moruya's coastline at North Head Campground. Book your unforgettable escape today!

properties.name: Wonboyn cabins and caravan park
properties.description: Nice campground in the middle of nature, away from the crowds. Much wildlife can be spotted here.

properties.name: Yuin Cultural Heritage Trail
properties.description:
The 9 signs on this trail are an initiative of the Far South Coast Branch of the National Trust, Merrimans Local Aboriginal Land Council and Bermagui Primary School. They recognise the sacred places, legends, history and recent achievements of the Djiringanj Clan of the Yuin Nation who have been the custodians of this country for 40,000 to 50,000 years. The trail is 15 kilometres long; the location of the signs is marked with an orange Y on the Bermagui town map/services guide.

Dickinson Point Headland

Starting from the Bermagui Visitor Information Centre, turn right out of the car park onto Bunga Street and at the T-intersection turn right again onto Lamont Street. Follow the road for about 300 metres, turn right into Pacific Drive and then left onto the gravel road on Dickinson Point. The sign is on the northern side of the headland looking towards Gulaga Mountain.

Bilima Rock

Return to Pacific Drive, turn left and continue for approximately 250 metres to the picnic table on the left. Bilima Rock is a huge ochre coloured rock formation shaped like a sea turtle with its flippers in the sea, at the base of the cliff.

Bermagui Sacred Waterhole

Turn back along Pacific Drive and turn left into Lamont Street. Follow the road for approximately 1.5 kilometres, taking the last left turn before the Bermagui River Bridge. Then turn left into West Street and left again into Hill Street. The sign is on the cul-de-sac at the end of the street overlooking the sacred waterhole.

Koori Trading Routes

Return to and cross the Bermagui River Bridge, head north for 6 kilometres on Wallaga Lake Road to Fairhaven Point Way. The sign is on the left at the corner of the turn off to Fairhaven Point Way.

Fairhaven Point Midden

Continue down Fairhaven Point Way for 1.5 kilometres and the sign is on the left when you reach the end of the sealed road, about 180 metres before the cul-de-sac at the end of the road.

Murunna

Return to the T-intersection at Wallaga Lake Road and turn left. Travel north for 1.2 kilometres and take the right turn to Camel Rock Surf Beach. The sign for Murunna is located in the car park at the end of the road, beside the path to Murunna headland.
