properties.description: This overnight circular rest area with good facilities and a dump point is located a short walk away from town.

properties.name: Graman Hotel
properties.description: This free campground is located behind a cafe/pub with accommodation facilities. It is spacious and among its many amenities, it offers hot showers. The hotel serves meals and drinks and organises various events, like birthdays and baby showers. It's best to check the availability before arriving, in case it gets busy (02 6725 6482)! There is also occasional live music.

properties.name: Glencoe Rest Area
properties.description: Grassy and relatively shaded rest area located in town. There is plenty of space to park several vehicles and it's easily accessible just off the main road, via a short dirt track. Nearby, you'll find a local tavern offering great entertainment, food and cold drinks, as well as other town services.

properties.name: Glen Riddle Recreation Reserve
properties.description: This is a spacious and grassy waterfront campground located north of the Split Rock Dam, 8km away from the main road. It has good amenities and dogs are  permitted here. Fishing, boating and bird watching are among the main camp attractions.

properties.name: Georges Junction Campground - Cunnawarra NP
properties.description: This scenic camping area with no facilities is located on the river bank and surrounded by mountains. There are plenty of trees around to add to the scenery. It offers breathtaking views and many walking tracks. Fishing, swimming and kayaking are permitted here.

properties.name: Glen Innes Showgrounds
properties.description: Glen Innes Showgrounds provides an easily accessed, centrally located, shaded camping area with flush toilets, hot showers, water tank refilling, and waste disposal. Camping not permitted during the annual show, and major events.

properties.name: Armidale Showgrounds
properties.description: The Armidale Showground offers powered and unpowered sites. Facilities are available for both camping and caravans.

properties.name: Barkala Farmstay
properties.description: Barkala Farmstay has various farm stay accommodation available including camping. Camping facilities include hot showers, toilets, and the use of an in-ground salt water swimming pool. An onsite café, Pilliga pottery, walking tracks and farm animals are some of the attractions of Barkala. Bookings can be made online or by phone.
properties.fees: AUD $15 x2 Adults; AUD $8 Adult; AUD $5 Child

properties.name: Adelong Golden Gully Caravan Park
properties.description: Adelong Golden Gully Caravan Park has cabins as well as campgrounds for caravans and tents. Facilities include toilets, hot showers and laundry. A limited number of powered sites are available, so phone ahead to book those.

properties.name: Levuka
properties.description: Levuka is an easily accessible flora and fauna reserve with camping.  Camping areas are large, shady and spread out. Facilities include hot showers, flush toilets, BBQs, a bush weather shed, and a rainwater tank. Activities in the area include 4x4 driving tracks, bush walking and fishing. Fires are generally permitted in the stone fireplaces provided. Bookings necessary.

properties.name: Yass Showgrounds
properties.description: Yass Showgrounds provides powered campsites with an honesty box system for most of the year, except during the Yass Show weekend. Amenities include flush toilets and hot showers (located adjacent to the sand arena).

properties.name: Yarrie Lake
properties.description: Yarrie Lake has powered and unpowered sites with shady trees and sandy beaches. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, washing machine, picnic tables, and barbecues. No pets allowed.

properties.name: Gumma Crossing Reserve
properties.description: Gumma Crossing Reserve is a Council run campground, along the banks of Warrell Creek. Facilities provided are toilets, cold showers, rubbish, boat ramp, dump point, BBQ and picnic tables. Collection of firewood is banned. Maximum stay is a month. Call for updated regulattions.

properties.name: Lake Liddell Recreation Area
properties.description: Lake Liddell Recreation Area offers accessible lakeside camping with powered and unpowered sites, suitable for both large RVs and campers in tents. Facilities include hot showers and BBQ areas. Call for enquiries and bookings.
properties.fees: AUD $9 Adult (Unpowered Site); $20 x2 Adults (Powered Site)

properties.name: Glengarry Hilton
properties.description: Glengarry Hilton offers free camping for campers and caravans at their historic hotel. Hot showers are available for $3.00. Activities in the area include fossicking for your own opal, and fishing for yabbies. The hotel serves food and drinks.

properties.name: The Granites Caravan Park
properties.description: The Granites Caravan Park provides scenic powered and unpowered campsites. Facilities include an amenities block, laundry, BBQs (gas and wood), camp kitchen, and a swimming pool (from October- March). Call for enquiries and bookings.

properties.name: Nimmitabel Caravan Park
properties.description: Nimmitabel Caravan Park offers centrally located camping within the small town of Nimmitabel. Facilities include an amenities block, hot showers, laundry, a playground and a picnic area. Call for bookings and enquiries.

properties.name: Multi Purpose Park
properties.description: Situated near the Darling River, Multi Purpose Park campsite provides powered and unpowered sites, suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, wood fireplace and picnic tables. You will need to bring firewood. Local activities include fishing, swimming and canoeing. Camp fees can be paid at the Telegraph Hotel. There is Potable water at each Powered Site and at the local Hall

properties.name: Woodenbong Campground
properties.description:
Woodenbong Camping Ground is a quaint rural camping area tended to by volunteers of Woodenbong village which caters for tents, caravans, RV and motorhomes. Powered sites available. 

There is a small shelter and a large undercover area with seating, electric barbecues and sink with preparation benches, clean ameni...

properties.name: Nelia Gaari Station
properties.description: Nelia Gaari Station offers unpowered campsite by the Darling River. Facilities include showers, toilets and gas BBQ. Dogs are welcome. Bookings can be made online or by phone.
properties.fees: AUD $10 per adult per night $5 under 16

properties.name: Bendemeer Camping Area
properties.description: Bendemeer Camping Area is located behind the showgrounds and is suitable for caravans and motorhomes. Facilities include toilets, and shelted picnic area. There is a maximum stay of 24 hours.

properties.name: Henty Showgrounds
properties.description: Henty Primitive Camping Ground is located at the Henty Showgrounds. It provides powered sites with amenities block. Bookings can be made by phone.

properties.name: Rossmore Station
properties.description: Food & Huts by Mt Oxley at Rossmore Station provides a range of accomodation including bedrooms in a Shearer's Hut and camping on the Dry Bogan River. The camping area is suitable for self contained vehicles only. There are no facilities available. Pets are allowed. Advanced bookings are required via phone or email.

properties.name: Coolamon Caravan Park
properties.description: Coolamon Caravan Park provides powered sites for caravans and unpowered camping sites. Facilities include amenities block, dump point, playground and BBQ area. Located near Redgrave Park, swimming pool, bowling club and tennis courts. A $25 refundable deposit is required for amenities key.

properties.name: Tullamore Showground
properties.description: Tullamore Showground offers powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, water, bings and mobile phone coverage. There is a maximum stay of 48 hours. Pets are allowed. Keys can be obtained from the General Store.

properties.name: Ophir Reserve
properties.description: Ophir Reserve camping area is suitable for vehicle based camping. It is not recommended for caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, fireplace and picnic tables. You will need to bring your own firewood and water. Activities include fishing and walking trails. A camping permit is needed. No advanced bookings are taken.

properties.name: Oasis Hotel Enngonia
properties.description: Oasis Hotel Enngonia provides caravan sites and hotel accomodation. Located off Mitchell Highway. Payments can be made at the hotel bar.

properties.name: Kendall Showgrounds
properties.description:
Kendall Showgrounds provides powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, water, boat ramp, BBQ and picnic tables. 

In support of Kendall Showground Camden Haven Show Society
​Short-term Camping (Overnight to 4 nights maximum)
​​$20 per site per night (Max 2 People plus $5 each extra person  (powered)

$ 5 Water Levy for VAN & CAR WASHING

On Arrival:
1. Scan this Services NSW QR code by using your mobile phone / iPad camera.
2. Follow the prompts on the Service NSW app or on the Service NSW webform.
3. Pay your camping fee $25 per vehicle (max 2 persons) plus $5 each extra person.
Put correct Cash into the completed envelopes located at the Secretaries Office and put into “Camping Money” box outside office.
Enjoy your stay and travel safely.

Sorry No Eftpos Available

Local activities include fishing, swimming pool, canoeing and kayaking.

properties.name: Emmdale Roadhouse
properties.description: Emmdale Roadhouse camping area offers powered sites suitable for tents, caravans, camper trailers and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, picnic tables, fire place and BBQ. Pets and generators are allowed. There is also a service station and kiosk.

properties.name: Ramond Deed Veterans Retreat
properties.description: Ramond Deed Veterans Retreat offers powered and unpowered sites for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, showers, water, laundry area, BBQ, wood fireplace and picnic tables. This site is restricted to Veterans, Service personnel, Emergency Services personnel, peacekeepers and friends and family with them.

properties.name: Lockhart Showgrounds
properties.description: Situated along the Brookong Creek, Lockhart Caravan Park provides powered sites, unpowered sites, and 3 self-contained cabins. Facilities include BBQ, camp kitchen, laundry area and dump point. Pets are allowed on a lead. Bookings can be made through the park manager.
properties.fees: AUD $23 2 ppl per night-powered AUD $18 2 ppl unpowered AUD$80 per cabin

properties.name: Murrundi Self Contained Vehicle Park
properties.description: Murrundi Self Contained Vehicle Park provides unpowered sites suitable for SC camping. This area of the caravan park is specifically reserved for self contained vehicles only at a cost of 5 dollars a night. There are no powered sites or facilities in this section. Facilities that can be used nearby at an extra cost include laundry area, camp kitchen, BBQ and amenities block. Fires are permitted. Bookings can be made by phone or online.
properties.fees: AUD $29 per 2 ppl powered sites. AUD $24 per 2 ppl unpowered. Self contained vehicles $5. Additional ppl $5.

properties.name: Blue Sapphire Caravan Park
properties.description: Blue Sapphire Caravan Park provides powered and unpowered sites. There are also cabins avaiable to rent. Facilities include showers, laundry, kisok, picnic tables and BBQ.  Local activities include tennis court, historical museum, tennis courts and shops. Bookings can be made by phone. Park closes for winter.

properties.name: Wattle Flat Racecourse
properties.description:
Wattle Flat Racecourse provides a basic campground. Sites are suitable for tents and caravans and large vehicles. 

Facilities include toilets, bins and shade.

properties.name: Bowling Alley Point Rec Reserve
properties.description: Bowling Alley Point Rec Reserve is located on the foreshore of Chaffey Dam. Sites are suitable for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and caravans. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, wood fireplace and picnic tables. You will need to provide your own firewood. Activites include fishing, canoeing, waterskiing, swimming and walking trails. There is a self serve booth at the campsite.

properties.name: Trunkey Creek Showground
properties.description: Trunkey Creek Showground offers powered and unpowered sites for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and caravans. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, BBQ, wood fireplace and picnic tables.  Camping is not available the 2nd week of October. Payments can be made at the hotel.

properties.name: Four Corners Farm Stay
properties.description: Four Corners Farm Stay provides up to 200 unpowered sites and powered sites. There are also self-contained cabins to rent. Activities include bush walking, fishing, remedial massage, and art classes. Bookings can be made via email or phone.

properties.name: North Head Primitive Campground
properties.description: North Head Primitive Campground offers sites for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, fireplace and drinking water. Activities in the area in clude, fishing, swimming and walking trails. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Hay Showground
properties.description: Hay Showground provides 40 powered and unlimited unpowered sites. Sites are suitable for tents, caravans and large rigs. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, bins and mobile phone coverage. Dogs are permitted. Bookings are not necessary.

properties.name: Cranky Rock Recreation Reserve
properties.description: Cranky Rock Recreation Reserve camping area offers sites powered and unpowered sites suitable for caravans, tents, and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, water, BBQ, kiosk, picnic tables and mobile phone coverage. In the area you can enjoy bushwalking and fishing.

properties.name: Berrima Reserve
properties.description: Berrima Reserve camping area has only four camp sites. Facilities include toilets, showers, BBQ, picnic tables, shelter and playground. In the area you can enjoy fishing and bush walking. Bookings can be made online. There is a maximum stay of 2 nights.

properties.name: Darling Campsites
properties.description: Darling Campsites

properties.name: Euabalong Campground
properties.description: Euabalong Campground offers powered sites for camper trailer and big rig access. Facilities include toilets, water, showers, and public phone. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Stewarts Brook Recreation Reserve
properties.description: Stewarts Brook Recreation Reserve offers sites for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, water, wood fireplace, and picnic tables. Fees are collected daily by the caretaker.

properties.name: Rabbit Trap Hotel
properties.description:
Established in 1929, The Rabbit Trap Hotel is the perfect respite for travellers found in the heart of NSW - located around 120 km from Dubbo.

Rabbit Trap Hotel camping area offers powered sites for caravans and large rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, drinking water, and public phone.

properties.name: Premer Lions Park
properties.description: Premer Lions caravan park offers powered and unpowered sites for camper trailers, tents and large rigs. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, picnic tables, children's playground, showers and drinking water. Bookings are not necessary. Payments made through an honesty box.
properties.fees: AUD $7 unpowered per vehilce AUD $12 powered per vehilce

properties.name: Burrumbuttock Hall
properties.description: Burrumbuttock Hall camping area offers sites for tents, caravans, and large rigs. Facilities include toilets, drinking water, fire place and firewood, picnic tables and public phone. Power is available, a donation is appreciated. The local pub offers hot meals, log fireplace and pool table. Animals are welcome.

properties.name: Eastern Foreshore Campground
properties.description: Eastern Foreshore Campground located in Lake Keepit State Park offers sites for tents, big rigs and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, and picnic tables. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Bora Crossing - Gwydir River Free Camping Area
properties.description: River level can change quickly if water is released from Copeton Dam for irrigators, so camping right on edge level with river is not wise, plenty of area for camping, quality depends on who gets their first.

properties.name: Moree Showgrounds
properties.description: Moree Showground Camping area is located in NSW. The campsite is close to shopping facilities. Suitable for tents, camping trailers and caravans. There are some powered sites.  Facilities include toilets, showers and access to water. The prices has gone up to $25 per night for power and $15 for unpowered
properties.fees: $25.00 powered site per night  $15.00 unpowered per night or $60.50 for 7 days

properties.name: The State Centre Caravan Park
properties.description: The State Centre Caravan Park is located in NSW. The campsite has both powered and non powered sites. The campsites are suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ areas, toilets and a campers kitchen.

properties.name: Narrandera Showground
properties.description: Narrandera Showground is a low cost camping area suitable for tents, caravans, camper trailers and motorhomes. There are both powered and unpowered sites available. Facilities include picnic tables, toilets, showers and access to water.

properties.name: Blatherarm Creek Campground
properties.description: Blatherham Creek Campground is located in NSW. There are 15 campsites suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities and toilets. There are no powered sites. Activities include walking, hiking and bird watching.
properties.fees: AUD $5 per Adult AUD $3 per Child

properties.name: Urana Caravan Park & Aquatic Centre
properties.description: Set in well maintained grounds, the Urana Caravan Park has a AAA Tourism Three Star rating and features 22 powered, 20 unpowered waterfront caravan and camping sites as well as five comfortable four to six berth on site cabins.Whether you want an action packed stay with their recreation facilities for skiing and fishing, or a relaxing weekend escape with amazing birdlife along the four kilometre walking track, the caravan park can satisfy every need.

properties.name: Yagon Campground
properties.description: Offering fishing, swimming, paddling and surfing near Seal Rocks in Myall Lake National Park, Yagon campground has 37 campsites. Sites are suitable for tents, camper trailers, caravans and vehicle-based camping. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables, BBQ and carpark. Take caution of strong rips and currents at Submarine Beach. You will need to bring your own water. Advanced bookings recommended.

properties.name: Cattai Campground
properties.description:
Cattai campground is located along the Hawkesbury River. Activites available include walking, canoeing and bike riding. Sites are unpowered and unmarked, suitable for tents, camper trailers and vehicle based camping. 

Facilities include toilets, showers, amenities block, BBQ and picnic tables. Fires are allowed in designated BBQs. You will need to bring your own firewood and water. Generators and chainsaws are not permitted. Bookings are available.

properties.name: Cypress - Pine Campground
properties.description:
Situated beside Boonoo Boonoo River, Cypress-pine campground offers 14 sites for tents, camper trailers, caravans and vehicle-based camping. 

You'll find secluded waterholes along the river, bush trails to explore and a beautiful waterfal. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ, amenities block, and toilets. Advances bookings are not available.

properties.name: Smoky Cape Campground
properties.description: Smoky Cape Campground is located in an isolated area below Smoky Cape lighthouse in Hat Head National Park.  Surrounded by lush rainforest, this campground offers 20 campsites for tents, camper trailers, and vehilce-based camping. A great place for fishing, diving, swimming and bushwalking. Facilities available include picinic tables, BBQ and toilets. You'll need to bring your own water. Limited firewood is avilable. This campground runs on a first come, first served basis. Bookings are not available.
properties.fees: AUD $6 per adult per night $3.50 per child

properties.name: Yanda Campground
properties.description: Situated on the banks of the Darling River in Gundabooka National Park, Yanda campground offers 10 campsites suitable for tents, camper trailers, caravans and vehicle-based camping. Fantastic location for the self-sufficient camper who enjoys remote areas. Facilites include toilets, carpark, BBQ and picinic tables. Check the weather before driving as the road can become boggy from rain. Bookings are not available.
properties.fees: AUD $6 per adult $3.50 per child over 5yrs

properties.name: Woko Campground
properties.description:
Alongside the Manning river, Woko campground provides unpowered campsites for tents, camper trailers, caravans and vehicle-based camping. Facilities include picnic tables, toilets and BBQ. 

You will need to bring your own water and firewood. Generators and domestic animals are not allowed. Take caution of strong currents in the Manning River. Contact NPWS Gloucester office for bookings.

properties.name: Green Gully Campground
properties.description: Green Gully camping area is located in Oxley Wild Rivers National Park and is just a short walk to lookouts over Chandler and Wollomombi falls.  Suitable for tents, camper trailer, and caravans. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables, wood BBQs, and drinking water.

properties.name: Station Creek Campground
properties.description: Station Creek Campground is located in the Yuraygir National Park. It offers 20 family friendly campsites with great fishing and swimming. Suitable for tents, camper trailers and caravans. No water on site so bring your own. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities and Amenities Block. Sites are unpowered. Generators are not permitted.
properties.fees: AUD $12 per Adult AUD $8 per Child

properties.name: Camp Wambelong
properties.description: Camp Wambelong is a peaceful campground offering spectacular views and an access point to many great walking tracks. Suitable for tents Camper Trailers and Caravans. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities and toilets.  Tank water is available. Sites are not powered.

properties.name: First Fleet Memorial Rest Area Wallabadah
properties.description: This large, grassy rest area with good amenities is located just off the highway in the First Fleet Memorial Gardens. There is plenty of shade, walking tracks and a children's playground. Donation is requested. 24hrs maximum stay.

properties.name: Ezzys Crossing
properties.description: Large, scenic campground with no amenities, located on the banks of the river. The trees around the area provide shade and shelter. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Euston Regional Park (State Forest)
properties.description: Spacious and shaded camping area with no amenities, located by the Murray river. Swimming and fishing is permitted here. Fuel station can be found nearby the campground.

properties.name: Eastern Dorrigo Showground and Community Hall
properties.description: This pleasant, grassy rest area is located between two churches. It provides toilets with disabled access and powered sites for a small fee. There are plenty of trees to provide shade. Please phone above number for after hours key. After 5pm

properties.name: Dormans Point - Blowering Dam
properties.description: This waterside campground is located on the grassy, yet sloping shore of the Blowering Dam. It is spread out over a large area and features several undesignated sites available for overnight stays. Some areas are more shaded than others, and level spots can be found under the trees, further away from the waterfront. 4WD access is recommended and bookings might be required in peak season.

properties.name: Dickigundi Reserve Camping
properties.description: This level bush camping area is scenically located on the bank of the Macquarie River and is accessible via a dirt road just off Mitchell Hwy. There are plenty of shaded and sunny camping spots, but no amenities.

properties.name: Delungra Hotel
properties.description: This is a safe and friendly campground located at the back of Delungra Hotel. Before setting up your camp, please talk to the staff at the Hotel. There is a small fee for the use of power, hot showers and laundry, but toilets are for free. The hotel offers a good choice of meals and hot and cold drinks.

properties.name: Currawarna State Forest
properties.description: This is a large and flat campground with river and beach access. There are no facilities, except for rubbish bins. Fishing, swimming and boating are permitted at this site, however it is available to SC vehicles only.

properties.name: Crossley Bridge Camping Area
properties.description: This spacious campground is located on the river banks, a walking distance away from the historic town of Sofala. This area provides great fishing, swimming and water sports opportunities, but no facilities (except for rubbish bins). The camping offers scenic views and walking tracks. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Cobrabald River Rest Area
properties.description: A road side dirt rest area located just off the main road. For overnight stays you can drive further towards the river for some extra privacy and minimized noise levels, although it is still quite exposed. There are no amenities here.

properties.name: Brooks Hill Rest Area
properties.description: Decent-size circular rest area with basic facilities located off the highway. It offers a sealed level surface and there is a fence to prevent visitors from parking on the grass.

properties.name: Bogan Weir
properties.description: This is a council maintained riverside camp ground with no amenities, located only 6 km from town. It provides plenty of flat, open and shaded spots as well as a good water access.

properties.name: Black Gate Reserve Camp Area
properties.description: Large and peaceful riverside campground with grassy level surface and plenty of shade. 4x4 access only and no facilities. Coming from Bathurst, this is the last campsite on the Bridle Track and the furthest any big vehicle can get.

properties.name: Barooga State Forest - Murray Valley
properties.description: Well signposted and easily accessible campground with no facilities, but very picturesque location.

properties.name: Alice Flats
properties.description: Lovely riverside campsite with no facilities, but with abundance of recreational opportunities - fishing, swimming and walking are all great here!

properties.name: Abbotts Tank Rest Area
properties.description: Small sealed parking area just off Stuart Highway with no facilities.

properties.name: Mungle Creek Overnight Stop
properties.description: Basic overnight camping stop for both SC and non-SC. Toilet and rubbish facilities.

properties.name: Black Perry Lookout
properties.description:
Located near Talbingo Mountain within Kosciuszko National Park, the Black Perry lookout presents captivating vistas of the Snowy Mountains region. It is conveniently situated in proximity to Tumut and the Yarrangobilly Caves. 

Black Perry lookout serves as an outstanding vantage point, providing visitors with an authentic appreciation of the vast and pristine wilderness areas that characterize the northern part of Kosciuszko National Park. 

Accessing this scenic gem is easily accomplished by veering off the Snowy Mountains Highway, allowing you to relish breathtaking panoramic views throughout the year. Be sure to bring along your camera and binoculars to capture these awe-inspiring landscapes, undoubtedly among the finest that Kosciuszko National Park has to offer.

properties.name: Yass Stopover
properties.description: Just off main road, SC only. Picnic tables available. No fires, no dogs. Max stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Black Stump Rest Area
properties.description: This is The Famous Black Stump! (If you don't know what that means, ask any Australian). The rest area has well-equipped toilets with disability access and even has a mother's room. There are sheltered picnic tables with three gas barbecues and rubbish bins. There is a tap but it does not have a hose thread.

properties.name: Yarrowyck Picnic and Camping Area
properties.description: This is a long-term campground with shade and sunny sites among scattered trees. It is beside the Gwydr River. There are non-flush toilets that a wheelchair could just squeeze into, rubbish bins, picnic tables and a barbecue pit and some river rock pits for open fires when permitted. There is no water supply.

properties.name: Taylors Arm Reserve Camping Area
properties.description: A quiet corner of the reserve is set aside for camping. There is a toilet without disability access and a sheltered picnic table with an attached wood barbecue. Pay five dollars at the ‘Pub With No Beer’ (which does have beer and bistro meals). You can use the pub shower for two dollars.

properties.name: Bluff Rock Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area set back from New England Hwy. Toilets, picnic tables, bins and BBQs available. Limited shade. Located 12km S of Tenterfield or 9km N of Sandy Flat.

properties.name: Bingara Riverside Camp Area
properties.description: Multiple areas for SC vehicles to stay. No camping within 50m of boat ramp. Max stay: 7 nights. Head to the right when the road splits, then choose one of the roads to get to a campsite. Muddy when wet.

properties.name: Hillston Rest Area
properties.description: Large sealed rest area along Kidman Way. Toilets, picnic tables and bins available, limited shade. Area is shared with trucks. Located at the S end of Hillston, 58km N of Goolgowi.

properties.name: Jeir Creek
properties.description: Sealed rest area on both sides of Barton Hwy. Sheltered picnic tables and bins available, some shade from trees. 27km N of Canberra and 54km S of Yass.

properties.name: French VC Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area 2km of Yarra. Has toilets, few covered picnic tables and rubbish bins. Unfiltered water. Eastbound only.

properties.name: Bethungra Dam Reserve
properties.description: Camp Area suitable for self contained and non self contained vehicles. 100m north of Bethungra Village turn right onto dirt road under viaduct, follow signs for Bethungra Waterworks Rd, continue along track for 4km to Dam. Well maintained gravel access road where a 4WD is not required.Facilities include Bins, Covered picnic areas and Toilets. Mostly sloped ground with some flat areas suitable for tents. Not suitable for dogs unless always on leads due to algae in resevoir bseide site and possible risk of poisoning from Baiting.

properties.name: Kyffins Reserve
properties.description: This beautiful and large camping area with no amenities, except for rubbish bins, is located on the shore of the Mulwala Lake. It offers scenic views, walking tracks and many water activities, such as swimming, fishing, kayaking and boating. There is plenty of shade and the site is suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Burke and Wills Campground
properties.description: Large camping area on the banks of Darling River. Toilets, bins and picnic tables available, some shade from trees. To access, turn E of Menindee-Broken Hill Rd (at -32.330598, 142.410259) and travel for 8km to campsite.

properties.name: Wollomombi Rest Area
properties.description: Simple grass rest area in the town of Wollomombi. Sheltered picnic tables, bins, some shade from trees, and toilets located opposite at Memorial Hall. Located on Wollomombi Rd, a few hundred metres N of the highway. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Bowmans Crossing
properties.description: Simple dirt rest area just of Golden Hwy on the E side of Hunter River. No facilities and limited shade, but you might be able to fish in the river. Located 7km NW of Jerrys Plains. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Wells Crossing Camping
properties.description: Large camping area on the W bank of Severn River. Picnic tables and BBQs available here, no toilets. You can also swim and fish in the river. Located 7km SE of Ashford, access on Wells Crossing or Ashford-Bukkulla Rd.

properties.name: Frog Hollow Camping Area
properties.description: This is a clean and spacious campground by Lake Cargelligo located very close to town. It doesn't have any amenities other than a picnic table and rubbish bins, however, there is a dump point just 500m away. Popular site among birdwatchers.

properties.name: Dingo Fence Rest Area
properties.description: Basic dirt rest area just back from Waterfall Way. Rubbish bins, no other facilities but some shade from trees. Located 10km E of Wollomombi.

properties.name: Wingham Riverside Reserve
properties.description: Overnight parking for self contained vehicles only. This reserve is next to the Wingham Riverside Reserve on one side and has a river on the other side. This is a very pleasant stopover place in an RV friendly town. There are toilets with disability access nearby, rubbish bins, sheltered picnic tables with free gas barbecues, unsheltered picnic tables and water tap not far from the boat launching ramp and jetty.

properties.name: Mid-State Shearing Shed Car Park
properties.description: Large sealed rest stop in Nyngan. Toilets and sheltered picnic tables available. Not suitable for tents. Located on Nymagee St, next to the road. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Gloryvale Reserve Camp Area
properties.description: This is a delightful, shady riverside campsite. There are rubbish bins, barbecue pits and a non-flush toilet at the south end of the campsite. There is one sheltered picnic table. There is a one-month maximum camping period in this free campsite.

properties.name: Gamboola Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed, shady rest area set back from Mitchell Hwy. Drop toilet, sheltered picnic tables and bins available. 17km SE of Molong.

properties.name: Bunyip Hole Reserve Camp Area
properties.description: Large campground at Darlington Point, follow the 'recreation ground' signs. Dirt road, dry weather road only. Many trees, near to the river. Maximum stay: 48hours. Dogs welcomed. Rubbish bins at entrance. No toilets.

properties.name: Spring Hill Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed, circular rest area on the W side of the Springs Creek bridge. Toilets, sheltered picnic table, BBQ and bin available here. Limited shade. Located on Barrier Hwy, 74km W of Wilcannia.

properties.name: Wallaby Rocks Crossing Camp Area
properties.description: The access road is narrow and steep and only suitable for small vehicles. It is just before the Turon River Bridge heading west from Sofala. The bridge is distinctive with a large white wooden structure. If you cross it, you've gone too far. This is a beautiful campsite right by the river, which has deep swimming holes. Level camping sites are scattered amongst the trees and by the river. There is a rubbish bin but no other facilities except river rock fire pits.

properties.name: Five Mile Reserve
properties.description: Shady rest area on the N side of the lagoon. Pit toilet available, and it's a nice spot for fishing and swimming. Located of Old Wagga Rd, 7km E of Narrandera. Max stay: 72hrs.

properties.name: Geurie North Rest Area
properties.description: Basic stopping bay along the highway. Road noises. No toilet facilities. Rubbish bins and picnic tables available. Recommended only if tired, otherwise rest and drive on.

properties.name: Birdcage Reserve
properties.description: Rest area on the banks of Murrumbidgee River. No facilities, but a nice quiet and shady spot where you can do some fishing. Just N of Sturt Hwy, signposted. Dirt road.

properties.name: Binalong Rest Area
properties.description: Large grassy camp area in town next to the swimming pool. Toilets, picnic tables, BBQs and rubbish bins available. Located on Stephens St (Burley Griffin Way). Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Gunnedah South Rest Area
properties.description: Basic parking area suitable for SC only. No toilet facilities. Rubbish bin and picnic tables.

properties.name: Coachwood Camping Area
properties.description: Camp area in Chichester State Forest on the banks of Telegherry River. Toilets and lots of shade from trees available. It is also a nice area for swimming. Located on Frying Pan Rd, 25km N of Dungog via Main Creek Rd.

properties.name: Burren Junction Baths Reserve
properties.description: Large dirt camping areas just off Kamilaroi Hwy. Toilets and showers available, but no shade. 88km W of Narrabri or 95km E of Walgett.

properties.name: Braefield Rest Area
properties.description: Shady dirt rest area on Kamilaroi Hwy next to railway line. Picnic tables and bins available, lots of space for parking. 10km N of Willow Tree.

properties.name: Woolbrook Rest Area
properties.description: Grassy camping area next to Macdonald River. Drop toilets, bins and picnic tables here, but limited shade. 1km S of Oxley Hwy, via Wilson St.

properties.name: Bohena Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Large parking area with toilet on site. Max stay: 12hrs. Sharing site with trucks.

properties.name: Bunnerungee Bridge Rest Area
properties.description: Large bay rest area with access to the Darling River, located on both sides of the road. Spacious and level with gravel surface. There are toilets, picnic tables and some shade.

properties.name: Boorooma Creek
properties.description: Rest area along Kamilaroi Hwy. No facilities but lots of shade. Next to The Big Warrambool bridge, 55km W of Walgett.

properties.name: 150 Meridian Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area on Oxley Hwy. Sheltered picnic tables and bins available, and there is an interesting sun dial here. You can also park on the grass, some shade from trees available.

properties.name: Kilgowlah Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Small sealed parking area on the E side of Hume Hwy, next to the creek. Sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins available, some shade from trees. 13km SW of Tarcutta.

properties.name: Cato Bridge Rest Area
properties.description: Large dirt rest area on Kamilaroi Hwy, just E of Cato Creek. Picnic tables and some shade from trees. 7.5km NE of Brewarrina. Small vehicles only.

properties.name: Meadow Glen Rest Area
properties.description: Gravel and dirt rest area on the side of Barrier Hwy. Toilets, picnic tables and rubbish bins available, some shade from trees. Dirt parts are only good in dry weather, becomes muddy in the rain. 62km W of Cobar.

properties.name: Bottle Bend Camp Reserve
properties.description: Free camping area on the banks of Murray River. Picnic tables and plenty of shade available. Located on Bottle Bend Rd, off Sturt Hwy. 2km of dirt road. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Gilgunnia Rest Area
properties.description: Dirt rest area on Kidman Way. Drop toilets, sheltered picnic tables and bins available. No shade. 110km S of Cobar.

properties.name: Willoughby's Beach Campground
properties.description: Peaceful camping area in Murray Valley National Park on the S banks of Edward River. Picnic tables and BBQ facilities available, shade  from trees. Located just off Memorial Drive in Deniliquin.

properties.name: Badja Recreation Reserve
properties.description: Shady camping area on the S side of the river. Toilets and picnic tables available. Located just E of Peak View Rd in the NE part of Numerella, 22km E of Cooma.

properties.name: Cookoothama Reserve
properties.description: Large camp area on Murrumbidgee River. No facilities, but some shade from trees and it's a nice spot for fishing. Located 1km S of Murrumbidgee River Rd, 9km NW of Darlington Point via Kidman Way.

properties.name: Bombay Reserve
properties.description: Shady rest area on the W bank of Shoalhaven River.  There are no facilities, other than a picnic table and a BBQ. Big vehicles may find it difficult to turn around and the surface is not very level. It's easy to find and has an information board at the entrance.

properties.name: Bulla Park Rest Area
properties.description: Dirt rest area on Barrier Hwy. Picnic tables and bins available, some shade from trees. Not good in wet weather, can be very muddy. 120km W of Barrier Hwy.

properties.name: Middleton VC Rest Area
properties.description: Small sealed rest area on the side of Federal Hwy. Sheltered picnic tables and bins available, no shade, road noise. 26km NE of Canberra, Northbound access only.

properties.name: Glen Riddle Recreation Reserve
properties.description: Large grassy area set in a nice reserve. Public toilets, rubbish bins and picnic tables. Max stay: 21 days.

properties.name: Bretti Reserve
properties.description: Free camp area on the banks of Barnard River. Toilets, picnic tables and bins here. Limited shade. Located on Bretti Track, 34km N of Gloucester via Thunderbolts Way. Max stay: 1 month.

properties.name: Garoolgan Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area on Burley Griffin Way. Sheltered picnic tables and bins available, some shade from trees. 10km E of Binya.

properties.name: Gara River Rest Area
properties.description: Simple, sealed rest area on Waterfall Way. Toilets, picnic tables and bins available, some shade from trees. 13km E of Armidale.

properties.name: Anzac Park Primitive Campground
properties.description: Free camping in Gwabegar. No facilities but some shade from trees. Located on Anzac Parade. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Rocky Creek Glacial Area
properties.description: Camping is permitted here at the Glacial area. Toilets are the only facility, but there is some shade and swimming holes here. 38km SW of Bingara via Killarney Gap Rd. Some dirt road at the end.

properties.name: Abercrombie River Camp Area
properties.description: Free camp area on the S side of the Abercrombie River. Nice shady spot with basic toilets and the river for swimming. Located on Abercrombie Rd, 75km S of Bathurst.

properties.name: Gulpa Island State Forest
properties.description: Free camping spots next to the creek. No facilities, but a nice area for swimming and fishing. To access, follow Picnic Point Rd from Mathoura. Travel onto Gulpa Creek Rd from there and follow the dirt road NW for 1km.

properties.name: Waldrons Swamp Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed parking, SC and non-SC. Toilets, rubbish bins and sheltered picnic tables. No fires.

properties.name: Birdcage Reserve Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area on both sides of the Sturt Hwy. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins available on both sides. Some shade from trees. 33km W of Darlington Point.

properties.name: Booberoi Weir
properties.description: Free camping area on the banks of Lachlan River. No facilities, but a nice spot for swimming and fishing. Located just off Kiacatoo Rd, 55km W of Condobolin via Condobolin-Lake Cargelligo Rd.

properties.name: Cobram-Barooga Camping Area
properties.description: First turn off North of the bridge. Turn right when you see the sign for day area. Self contained only.

properties.name: Pilliga No 2 Rest Area
properties.description: Large parking area with no toilets, however there are multiple areas to park.

properties.name: Coleambally Water Ski Club
properties.description: Free camping area next to Murrumbidgee River. Toilets, picnic tables and a boat ramp available. Also a great spot for swimming, fishing and water skiing. Located 3km W of Euroley Rd, which is 45km E of Darlington Point. Both the access road and the site's surface are level, but can get slippery when wet.

properties.name: Yanga Rest Area
properties.description: Rest Area for self-contained vehicles only, close to the Yanga Lake. Non-filtered water available. Have some picnic table and rubbish bins. No toilets. The Yanga National Park is open from 8.30am to 4.30pm.

properties.name: Enngonia South Rest Area
properties.description: Drive through rest area just back from Mitchell Hwy. Picnic tables and limited shade available. 65km N of Bourke.

properties.name: Spring Ridge Showground
properties.description: The camping area is a grass and coarse sandy flat area with a little shade from some scattered trees. A donation is requested. The is a sheltered picnic table, rubbish bins, water and a barbecue pit near the campsite. There are picnic tables and a free gas barbecue and a shelter to the right of the entry. You couldn't squeeze a wheelchair into the older toilets.

properties.name: Nowlands Gap Rest Area
properties.description: Small sealed rest area on New England Hwy. Picnic tables and rubbish bins only. 13km S of Willow Tree. Southbound access only.

properties.name: Main Weir Campground
properties.description: Free camping area on the banks of Darling River. Flushing toilets and picnic tables available, as well as swimming and fishing in the river.

properties.name: Caltigeena Rest Area
properties.description: Large roadside rest area on Barrier Hwy. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and bins available. Level ground but very little shade. 47km SE of Wilcannia.

properties.name: Balancing Rock Rest Area
properties.description: Simple roadside rest area on New England Hwy. Toilets, picnic tables and rubbish bins available. 6km S of Glen Innes.

properties.name: May's Bend
properties.description: Basic camping area on the N side of Darling River. No facilities, but you can swim and fish in the river. 16km NE of Bourke, via Mitchell Hwy. Turnoff is onto dirt road at Y junction. Check with Bourke Info Centre for road conditions (02 6872 1321).

properties.name: Lake Pamamaroo Campsites
properties.description: Various camping spots next to the river. No facilities, but you can swim and fish in the river. Turnoff is on E side of Menindee-Broken Hill Rd, 8km N of Menindee. Access to camps from here is via dirt road.

properties.name: Kinchela Rest Area
properties.description: Gravel rest area just set back from Kidman Way. No facilities except rubbish bins. Limited shade. 40km S of Bourke.

properties.name: Sunny Corner Recreation Reserve
properties.description: This is a very basic but charming camping ground. The slightly sloping area is surrounded by mature trees. There are no rubbish bins or other facilities except an old but wheelchair accessible toilet hidden in the trees on the other side of the campground from the entrance. There is a children's playground nearby but it looks a little bit the worse for wear.

properties.name: Red Earth Estate Vineyard
properties.description: Please register at the reception, the hosts will show you around. Most of the people camping here are joining a wine tasting. The winery has a beautiful terrace and interior, it's a very welcoming place.
properties.fees:
powered site $25 per night 
non powered $15 per night

properties.name: Boolooroo Rest Area
properties.description: c

properties.name: Billabong Creek
properties.description: Shady rest area on the S side of creek in Jerilderie. No facilities available. Located just off Bolton St, 500m N of Newell Hwy.

properties.name: Wallaroi Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Shady camp area next to the creek on Condobolin Wyalong Rd. Picnic tables and rubbish bins available. 15km S of Condobolin.

properties.name: Currajong Rest Area
properties.description: Large rest stop/truck stop on Newell Hwy, 3km N of Parkes. Toilet, covered picnic table and bin facilities available. Very close to the road so there is traffic noise.

properties.name: Mackay VC Rest Area
properties.description: This is a sealed, nearly level area about 100 m from the road. There are no-flush toilets with disability excess and non-potable hand washing water, rubbish bins and sheltered picnic tables.

properties.name: Moama Camp Area
properties.description: Large area for overnight camping next to the Murray River, 8km W of Moama.

properties.name: Boggy Swamp Creek Rest Stop
properties.description: Putty Road rest area next to Boggy Swamp Creek. Picnic tables, bins and some shelter. 75km SW of Singleton and 60km N of Colo Heights. Max Stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Maisie Thompson Campground
properties.description: Camping Ground at Gooloogong suitable for self contained and non self contained vehicles. Located just off roadside within small town. Power available. Gold coin donation honesty box system. Maximum stay: 72 Hours. 8 large, flat tent pitches. Washing up point available under covered area.

properties.name: Bendick Murrell Rest Area
properties.description: Highway rest area E of Bendick Murrell with toilets, picnic table, rubbish bins and plenty of shade.

properties.name: Gratwick VC Rest Area
properties.description: Basic highway rest area right next to the road with sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins. Located in Collector, just N of Church St.

properties.name: Firetail Rest Area
properties.description: Large highway rest area 5km N of Grong Grong. Has toilets. Trucks also park here.

properties.name: Ben Halls Campground
properties.description: A nice camp area in Weddin Mountains National Park that has toilets, picnic tables and BBQ facilities. Follow the Hwy 5km W of Grenfell and turn on to Back Piney Range Rd. Follow this W and then S as it becomes Lynchs Rd. Turn left just before the forest of trees.

properties.name: Alford Street Rest Area
properties.description: This is a simple stopover place with sheltered picnic tables and scattered trees giving some shade. There are rubbish bins. Over the road there is a children's playground, toilets and a sports ground.

properties.name: Billabong Creek Camp Area
properties.description: This free camp area is S of Walbundrie. No facilities but there is a lot of shade and it is only a short walk from town. Entrance is at the S end of the bridge.

properties.name: Capertee Rest Area
properties.description: Large highway rest area located in Capertee. There are toilet, rubbish bin and sheltered picnic table facilities available, as well as a playground. Also a petrol station and cafe opposite.

properties.name: Mullengandra Rest Area
properties.description: Shady rest area with toilet, picnic table and rubbish bin facilities. Located right on Hume Hwy at the N end of Mullengandra.

properties.name: Whiporie General Store Camp Area
properties.description: Excellent free camp area outside the general store with toilets, covered picnic tables, bins and food available to buy. Located 15km S of Myrtle Creek. Let the owners know you are staying.

properties.name: Gundagai East RV Stop
properties.description: Camp area in East Gundagai, near to Morleys creek. For self-contained vehicles only. Maximum stay: 72h. No facilities, take your rubbish with you.

properties.name: Blackbird Flat Camp Reserve
properties.description: Blackbird Flat Camping Ground is situated on the road from Kempsey to Armidale. It is a free camping area located beside the Macleay River. Tank water is available but bring drinking water. Pit toilets, shelter shed and covered wood barbecue area.

properties.name: Caragabal Rest Area
properties.description: Rest Area located in the town of Caragabal. Has toilet, picnic table, rubbish bin and BBQ facilities. Some shade available.

properties.name: Bogolong Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Basic highway rest area with picnic table and BBQ. 9km W of Grenfell.

properties.name: Barraba Lions Park Area
properties.description: Basic roadside parking area available for SC and non-SC. Toilet and rubbish facilities, max stay: 24hrs. Donations accepted.

properties.name: Mendooran Rest Area
properties.description: Large parking area with toilet, cold shower, picnic tables, rubbish facilities and dog exercise area. 200 metres from police station. Maximum stay: 2 nights.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Jindabyne
properties.description:
Thirty minutes from your caravan park and you’ve arrived in the alpine country ski slopes in winter. Summer’s the time for mountain biking, white-water rafting, horse-riding, fishing and bushwalking. Take a mountain drive to local wineries, restaurants and galleries. 

Explore Mount Kosciuszko National Park by foot, horseback, canoe, car, mountain or trail-bike. Marvel at the 440 million year old stalagmites and stalactites of Yarrangobilly Caves or take a dip in the thermal pool, constantly at 27 degrees.

properties.name: Old Olney HQ Camping Area
properties.description: Shady camp area in Olney State Forest. Toilets and sheltered picnic tables available. Located on Watagan Forest Rd, 16km W of Cooranbong via Martinsville Rd. Dirt road.

properties.name: Pacific Palms Caravan Park
properties.description: Good campsite. Toilets and showers are clean. The kitchen is clean. Good 4G signal with Telstra reception. It is just behind Elizabeth Beach. You can go there at sunrise and see dolphins swimming on the beach shore. Beautiful area.

properties.name: Cootamundra Showgrounds
properties.description:
This paid campground provides toilets, showers, electricity, and drinking water. It is accessible to most caravans and large rigs. A caretaker is usually present on-site daily from 4pm to 5:30pm, and payments are accepted in cash only. 

If you arrive after 5:30pm, please use the yellow honesty box located near the amenities. 

Dogs must be kept on a lead at all times. Fire pits are not permitted. 

The campground will be closed for camping on days when horse or cattle events are taking place; these dates will be posted approximately one week in advance.

Lots of grass. Trees for shade. Nice and very clean amenities. 

There is a honesty box. 

$10 for unpowered and $20 for powered a night.

properties.name: Michelago Farm Camping
properties.description: Quiet location with a beautiful view!

properties.name: Stockinbingal Community Reserve
properties.description: Free camping at the rec ground/ oval. Toilets and water are available and there is FREE power. Very quiet little town. A great find!

properties.name: Camp on allyn
properties.description: Private farm stay

properties.name: Bonalbo Tourist Caravan Park
properties.description: Perfect place to stay wether that’s for a night or a few months. Caretakers are lovely! There is a camp kitchen with microwave/toaster/kettle/fridges/washing machine/dryer/sinks. The bathrooms have multiple hot showers and toilets. Council pool next door and a park a short walk away. There is a bowling club & golf course next door and the general store/pharmacy/bottle shop/post office is all within walking distance. Highly recommend!

properties.name: Hodge Lodge
properties.description: Hodge Lodge is located in Johns River NSW. There are powered and unpowered sites  from $10.00 a night per couple. A cabin is also available with full bathroom and kitchen facilities from $80.00 a night per couple

properties.name: Phil's Bend
properties.description:
Our campsite are situated on the banks of the mighty Murray, Euston NSW! Both Euston and Robinvale being a few minutes drive away!


We have 6 campsites available which are scattered along absolute river frontage! Your campsite will be away from other campers so you have room to move, but are big enough for you to be able to share the same site with those traveling with you!


Our property is fenced and gated giving you that little bit extra security! Entry is via combination lock, the code will be sent to you the day before arrival! 


If you have selected firewood and your booking is booked a few hours in advance we can drop your firewood off so it is ready for you when you arrive!

If you are already on site or arriving shortly we will drop if off as soon as possible!


Our campsite are a short stroll over the bridge to Robinvale or you can follow the walking track into Euston!


If your bring your boat with you there is a boat ramp just across the river in Robinvale, there is also one in front of the Euston Club




-Now for all the boring but important information-



*We do not offer toilets and showers so you will need to be fully self-sufficient

*We strive to keep our campsites free from rubbish so we ask that you please take your rubbish with you when you leave.

*We do allow your furry friends to come along but they will need to on a leash and please clean up after them

*Preferred sites are subject to availability

* We do not allow motorbikes 

* Generators allowed from 8am - 9pm                                                                                                                                                                                    ENTRY IS AT OWN RISK! THE PROPERTY OWNERS ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGES OR LOSS TO PERSONAL PROPERTY OR VEHICLES.

properties.name: Manilla Freedom Camp
properties.description: Hugh grassy area, beside Naomi River. Drinking water taps, rubbish bins. Dog friendly. Walking distance to town. Donations $ go to Manilla Men’s Shed

properties.name: Long Flat Travellers Rest Hotel
properties.description: Quite little camping area just off Oxley Highway , longflat pub a stones throw away. Showers and toilets available, great food in the bistro and cold beers

properties.name: Willow Tree Recreation Park
properties.description: Large quiet grassy area b ehind silo's with well spread out power and water outlets. Need to cross railway line on east end of town. Pay at Willow Tree  tourist info centre George IV Park New England H/way ( main street. )

properties.name: Aloomba Lavender Farm
properties.description: Camp ground on a lavender farm with beautiful views.   Cafe and gift shop.  Please be water wise as they are on tank water.

properties.name: Yerranderie Camping Area
properties.description:
Booking must be made prior to arrival via the National Parks website. For any enquiries contact the Yerranderie caretaker on 02 46596165 (Krubi Cottage residence beside the campground in Private Town).
Other information

Noise restrictions apply at this campground.
The campground is in a remote location, so please pick up all your supplies before you arrive.
Access to Yerranderie Private Town only from Oberon Colong historic stock route, no access from Sydney (Oakdale). Caretaker lives on-site and is available for information regarding the site and it’s history

properties.name: Collie Hotel
properties.description: Friendly owners, great pub, yummy food. Rooms available. Playground for kids
properties.fees: If you have your own power and water it is FREE to stay – no site charge. If you require power and water not a problem our site is $15 per night.

properties.name: The Harvest House
properties.description:
Set on 100 acres, half way between Sydney and Brisbane and just 5 minutes off the Pacific Highway, The Harvest House is an ideal place to stop over to break-up your journey. The property is a mixture of fields and bushland. Old logging tracks cut through the trees are perfect for exploring. There is an abundance of wildlife from kangaroos and wallabies to red and yellow tailed black cockatoos, and even the occasional echidna!

There are several camping areas to choose from. We have room for RV's and big camping rigs to pull up too.

Well behaved pets are welcome. We are ideally suited to self-contained campers as there are no facilities onsite.

The famous Eungai Creek Buffalo farm and cafe is just 5 mins away and beautiful beaches, shops and restaurants are all within a 20 minute drive.

properties.name: Hair of the Dog inn
properties.description: Offers free camp to patrons. The inn offer free camping in an enclosed grass area or $10including power.

properties.name: Mundi Mundi Lookout
properties.description: The Mundi Mundi Lookout is more than just a scenic viewpoint; it's an opportunity to connect with the wild and untamed spirit of the Australian Outback. Whether you're a traveler seeking adventure or someone looking to find tranquility in nature, this lookout is a must-visit destination. It's a reminder of the Earth's vastness and the sense of wonder that the Outback can instill in those who venture here.

properties.name: The Rock Recreation Ground
properties.description:
Nice and big free area in between the eucalyptus trees with free hot showers
 (donations welcomed)

properties.name: Big Tree Car Park
properties.description: Set among the trees along the Edwards River a short walk to town. Public toilets across the road at the Football Club. Good fishing spots

properties.name: Tomaree Mountain
properties.description:
Tomaree Mountain is a popular hiking spot with stunning views of the Port Stephens coastline. The hike to the summit is challenging but rewarding, and the views from the top are breathtaking.

The mountain is also home to a number of Aboriginal rock art sites, making it a valuable cultural and historical destination. There are a number of trails to suit all fitness levels.

properties.name: Whian Whian Falls
properties.description:
Whian Whian Falls is a beautiful waterfall located in the Whian Whian State Conservation Area in New South Wales, Australia. It is a two-tiered waterfall that drops about 30 metres in total. The falls are surrounded by lush rainforest and are a popular spot for swimming and picnicking. 

The best time to visit Whian Whian Falls is during the wet season, when the falls are flowing at their fullest. However, the falls are also beautiful during the dry season, when the water levels are lower.

Please park with in designated areas.

properties.name: Apsley Falls Campground
properties.description:
Apsley Falls campground offers a night in the bush with scenic waterfall views, walking and wildlife.
This unique bush site is suitable for: Tent, Camper trailer site, Caravan site, Camping beside my vehicle
properties.fees: $6 per adult per night. $3.50 per child per night.

properties.name: Cape Hawke lookout
properties.description:
Located at the northern tip of the national park, this exceptional viewpoint justifies the 500-meter hike through rejuvenating coastal rainforest. Lace up your hiking boots and equip yourself with binoculars and a camera. After ascending approximately 420 steps, you'll reach an 8.4-meter tower offering breathtaking panoramas of the nearby region.

To the south lies Booti Booti, and slightly to the west, Wallingat National Park unfolds. On clear days, the vista extends to Barrington Tops and Crowdy Bay National Park.

Throughout the year, birdwatching is a delightful activity here, with an abundance of pelicans and terns. However, winter adds a delightful surprise - the sight of whales breaching the ocean's surface, spouting water. This vantage point provides an exceptional spot to observe these magnificent creatures during their annual migration

properties.name: Honeymoon Bay Campground
properties.description: Honeymoon Bay is set in a picturesque location in Jervis Bay. It is approximately 10 kilometres from the edge of Currarong along the Point Perpendicular Lighthouse Road. Honeymoon Bay is a small sheltered bay to spend a day by the beach, snorkel and paddle in the sea. Camping is fully booked during the summer holiday period via a ballot system held each August. At other times of the year it is available on most weekends and during school holidays on a first-come, first-served basis. No pets are allowed. At times the area is closed when the car park reaches capacity or for Defence exercises Monday to Friday. Telephone the Beecroft Weapons Range for more information.

properties.name: Maitland Showground
properties.description:
Maitland Showground offers spacious grassed sites available for camping on our grounds subject to availability.
No bookings are necessary, please use entrance at corner of Blomfield and Anzac Streets.   Powered sites are available.  

We have an amenities block which is maintained during the working week only.

During Market days, camping is restricted to the first three rows on the left at the entrance of the showgrounds.

During our Maitland Annual Show and Groovin the Moo and some other events - NO camping is available.

properties.name: One Mile Sand Dune
properties.description:
The One Mile Sand Dune is a popular spot for sandboarding, sand sledding, and hiking. It is also a popular spot for photography, as the dune offers stunning views of the surrounding area.

The best time to visit the One Mile Sand Dune is during the summer months, when the weather is warm and sunny. However, the dune can be visited year-round.

properties.name: Cullendore High Country
properties.description: A fantastic working Cattle Station set on 4000 acres with camping.  Accessible by 2WD and 4WD.  Creek camping or Bush camping, with flushing toilets and hot showers. Stanthorpe and Warwick close by for groceries and fuel.

properties.name: Billabourie Riverside Tourist Park
properties.description: A great little place along the river. Hot showers and flushing toilets. A number of campfires set up.
properties.fees:
$15 per person per night unpowered 
Extra $5 a child. Under 3 free. 
Extra $5 a night for power.

properties.name: Wheeney creek
properties.description: Free camp -  dirt road in - toilets only - no showers - limited spots for rv n caravans - plenty of spots for tents

properties.name: Dooragan National Park North Brother Lookout
properties.description: Enjoy stunning views of Queens Lake, North Haven, and the surrounding area from North Brother Lookout in Dooragan National Park. The lookout is easily accessible by car or on foot, and it's a great place to visit for a picnic, a hike, or simply to take in the scenery.

properties.name: Gurney Campsite
properties.description: Free overnight campsite just off the main road. Two unisex composting toilets on site. 100 metres off the main road.

properties.name: Minnehaha Falls
properties.description: Minnehaha Falls is a 30-metre waterfall located in the Blue Mountains National Park, New South Wales, Australia. The falls are situated in a deep gorge, and are reached via a short walk from the Echo Point lookout. Minnehaha Falls are part of the Jamison Valley, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

properties.name: Wentworth Falls
properties.description:
Wentworth Falls is a beautiful and iconic waterfall located in the Blue Mountains National Park in New South Wales, Australia. It is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the Blue Mountains, and for good reason. 

The falls are formed by the Jamison Creek as it cascades over a cliff face into a pool below. The water is clear and clean, and the pool is a popular spot for swimming and picnicking. 

There are a number of different ways to experience Wentworth Falls. You can take a walk to the top of the falls for stunning views, or you can descend the stairs to the bottom of the falls for a closer look. You can also go for a swim in the pool at the bottom of the falls, or simply relax and enjoy the scenery.

properties.name: The Rock Lookout
properties.description:
The Rock Lookout area of Blue Mountains National Park is situated within the historic Mulgoa Valley, only minutes from the bustling city of Penrith. 

A short track of a few hundred metres leads to The Rock with superb views of the Nepean River.

properties.name: Sublime Point Lookout
properties.description: Sublime Point Lookout offers 180 degree views over the sea, the rainforest and the 17 beaches that span the coastline to Wollongong. Sublime Point track covers a distance of 850 metres. The lookout offers some of the best views of the Illawarra escarpment, plain and coastline. Barbecues, picnic shelters, and toilets cater to visitors, but bring your own drinking water.

properties.name: South Lawson Waterfall Circuit
properties.description:
South Lawson Waterfall Circuit is three kilometres long and traverses South Lawson Park passing four very different waterfalls: Adelina Falls, sand lined Federal Falls, Cataract Falls and Junction Falls - an amphitheater of cascading water. 

This historic walking circuit is popular with locals and travellers alike.

properties.name: Saddleback Mountain Lookout
properties.description: Saddleback Mountain Lookout is a popular scenic viewpoint located in Kiama. It offers stunning panoramic views of the town, the Kiama coastline, and the Illawarra region. The lookout is accessible via a short drive from the town center, or by a walking trail from the Kiama Blowhole. From the lookout, visitors can enjoy views of Kiama's harbor, beaches, and town center. They can also see the Kiama Blowhole, a natural rock formation that shoots water up into the air when the waves crash against it. On a clear day, it is possible to see all the way to the Illawarra Mountains to the west.

properties.name: Perrys Lookdown
properties.description: Perrys Lookdown is located at the end of Hat Hill Road, Blackheath. It offers grand views from the top of the escarpment into the World Heritage National Park and the Grose Valley. From here there is a bushwalk which is the shortest but steepest descent into the famous Blue Gum Forest. Five and a half hours return

properties.name: One Tree Point Lookout and Picnic Area
properties.description:
One Tree Point Lookout and Picnic Area is a popular spot in Tuross Head, NSW, Australia. It is located at the southern end of One Tree Beach and north of Main Beach. The lookout offers expansive views of the ocean and is a good land-based vantage point for whale watching in the spring. 

There is a paved path that leads to a lone Norfolk Island Pine, marking the Tuross headland lookout. There are also picnic tables, barbecues, and a cycle path.

properties.name: Hay Weir
properties.description: The Hay Weir (Also known as Johnston Park) is located approximately 15 kilometres from Hay on the Maude Road. Facilities available include barbecue, picnic area, and toilets. The Hay Weir is also an extremely popular fishing spot, where fisherman have been known to catch Murray Cod up to 70 pounds in weight!

properties.name: Hassans Walls Lookout
properties.description:
Hassans Walls Lookout is the highest scenic lookout in the Blue Mountains, Australia, offering breathtaking views of the region. 

Perched atop a towering sandstone cliff, the lookout provides panoramic vistas of the surrounding valleys, mountains, and forests.

properties.name: Hargraves Lookout
properties.description:
A pleasant drive to the western end of Shipley Plateau passing local apple orchards will bring you to Hargraves Lookout and provide magnificent views over the rural Megalong Valley. 

At the very end of Shipley Plateau is Mount Blackheath, a popular hang-gliding site from a purpose built ram near the lookout.

properties.name: Gan Gan Hill Lookout
properties.description:
Gan Gan Hill Lookout is a captivating natural attraction nestled in Port Stephens, Australia, offering visitors a panoramic vista of breathtaking beauty. 

This scenic lookout, perched atop Gan Gan Hill, provides a stunning 360-degree view of the surrounding landscapes. As you ascend, you'll be treated to vistas of pristine beaches, lush forests, and the sparkling waters of Port Stephens, making it a photographer's paradise and an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts. 

The lookout is easily accessible by car, making it a must-visit destination for those seeking to immerse themselves in the region's natural splendor while enjoying a bird's-eye view of this coastal paradise.

properties.name: Table Top Hotel
properties.description: Stop, shake off the dust and visit the iconic Ettamogah Pub. Based upon Ken Maynard's cartoons, the original Ettamogah Pub is situated 15 kilometres north of Albury on the Hume Highway, an easy drive from the city.

properties.name: Crackneck Point Lookout
properties.description:
Uncover the secret of local whale watchers at Crackneck lookout. Make a beeline for this atmospheric lookout between May and August and you may just be rewarded with views of whales swimming past on their northern migration, and surfers can check out wave conditions.

Crackneck lookout is a fantastic place to take a picnic lunch and soak up the sunshine with your family while overlooking Bateau Beach, Shelly Beach and towards The Entrance.

If you park at Bateau Beach you can walk on the trail up to the lookout and if your feeling extra energetic you can carry on to the next lookout (about a 7 km round trip) which overlooks Forresters Beach.

properties.name: Botanic Gardens
properties.description: Located at the base of Willans Hill and set over 22 acres, the Wagga Wagga Botanic Gardens are a must see Wagga attraction. A mini zoo, children's adventure playground, free flight aviary and rainforest section are open to visitors. Other attractions include a Tree Chapel, Chinese Garden, Camellia and Cactus Gardens and Miniature Railway.

properties.name: Abrahams Bosom Reserve & Walking Tracks
properties.description:
Abrahams Bosom Reserve is a beautiful coastal reserve located on the South Coast of New South Wales, Australia. It is known for its stunning beaches, secluded coves, and scenic walking tracks.

The reserve is home to a variety of different walking tracks, ranging from easy to challenging. Some of the most popular tracks include:

* Coomies Walk: This 3.3-kilometre loop track takes you past some of the reserve's most beautiful beaches, including Wilsons Beach, Abrahams Bosom Beach, and Mermaid Pools.
* Wreck Walk: This 2.5-kilometre track takes you past the remains of the SS Merimbula, a shipwreck that occurred in 1928.
* Little Beecroft Head Track: This short but challenging track takes you to the top of Little Beecroft Head, where you can enjoy stunning views of the coastline.

properties.name: Tucki Tucki Aboriginal Bora Ring - Ceremonial Grounds
properties.description:
Tucki Tucki Aboriginal Bora Ring is one of the several Tribal Ceremonial Grounds in the district and has been fenced and marked with a description board. 
Ceremonial grounds are very significant to the Aboriginal people and are usually marked with a Bora Ring. The Bora Ring is a raised platform of dirt arranged in a circle, which was last used in the 1800s is located 15kms south of Lismore on Wyrallah Road; it is a peaceful place, next to a cemetery with views to Parrots Nest and Blue Knob.

properties.name: Sydney Scenic View Point
properties.description:
View point at tghe base of the Harbour Bridge that gives an excellent view back of the City, Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

An iconic image of Sydney.

properties.name: Blackbutt Reserve Wildlife Exhibits
properties.description:
Blackbutt Nature Reserve is a 182-hectare reserve located in the Newcastle region of New South Wales. It is home to a variety of native plants and animals, including koalas, kangaroos, and wallabies. 

The reserve also has a number of walking trails, a wildlife exhibit, and a rainforest area.

properties.name: Campground
properties.description: Unpowered sites. State forest background

properties.name: Morundah Rest Area
properties.description:
800m+ off the Newell, so little noise. Shady trees, water and fish jumping. 
Fireplace there but bring your own wood. Toilets 700m away in town. Pub does good pizza.

properties.name: Wedding Cake Rocks
properties.description:
Wedding Cake Rock in Sydney is a stunning coastal rock formation located in the Royal National Park. Its name comes from its resemblance to a multi-tiered wedding cake. This Instagram-worthy spot offers breathtaking ocean views, making it a popular destination for hikers and nature enthusiasts. Please exercise caution when visiting, as the rock is fragile and potentially dangerous if approached too closely. 

Enjoy the natural beauty of this iconic Sydney landmark while respecting its preservation.

properties.name: Bondi to Bronte Coastal Walk
properties.description:
The Bondi to Bronte Coastal Walk is a 2.5-kilometre (1.5-mile) clifftop walk that links two of Sydney's most iconic beaches, Bondi Beach and Bronte Beach. The walk offers stunning views of the Pacific Ocean and the Sydney coastline, and is a popular spot for walkers, runners, and cyclists. 

The walk starts at Bondi Beach and follows the coastline north, passing by Tamarama Beach and Mackenzies Bay. There are a number of lookout points along the way where you can stop to take in the views. The walk ends at Bronte Beach, where you can cool off in the ocean or enjoy a coffee at one of the many cafes.

From May until November, the Bondi Coastal Walk is a great place to spot humpback whales in the distance, with the absolute best time of the year being end of June to early July. There are plenty of vantage spots along the walk, which is elevated enough so you can spot the whales.

properties.name: Mrs Macquarie's Chair
properties.description:
Mrs Macquarie's Chair is a sandstone rock bench located at Mrs Macquarie's Point in Sydney, Australia. It was carved out of the rock in 1810 by convicts for Elizabeth Macquarie, the wife of Governor Lachlan Macquarie.

The chair is located in a scenic spot with stunning views of Sydney Harbour, the Sydney Opera House, and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. It is a popular tourist destination and is also used by locals for picnicking, sunbathing, and simply enjoying the views.

properties.name: Sydney Opera House
properties.description:
The Sydney Opera House is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most popular tourist destinations in Australia. It hosts a wide variety of performances, including opera, ballet, theatre, and concerts. 

The Sydney Opera House is a symbol of Australia and its culture. It is a place where people from all over the world come together to experience the arts.

properties.name: Hidden valley Camping and Tea Gardens
properties.description:
Paradise Valley is a great place for some peace and quiet, surrounded by the Border Ranges National Park. Come and enjoy the local fauna and flora, go for a day drive, or just sit around and relax.
Being very isolated, it is definitely a 'bring your own' everything venue. Open fires are available.

properties.name: Mungo Shearers Quarters
properties.description: Mungo National Park is located in Outback New South Wales and can be easily accessed from Wentworth, Mildura, Balranald and Broken Hill. Located within the park are the Mungo Shearer's Quarters.

properties.name: Delicate campground
properties.description: Create some family memories at Delicate campground. Being located in the Goolawah Regional Park area, you can even bring your dog along to the campground to join in the the family snaps. A fabulous spot for beach camping, this back-to-basics campground has all the ingredients for a classic beach holiday.
properties.fees: $24 per site for 2ppl. Additional adults $12 each. $6 children 5-15 yo

properties.name: Woolomin Reserve
properties.description: This site has good amenities (incl. two powered sites at AUD7 per night) and pleasant riverside, which is great for swimming and fishing (subject to water levels). It is located close to town, yet feels secluded and private. It is suitable for all vehicles and has plenty of space for several campervans. There is a dump point close by at Chaffey Dam and 30hrs max stay limit applies.

properties.name: Wilks Park Rest Area
