properties.description: This spacious camping area with good facilities and a dump point is located on the banks of the river, close to town. It's designed for self-contained vehicles only and suitable for big rigs with maximum stay of 72hrs. Tents are not allowed here.

properties.name: Warri Camping Reserve
properties.description: Great and spacious riverside camping area with good facilities, located just off the highway. It is surrounded by a forest and is therefore shaded and quiet. There is a nice fishing spot and swimming is permitted here, too.

properties.name: The Pines Camping Area at Olney State Forest
properties.description: This camping area with good facilities is located in a pine forest. It offers a few pleasant walking tracks among the pine trees and a peaceful surrounding. There is a rock pool close to the campground. It's not suitable for big rigs, however caravans can park nearby in Abbots Falls Track - 4WD recommended.

properties.name: The Basin Camping Area - Olney State Forest
properties.description: Lovely walk-in camping area with good facilities, located by the road and the creek. The area offers scenic views, pleasant walking tracks, plenty of shade and good swimming spots.

properties.name: Sandy Beach Reserve
properties.description: Spacious and grassy rest area located by the Murrumbidgee River and easily accessible via a dirt track (200m) off the main road. It has good amenities and plenty of camping spots with shaded and sunny areas. There is restricted access to the fast-flowing river, however swimming and fishing, as well as some water sports, are permitted here.

properties.name: Rixs Creek Rest Area
properties.description: This newly renovated roadside sealed rest area with good amenities is located close by the highway. The area is exposed and there is little to no shade. It will also get noisy, due to its location and trucks pulling in and out of this site. There is a designated parking area for big vehicles (caravans and trucks).

properties.name: Patons Clearing - Meryla State Forest
properties.description: This beautiful, spacious camping area with no amenities is located in a forest by Meryla Road. It offers scenic views and a peaceful atmosphere. 4WD is recommended and the site is suitable for big groups.

properties.name: Mendooran Rest Area
properties.description: Very large, scenic and shaded campground with great amenities (incl. cold showers) located on the bank of the Castlereagh River, close to the village and right behind the police station. It is very scenic and offers great bird watching opportunities. The nearby village has a pub, store and petrol station. There is 48hrs limit.

properties.name: Mary Flynn Reserve - Bridle Track
properties.description: This beautiful, grassy camping area with good facilities is located on the bank of the river. It offers scenic views, walking tracks and a good fishing spot. Swimming, canoeing and other water sports are permitted here. 4WD and off-road camper trailers are recommended.

properties.name: Krambach Park Rest Area
properties.description: This spacious, grassy overnight rest area with good amenities is located off the Bucketts Way. There is some shade available and it's easily accessible by all vehicles.

properties.name: Gwydir River Camps
properties.description: This area features a selection of different campgrounds scattered along the river bank. It is located 8km from town with a good variety of pubs, cafes and other services. Gwydir River Camps have no facilities, however, they provide river access, large grassy sites and plenty of shade. Swimming, fishing and water sports are allowed here. It is best to access any campground in this are by a 4x4 vehicle.

properties.name: Gum Flat Public Reserve
properties.description: This is a very spacious, grassy and shaded campground located at the bank of the Gwyder River. It has no amenities, however, the town with its shops and services is only a short drive away. The views at this site are very scenic and it feels private, due to its large size. To access (in dry weather only!), drive 3km further into the land at the marked turn-off, just off the highway.

properties.name: Gum Bend Lake
properties.description: This campground is located by a man-made lake with permanently high water level. It has fantastic facilities with hot shower and children's playground. The area is large and grassy and it's only 3km from town. It can also be accessed by a slightly longer bike path. There are fishing, swimming and water sports activities available nearby. Please donate up to $10 if you're making use of this place.

properties.name: Grey Gum Cafe
properties.description: This overnight rest area with fantastic facilities is located off the Putty Road. The pub offers a big choice of tasty meals and drinks. Maximum stay is 48hrs.

properties.name: Grawin Club in the Scrub
properties.description: This free campground located beside the Club is available for its guests and provides basic facilities. The Club also offers meals and drinks and orgnises some events. If you are not a member of the Club, please sign in before entering and talk to the staff ahead of setting up your camp. Dogs are not allowed on this site.

properties.name: Gordon VC Rest Area
properties.description: This rest area with good facilities incl. toilets, picnic tables and a rubbish bin, is located close to Hume highway (Northbound traffic only) and is accessed via Belanglo Road.

properties.name: Oberon Showgrounds
properties.description: Camping area at Oberon Showground. Sites are powered with toilets and shower included in the price. Call the number provided to arrange a site.

properties.name: Urbenville Forest Park
properties.description: Urbenville Forest Park has sites for tents, and caravans in a forest setting within the Urbanville town boundaries. Facilities include picnic tables, wood barbecues, and toilets. Camping permits can be obtained through Urbenville News.

properties.name: Wee Jasper Reserves
properties.description: Wee Jasper offers a variety of primitive bush camping grounds on a first-come-first-serve basis.
properties.fees: AUD $10 Adult, Children under 16 are free.

properties.name: Lismore Showgrounds
properties.description: The Lismore Showgrounds has powered and unpowered sites, both at the same rate. Basic amenities are provided as well as hot showers. The site features a number of seasonal events including a weekly farmers market on Saturdays.
properties.fees:
AUD $25 per 2ppl
Children under 12 free
Extra adult $5 per night

properties.name: Knorrit Flat Riverside Retreat & Camping Ground
properties.description: Knorrit Flat Riverside Retreat features large grassy campsites, on 16 hectares of private property along the Nowendoc River. Campers can go swimming, fishing, tubing and canoeing in the river. Facilities include flush toilets, hot showers, BBQs and fireplaces. Bookings can be made by phone or through the website. Extra fees apply during peak times.
properties.fees: AUD $13 Adult; AUD $7.00 Child; Extra fees apply during peak times.

properties.name: Barrington River Reserve Campground
properties.description: Barrington Reserve offers basic camping facilities along the Barrington River where swimming, canoeing, and fishing can be enjoyed. Pit toilets, rubbish bins, fire pits and picnic tables are available for campers’ use. Bookings and camping permits are obtained through the Barrington Store in Barrington village.

properties.name: Bells Bay Campground
properties.description: Bells Bay is a small, basic bush camping area, surrounded by forest. Bells Bay is a basic campsite with compost toilets, shelter sheds, rain water tanks, barbecues and boat ramps. Bring your own drinking water. The Toonumbar Dam provides a multitude of attractions from fishing, to boating. Canoes can be hired at House 750. Pay camping fees at the self- registration box and display the ticket in your vehicle’s windscreen.

properties.name: Canowindra Caravan Park
properties.description: Canowindra Caravan Park features shady campsites, surrounded by trees, and overlooking the Belubula River. The park is near the town and has modern amenities. .

properties.name: Eugowra Showground
properties.description: Eugowra Showground offers short term camping with powered and unpowered sites, as well as modern amenities.

properties.name: Wingham Showground
properties.description: Call or email for enquiries and bookings

properties.name: Penrose Park
properties.description: Penrose Park provides a peaceful location for camping with numerous activities to be enjoyed. Cabins, powered and unpowered sites are available, with facilities including toilets, showers and BBQs. The park is family- friendly with tennis courts, playgrounds, walking trails and a bush golf course. Lots of native wildlife visit the area, including wild kangaroos.

properties.name: Bigga Recreation Centre
properties.description: Bigga Recreation Ground is located in the centre of the village, with flat unpowered campsites and shady trees. Amenities including The General store, The Golf Club and The Federal Hotel are short distance. Facilities include disabled toilets and hot showers.  Camping here is free for three days, after which it’s $10 per day.

properties.name: Ebor Falls Hotel Motel
properties.description: Ebor Falls Hotel Motel offers powered and unpowered sites in a grassy area behind the hotel. Facilities include flushing toilets and hot showers. Call for enquiries and bookings.

properties.name: Camp Kurrajong
properties.description: Camp Kurrajong is a family friendly campground that caters to large groups with large on-site dormitories and 13 acres of grassy land. Facilities include ablution blocks, with hot water, entertainment and activity halls, large commercial kitchen, an outdoor barbecue area, and an absail tower. Call for current rates and bookings.

properties.name: Gunyah - Deepwater River Camping
properties.description: Gunyah - Deepwater River Camping offers riverside bush camping with no facilities.

properties.name: Trundle Showgrounds
properties.description: Trundle Showgrounds camping area provides powered sites for caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, and bins. Pets are allowed. Payment can be made at Lucky 7 store. Advanced bookings are preferred.

properties.name: Split Rock Dam
properties.description: Split Rock Dam camping area provides powered and unpowered sites for vehicle based caming, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include showers, toilets, picnic table and shelter, boat ramp and drinking water. Activities include swimming, fishing, boating, waterskiing and canoeing. Camp fees can be paid at the Council in Manilla.

properties.name: Yeoval Showground
properties.description: Yeoval Showground provides powered and unpowered camp sites suitable for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities are limited. There are toilets and bins provided. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Yerong Creek Campground
properties.description: Yerong Creek Campground provides sites for caravans and motorhomes. Power is available. Facilities include toilets, showers, and water. Pets are permitted.

properties.name: Wanaaring Store & Caravan Park
properties.description: Wanaaring Store & Caravan Park provides powered and unpowered sites, suitable for tents, caravand and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, BBQ, fire place, picnic tables and bins. Fuel and kiosk are available.

properties.name: Toongi Hall Campground
properties.description: Located off Obley Road, Toongi Hall camping area provides sites for tents, carvans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, bins, picnic tables and drinking water. Pets are allowed. $5 donation requested.

properties.name: Alstonville Showground
properties.description: Located on the Bruxner Hwy, Alstonville Showground provides powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include showers, toilets, picnic tables, BBQ and bins. Pets are allowed. There is a caretaker on-site. Bookings can be made by phone.
properties.fees: AUD $20 per unpowered  AUD$25 per powered site

properties.name: Bribbaree Showground
properties.description:
Bribbaree Showground is situated in a quaint country village at the edge of the Hilltops Region. 

This pet-friendly site provides campgrounds suitable for caravans, motorhomes, and camper trailers, with amenities including toilets, showers, drinking water, power hookups, and waste bins.

properties.name: Junction City Hotel
properties.description: Junction City Hotel offers a range of accomodation including self contained cabins and a caravan site behind the hotel. Caravan sites are powered.

properties.name: Wee Waa Showgrounds
properties.description: Wee Waa Showgrounds provides powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, and bins.

properties.name: Berrigan Lions Caravan Park
properties.description: Located 30 minutes from the Murray River, Berrigan Lions Caravan Park provides powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, caravans and large rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, laundry area, BBQ, children's playground, and picnic tables. Pets are permitted. Bookings can be made by phone.

properties.name: Coolendel Bush Camp
properties.description: Situated on the Shoalhaven River, Coolendel Bush Camp provides unpowered tent sites, cabins and a bunkhouse. Facilities include amenitites block, hot showers, fireplaces, gas BBQ area, shelter shed and flush toilets. There is also a kiosk where you can purchase basic supplies. Activities include biking, bush walking, canoeing and fishing.  Bookings can be made by phone.
properties.fees: Peak- AUD $32 per adult/ $17 per child. Shoulder- AUD$25/$16. Off Peak- AUD $19/$10

properties.name: Kyogle Showground
properties.description: Kyogle Showground provides a camping area with powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, camper trailers, and large rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, BBQ, water and bins. There is a manager on site. Bookings can be made by phone.

properties.name: Yetman Caravan Park
properties.description: Yetman Caravan Park provides powered sites for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, picnic tables and fire place. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Inverell Showground
properties.description: Inverell Showground provides sites for tents, caravans and long rigs. There are 6 powered sites available. Facilities include toilets, showers, drinking water and bins. Camp fees can be paid to the caretakers.

properties.name: Copeton Northern Foreshores
properties.description: Copeton Northern Foreshores  camping area provides powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, and caravans. Facilities include toilets, showers, laundry area, bins, fireplace and picnic tables. There is also a children's playground, boat ramp and fossicking site. Dogs are not permitted. Activities include swimming, fishing and walking trails. There is a resident caretaker and kiosk for basic supplies.
properties.fees: AUD $10 per night for 2 adults & 2 children-  unpowered $15 powered. Extra person $2

properties.name: Thomas Boyd Trackhead
properties.description: Thomas Boyd Trackhead camping area offers sites for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and caravans. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, picnic tables, and drinking water. Dogs are allowed. Activities include swimming, fishing and walking trails.

properties.name: Pimpara Lake Station
properties.description: Situated on the lake-side, Pimpara Lake Station provides bush camping or the fully-equipped shearer's quarters. Facilities include showers ($5) and toilets. Firewood is porvided. Dogs are allowed. Local activities include 4WD tours and walking tracks.
properties.fees: AUD $10 per person- bush camping. $5 per shower

properties.name: Manildra Showground
properties.description: Manildra Showground provides powered and unpowered sites. Facilities include toilets, water, picnic tables, and dump point.  Pets are allowed.
properties.fees: AUD $10 per vehicle per night unpowered. $15 powered.

properties.name: Town Beach
properties.description: Located off Newell Highway, Town Beach camping area is located in Tocumwal Reginal Park. Sites are suitable for caravans and motorhomes. Facilities include toilets, drinking water, showers and mobile phone coverage. Dogs are permitted.

properties.name: Maclean Showground
properties.description:
The Maclean showground is a great camping spot right on the Clarence River and it is located on a short 800-metre walk into the CBD.

Offering a maximum of 10 campsites, for a three-night stay, but it is first in first served basis as you are not able to book your sites. There are designated areas to park with some sites along the river bank, and the rest around the main ring. The sites are all grassed and reasonably flat.

Minimal facilities with toilets and no showers, but they do have a dump point. Pets are permitted on a leash.

Since there are limited sites available it is best to call ahead to check availability.

properties.name: Wattle Flat Heritage Land (North)
properties.description: Wattle Flat Heritage Land (North) offers bush camping for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, bings, and picnic tables. You will need to bring your own drinking water. There are numerous walking trails in the area. Dogs are permitted. Payment can be made at the hardware store. There is a maximum stay of 14 days.

properties.name: Tamworth Airport Rest Area
properties.description: Tamworth Airport Rest Area provides an overnight rest area and day use area. It has access for caravans and big rigs. Facilities include toilets, drinking water, BBQ and picnic tables. There is a maximum stay of 20 hours.

properties.name: Taralga Showgrounds
properties.description: Taralga Showgrounds is suitable for tents, camping trailers and caravans offering powered and non-powered sites. Facilities include toilets, showers and drinking water. Campfires are allowed. Payments can me made at Taralga Gifts & Goodies, the Information Centre or the General Store & Tea Rooms.
properties.fees:
Powered site- $22
Unpowered site- $16
Payable at General Store or Taralga Information Centre

properties.name: Morisset Showground
properties.description: Morisset Showground provides a quiet powered camping area for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, showers, water and mobile phone coverage. In the area you can enjoy the lake, Watagan Forest, or showground events. You do not need to make a booking for short term camping .
properties.fees: $20 for 2 ppl with power + $5 per extra person

properties.name: Wharf Reserve
properties.description: Wharf Reserve camping area offers unpowered sites for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and caravans. Facilities include toilets, wood fireplace, picnic tables and drinking water. You will need to bring your own firewood. Attractions include swimming, fishing, sailing and canoeing. Advanced bookings are recommended.

properties.name: Shallow Crossing Camp Ground
properties.description: Shallow Crossing Camp Ground offers bush camping along the Shoalhaven River. Facilities include drop toilets, hot showers, BBQ and amenitites block. A great place for fishing, birdwatching, canoeing and bush walking.
properties.fees: $15 per adult and kids under 12 are free

properties.name: Pine View Station
properties.description:
Pine View Station operates as a family owned organic sheep and cattle property. There is a range of accomodation available, including a campgaround, farm stay or B&B. 

The campground is suitable for tents, caravans and big rigs. Facilities include toilets, water and bins. Dogs are permitted.

properties.name: Boomi Community Co-Op Campground
properties.description: Boomi Community Co-Op Campground is a community run campground. It offers powered and unpowered sites for tents, caravans and large rigs. Facilites include toilets, hot showers, drinking water, laundromat, BBQ and public phone. There is a swimming pool, spa and grocery store in the area.

properties.name: White Cliffs Opal Pioneer Reserve Caravan Park
properties.description: Opal Pioneer Caravan & Camping Tourist Park offers powered and unpowered sites campsites. There are also 2 cabins on site with a double bed and bunk beds, microwave, fridge and TV. Facilities for campsite include coin operated laundry and hot showers, electric BBQ's, and children's playground. This site is pet friendly.

properties.name: Maitland Showground
properties.description:
Maitland Showground offers spacious grassed sites available for camping on our grounds subject to availability.

No bookings are necessary, please use entrance at corner of Blomfield and Anzac Streets. Powered sites are available.  

We have an amenities block which is maintained during the working week only.

During Market days, camping is restricted to the first three rows on the left at the entrance of the showgrounds.

During our Maitland Annual Show and Groovin the Moo and some other events - NO camping is available.

properties.name: Sackville Ski Gardens
properties.description: Sackville Ski Gardens offers waterfront powered sites suitable for tents, and motorhomes. Facilities include playground & pool.

properties.name: Sandalwood Van & Leisure Park
properties.description: Sandalwood Van and Leisure Park is located in NSW. This campsite is suitable for tents, caravans, camper trailers and motorhomes. There are both powered and unpowered sites available. Facilities include toilets, BBQ facilities, playground, amenities block, access to laundry facilities and a swimming pool.

properties.name: Mullaley Hotel
properties.description: Mullaley Hotel camping area consists of 20 campsites. Facilities include picnic tables, toilets, drinking water. Meals and refreshments are available from the hotel pub or roadhouse. Usually has a special meal for cheap for friday evening. Can pay with Eftpos.

properties.name: Group Campground
properties.description: The perfect location for exploring Willandra Creek , Willandra campground offers 10 non powered sites for bush camping. Enjoy the Wilandra Billabong Weir and Nilla Yannagalang Billana  walking track. Sites are suitable for tents and vehicle based camping. Facilities include toilets, BBQ and carpark. Bore water is available, but must be treated before drinking. Generators are not permitted. Bookings are not available.

properties.name: Apsley Falls Campground
properties.description: Enjoy scenic waterfall views, walking and wildlife at Apsley Falls campground. There are 15 campsites available for tents, camper trailers, caravans and vehilce based camping. Facilities include toilets, carpark, BBQ and picnic tables. Untreated water is available. Bookings are not required

properties.name: Warrabah National Park
properties.description: Warrabah campground is located beside the Namoi River and offers vehicle-based camping. Facilities include toilets, picinic tables, BBQ and carpark. Enjoy bushwalking, swimming, canoeing, birdwatching, and plenty of wildlife. Firewood is not supplied. Don't forget your sunscreen and water.
properties.fees: AUD $5 per adult AUD $3 per child

properties.name: Camp Blackman Campground
properties.description: Camp Blackman is a favored base for exporing the Warrumbungle National Park. It consists of 102 powered and unpowered campsites, suitable for tents, camper trailers, caravans, and camping beside vehicles. It comes equipped with picnic tables, BBQ, public phone, amenitites block, showers and toilets. Wood fires are permitted but water is not available. Walking and cycling tracks are near by the campsite. Also in the area are kangaroos, cockatoos, kookaburras and butcher birds.
properties.fees: $6 per adult for unpowered sites AUD $3 per child or $10 per adult for powered sites $5 per child

properties.name: Hobart Beach Campground
properties.description: Hobart Beach Campground in located in Bournda National Park. It provides the perfect coastal holiday offering swimming, fishing, paddling and walking. There are 63 campsites suitable for tents, camper trailers and caravans. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities, showers and toilets.

properties.name: Finley Showgrounds
properties.description: This spacious, grassy camping area with fantastic facilities is located off the highway. It offers powered sites for a small fee. You need to be self-contained here. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Cottadidda State Forest
properties.description: Secluded rest area with no facilities, located close to the river and 8km from the town centre. It offers scenic views and walking tracks. There are plenty of trees around, which provide shelter and shade. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Coolatai Hall
properties.description: Very spacious and grassy campground with fantastic facilities, located close to town. It provides toilets and hot showers. Travellers can also stay at the grounds around the hall. There is an honesty box system.

properties.name: Cathedral Reserve
properties.description: This is a large, level and grassy camp ground with good amenities and a picturesque location. There are bollards to prevent cars from parking on the grass or camping areas, two old pit toilets and two modern composting toilets, as well as some BBQs. A great gateway to the Cathedral of Ferns Walk.

properties.name: Campbells River - Dog Rocks State Forest
properties.description: Very spacious and shaded campground with no facilities, located on a grassy clearing by Campbells River. It is accessible via Swallows Nest Rd and is a popular fishing destination among tourists and locals alike.

properties.name: Burrumbuttock Hall
properties.description: Camping ground with good facilities located behind a Town Hall, with easy access to a store, pub and various dining options. Power is available at AUD5 per night, donations are appreciated.

properties.name: Burcher Camping Ground
properties.description: Located 15 km from town, this large campsite provides great amenities which include clean showers and flushing toilets, as well as a playground. This site is spacious, shaded and easily accessible from the main road. There is an honesty box with recommended donation of AUD5 a night.

properties.name: Bungleboori Camping Area
properties.description: Large and spacious campground located on the Newnes Plateau discovery trail. It has level surface, plenty of shade, but no amenities. Popular gateway to exploring the Glow Worm Tunnel or Gardens of Stone National Park.

properties.name: Buckingbong Camping Reserve
properties.description: Spacious but basic rest area located by the Murrumbidgee River and easily accessible via a dirt track off the main road. Private and secluded, with no amenities.

properties.name: Brewarrina Rest Area
properties.description: Spacious and shaded rest area situated on the banks of the Barwon River with no facilities. It's easily accessible via a dirt track running along the main road.

properties.name: Braidwood Servicemans Club
properties.description: **Camping anytime in the residential street(s) adjacent to the club constitutes illegal camping. Please see: NSW Government Planning Illegal Camping.***

properties.name: Boggabri North Rest Area
properties.description: Decent size drive-through bay located directly by the highway behind some trees. No facilities and limited shade.

properties.name: Bingara Riverside Camping Area
properties.description:
Well signposted riverside camp ground accessible through its southern entrance. Close to town. 

The detailed map at the gate provides exhaustive info on the area. There are no facilities and 7 days max stay.

properties.name: Amy Anderson Reserve
properties.description: Great riverside campground with good facilities and a very picturesque location. 4x4 drive recommended, but not essential.

properties.name: Cranky Rock Reserve Campsite
properties.description: $18/night for van with power. Nice spot in nature. Caretaker is very friendly.

properties.name: Yambulla Rest Area
properties.description: Next to main road, SC only. Covered picnic tables and fireplaces.

properties.name: Smoky Cape Camp Area
properties.description: This is a pleasant campground with shade trees (but don't camp under them because they may drop branches) there are shaded picnic tables and fire pits but no water or rubbish bins. There are non-flush toilets with disability access. National park fees of five dollars per adult per day apply and the maximum stay is six weeks. See http://www.nationalparks.nsw.gov.au/camping-and-accommodation

properties.name: Green Bank Campsite
properties.description: Free campsite not far from town. Large areas for parking, just find a spot and park up for the night. Around 600 metres of dirt road to get to the main camping area. Drive to the end of Brears Rd and follow the dirt road.

properties.name: Merriwa RSL Club
properties.description:
There are two areas at the back of the RSL that are available for free camping
There are no facilities though but the club does have toilet facilities available from 6.30am in the BBQ area and shower facilities during opening hours

properties.name: Sculptures in the Scrub Camping & Picnic Area
properties.description: Free camping and picnic area in Timallallie National Park. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and BBQ facilities available, please take your rubbish with you. Located on Sculptures in the Scrub Trail, 20km E of Baradine via Beveriges Rd and Duggins Rd. Dirt road. Signposted.

properties.name: Battery Rock Rest Area
properties.description: Nice little camping area with toilet and bin facilities. Among the trees and set back from the road.

properties.name: Berembed Weir
properties.description: Grassy camping spot on the N bank of Murrumbidgee River. Toilets and picnic tables here, but campsite is neglected and rubbish bins are rarely emptied. Located S of Old Narrandera Rd, 22.5km S of Matong via Deepwater Rd.

properties.name: Cunjigong Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area just off Olympic Hwy next to the creek. Picnic tables are the only facilities available at this shady, grassy park. Located on Frampton Rd, 12km SW of Cootamundra.

properties.name: Collarenebri Primitive Campground
properties.description: Rest area set back from Gwydir Hwy next to football grounds. Toilets, hot showers and and dump point here. It is also a short walk to Barwon River. Located at the S end of Collarenebri, 75km N of Walgett. Max stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Basket Swamp Campground
properties.description: Shady camp area in Basket Swamp National Park near the falls. Basic toilets and picnic tables available, shade from trees. 15km NE of Tenterfield, turn right onto dirt road (at -28.940084, 152.091064). Follow road NE for 10km to campsite.

properties.name: Dry River Rest Area
properties.description: Simple sealed rest area on Princes Hwy at the S end of Quaama. Has toilets, sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins. 11km S of Cobargo.

properties.name: Darbys Falls River Reserve
properties.description: Shady camping spot on the N bank of Lachlan River. Picnic tables are the only facilities, but there is a nearby toilet at Darby Falls carpark. Located 25km SE of Cowra. at the S end of Darby Falls. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Boorolong Creek Camp Area
properties.description: There are no facilities here at all but otherwise it is a nice place to camp among scattered gum trees and beside the creek.

properties.name: Cargelligo Weir
properties.description: Rest area on the banks of Lachlan River. Drop toilets and picnic tables available, and a nice spot for fishing. Located 75km W of Condobolin, via Condobolin-Lake Cargelligo Rd. Dirt road access.

properties.name: Ardlethan Rest Area
properties.description: Large sealed rest area on both sides of Newell Hwy. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and bins available, limited shade. 14km S of Ardlethan.

properties.name: Black Springs Campground
properties.description: Grassy camp area at the edge of Vulcan State Forest. Toilets and picnic tables available, and some shade from trees. Is also across the road from a general store. Located on Abercrombie Rd in Black Springs, 23km SW of Oberon.

properties.name: Pipers Reserve
properties.description: Shady rest area on the S bank of Murrumbidgee River. Basic toilet, picnic tables and rubbish bins available. 10km N of Galore via Weir Rd. Dirt road access.

properties.name: Red Bank Rest Area
properties.description: Large gravel overnight parking area with toilet, rubbish facilities and picnic tables.

properties.name: Newtons Crossing Area Yambulla State Forest
properties.description: 4km dirt road in, may be slippery in wet conditions, SC and non-SC. Toilet, picnic tables and fireplaces.

properties.name: Canowindra Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area on Nangar Rd next to Belabula River. No facilities but shade from trees. At the W end of Canowindra.

properties.name: Boggabri South Rest Area
properties.description: Medium sized parking area, SC only, with no facilities.

properties.name: Netallie Hill Rest Area
properties.description: Travel 18km towards Broken Hill from Wilcannia. Rest stop is well sign posted on left hand side. Gravel and hard core parking areas. Only  Suitable for self contained vehicles only due to no areas for tents and swags.  Facilities include Public Toilet, picnic area and bins.

properties.name: Swimming Pool Carpark
properties.description: Parking Area in Balranald, in front of the swimming pool. Follow the dump station signs on Church St, it's next to the water towers. You can stay here 24h maximum, only for self-contained vehicles.

properties.name: Ebor Rest Area
properties.description: Grassy rest area 600m S of town, next to sportsground. Picnic tables and bins available, no toilets here but some shade from trees.

properties.name: Gooloogong West Camp Area
properties.description: A free campsite near Gooloogong. Look for the signpost directing you to the First Anglican Church site. Located beside the river. Maximum stay is 72 Hours.  Site has no amenities but provides a large flat grassy area suitable for both self and non contained vehicles.. Flat grassy areas for tents- wet in winter, with a few trees providing shade in the summer months.

properties.name: Beardy Creek (Heritage Park) Rest Area
properties.description: At the entrance to this heritage Park you are greeted by a small part of Stonehenge. If you don't see the Stonehenge Memorial you have probably confused this site with the truck park that is about a kilometer to the north. There are non-flush toilets without disability access, sheltered picnic tables, barbecue places and rubbish bins but no water.

properties.name: Tookey Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Gravel rest area on Newell Hwy. Drop toilets, sheltered picnic tables and bins available. Trees provide some shade and block rest area from road view. 48km S of Moree.

properties.name: Millionth Acre Picnic Area
properties.description: Grassy camping and picnic area in Hampton State Forest. Toilets and picnic tables available, some shade from trees. Located on the corner of Jenolan Caves Rd and Duckmaloi Rd, 30km SW of Hartley.

properties.name: West of the Range Rest Area
properties.description: You can stop here overnight but you'd have to be very keen at as it is completely exposed to the road and near a factory/warehouse. There are non-flush toilets with disability access, rubbish bins and a picnic table nearby. There is only non-potable hand washing water

properties.name: Coles Bridge Camping Area
properties.description: Free camp area on S side of the Turon River. No facilities but a nice spot for fishing and swimming. Limited shade. Located just NW of Turondale Rd bridge, 42km SW of Ilford via Goulburn-Ilford Rd.

properties.name: Little Styx River Campground
properties.description:
Grassy rest area next to the river. Drop toilet (bring own paper) and picnic tables available here, and shade from trees.

At entrance to New England National Park on Pt Lookout Rd. Travel 10km E of Waterfall Way turnoff to get to camp. Dirt road.

properties.name: MacCullochs Range Rest Area
properties.description: Nice sealed rest area on Barrier Hwy. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables, bins and BBQs available here. There is also a nice sheltered playground for the kids and some shade from trees. 55km SE of Wilcannia.

properties.name: Round Hill Hotel
properties.description: Food and bar available in hotel/pub beside campground. Toilet available during pub opening hours. LPG bottle swaps available. Camping on good flat grassy ground with good drainage. Light tree coverage. On a quiet road.

properties.name: Old Bonalbo Pioneers Park
properties.description: Shady rest stop just off the road. Toilets, bins and picnic tables available. Located on Bonalbo-Urbenville Rd, 39km N of Tabulam. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Dead Mans Point
properties.description: Simple camping area next to Lake Cargelligo. Toilets and picnic tables available. Located 3.5km NE of town via McInnes Rd.

properties.name: Cockburn River Camp Area
properties.description: This is a really nice riverside site on a quiet out of town road. There are shaded and sunny campsites amongst the gum trees. There is a non-flush toilet without disability access, a large sheltered picnic table, and steel barbecue pits.

properties.name: Cassills Rest Area
properties.description: Well established free campsite, available to both SC and non-SC. Toilet facilities available.

properties.name: The Shanty Reserve
properties.description: Free camping spot on the banks of Murrumbidgee River. No facilities here, but it's a nice shady place where you can swim and fish. 6km N of Alfred town, via River Rd. Dirt road. Signposted.

properties.name: Severn River
properties.description: Rest area just off the road, on the W side of the river. Toilets, picnic tables and bins available, some shade from trees. 4km NE of Ashford.

properties.name: Derrick VC Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area just S of Hume Hwy. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and BBQ facilities available. Some shade from trees, some highway traffic noise. 20km W of Marulan, Westbound access only. Signposted.

properties.name: Swan Brook Rest Area
properties.description: Camping area just off Gwydir Hwy, on the N side of Swan Brook. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins available, limited shade. Might be some noise from highway.

properties.name: Wallagaraugh River Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed parking, SC and non-SC. Toilets, non-drinkable tap water and rubbish bins. Has sheltered area with fireplace.

properties.name: Caroona Hall Rest Area
properties.description: There is a flat grassy area next to the Caroona Hall just off the road. An old sheltered picnic table is now used as a horse stall. There are flush toilets that you could just squeeze a wheelchair into and nearby there is a tap. There is shade from some of the trees and plenty of flat areas to camp on.

properties.name: Bundure Rest Area
properties.description: Shady rest area on the side of Newell Hwy. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and bins available. Rest area is shared with trucks.

properties.name: Candelo Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed parking, SC and non-SC. Flush toilets, tap water, playground, picnic tables, gas BBQs and general rubbish bin.

properties.name: Conargo
properties.description: Parking area adjacent to tennis courts on Conargo Rd, next to sports oval. Toilets, picnic tables and some shade from trees here.

properties.name: Uarbry Hall Rest Area
properties.description: Small grassy area available for both SC and non-SC. Basic toilet facilities on-site. Gold coin donation appreciated. Access from East and West.

properties.name: Berry Park
properties.description: Small sealed bay located directly by the main road. Good facilities with 72hrs max stay.

properties.name: Birdcage Reserve Rest Area
properties.description: Rest Area located between the Newell Hwy/Sturt Hwy junction and Hay. Areas both part of the road. Unfiltered water. Toilets, rubbish bins and few picnic tables.

properties.name: Bedgerabong Showground
properties.description:
Grassy camping area at the showgrounds on N Condobolin Rd. Toilets and showers provided. 

At the E entrance to Bedgerebong.

properties.name: Wakool River
properties.description: Selection of free camping spots on the S side of Wakool River near the bridge. Drop toilets and picnic tables here, as well as the river for swimming and fishing.

properties.name: Marsden Rest Area
properties.description: Large sealed rest area on Newell Hwy. Toilets, picnic tables and bins available. Lots of space, limited shade. 68km SW of Forbes.

properties.name: Mulwala Regional Park
properties.description: Free bush camping area in the National Park next to Murray River. Picnic tables are the only facility, but you can fish and swim in the river. Located 4km SW of park entrance (-35.953344, 145.961314) on Mulwala-Barooga Rd, 11km N of Yarrawonga.

properties.name: Ponderosa Park Campground
properties.description: Shady, grassy camp spot in Hanging Rock State Forest. Toilets and picnic tables available here. Located on Forest Way, 16km W of Nundle. 8km of dirt road.

properties.name: Corang River Stop Area
properties.description: No facilities, no signs, SC only.

properties.name: Burraga Dam
properties.description: Large camping area next to the lake. Drop toilet available, also a nice spot for swimming and fishing. 3km NE of Burraga, via Arkstone Rd. Dirt road.

properties.name: Kings Plains Creek Campground
properties.description: Shady camp area next to the creek in Kings Plains National Park. Toilets, picnic tables and BBQ facilities available, and some nice bush walks in the area. Located just S of Ironbark Dr, 24km W of Wellingrove via Kings Plains Rd. Dirt road leading to campsite. Bookings required $6 per night for 2 people.

properties.name: Lachlan River Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area at the river, just off Kidman Way. No facilities here, but there is shade from trees. Located on Wallanthery Rd, 35km NE of Hillston beside old bridge.

properties.name: Ration Point Camping Area
properties.description:
Warning! Take care turning off the road into this campsite - the turn is steep and sharp. This is a beautiful campsite next to some deep swimming holes in the Turon River. There are plenty of level gravel sites by the river and amongst the trees. Rubbish bins and river rock fire pits are the only facilities
Self-contained Vehicles only.

properties.name: Burning Mountain Reserve
properties.description: Rest area 200m S of New England Hwy. Picnic tables, BBQs and some shade available. 100km S of Tamworth. Max stay: 20hrs.

properties.name: Alex Trevallion Park
properties.description: Walgett is a RV friendly town and offers a camping area for free. Public toilets, several picnic tables (some sheltered), rubbish bins, BBQ and a dump point available. Max stay: 2 nights in the designated areas. Suitable for all kinds of vehicles and tents. Parking on sandy area, might get dusty thought. Toilets old and not too clean, but okay. No lights. Please appreciate the courtesy of Walgett and leave this place clean. Well-established area, don't arrive too late. Safe place, police drive by frequently.

properties.name: Baden Park Rest Area
properties.description: Small rest stop on Barrier Hwy. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables, rubbish bins and BBQs available. Limited shade. 170km W of Cobar.

properties.name: Boomanoomana State Forest Camps
properties.description: Entrance to three camp areas within the forest. Picnic tables available, as well as swimming and fishing in the river. Signposted at entrance on Mulwala-Barooga Rd.

properties.name: Moonbi Lookout
properties.description:
Moonbi Lookout and Park is a spacious area perched on top of a hill, offering panoramic views of the Cockburn Valley and the surrounding countryside. The park is a popular destination for campers, picnickers, and nature lovers, providing a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

The lookout is the main attraction of the park, featuring a flat gravel site with ample space for vehicles and camping gear. The views from the lookout are simply breathtaking, encompassing rolling hills, lush greenery, and meandering rivers. On a clear day, one can even spot the distant peaks of the New England Range.

The park also features two sheltered picnic tables, perfect for enjoying a leisurely meal or simply relaxing and soaking in the scenery. For those who wish to cook outdoors, there are also barbecue pits available, along with rubbish bins for proper disposal of waste. However, it is important to note that there is no water source in the park, so visitors are advised to bring their own drinking water and supplies.

While the park is generally accessible, the toilets are located below the lookout, making them challenging for wheelchair users to access. It is hoped that the authorities will consider making the toilets more accessible in the future to ensure that everyone can enjoy the park's amenities.

properties.name: Cornish Rest Area
properties.description: Large rest area in the E of Cobar. Toilets, picnic tables and bins available, no shade. Area is shared with trucks, park on grass area behind toilet to keep away from truck parking area. SC only. Located on corner of Barrier Hwy and Kidman Way. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Four Mile Campground
properties.description: Free camping on the banks of Barwon River. Toilets, cold showers and BBQ facilities available. There is also a boat ramp, and you can swim and fish in the river. 8km SE of Brewarrina via Billybingbone Brae. Follow blue signs.

properties.name: Stockyard Creek Rest Area
properties.description: S 31 degrees 24.15.  E 152 degrees 07.430.    Suitable for big rigs, there is a road off into the forest ( didn't go in!). Whip birds and bell birds ... Very pretty Wood supplied.

properties.name: Brown Mountain
properties.description: Camping area on Snowy Mountain Hwy behind truck parking area. No facilities but some shade. 17km W of Bemboka.

properties.name: CWA Memorial Park
properties.description: Large grassy camp area in Girilambone. Toilet and shower available, and some playground equipment for the kids. Located on Murrawombie Rd, just NE of Mitchell Hwy. Signposted.

properties.name: Wheatley VC Rest Area
properties.description: Free sealed rest area just off Federal Hwy. Toilets, bins and picnic tables available, limited shade. Lots of space for turning around. 52km SW of Goulburn. On the E side of the highway but accessible from both sides.

properties.name: Straneys Bridge
properties.description: Free camping area next to the Lachlan River on Hodges Rd. No facilities but plenty of shade, and you could try fishing in the river. 37km W of Forbes.

properties.name: Ardlethan Community Park
properties.description: Large rest area with some shade from trees. On Ariah St in Ardlethan, next to bowling club. Toilets, BBQs and a playground available, and it's in the centre of town so lots of shops around. 4 power outlets available for a fee. SC only. Max stay: 72hrs.

properties.name: Bakers Shaft Reserve
properties.description: Nice, quite camp area on the banks of Belubula River. Long drop toilet available, some shade. No other facilities but is a good spot for swimming and fishing. 12km N of Mandurama, via Mandurama Burnt Yard Rd and a 5 km dirt road.

properties.name: Bowna Rest Area
properties.description: Gravel rest area near Mullengandra Creek. Sheltered picnic tables and bins available, limited shade. Located on Bowna Rd, 9km S of Mullengandra.

properties.name: Numeralla River Rest Area
properties.description: Large, gravel rest area just down from Monaro Hwy, next to Numeralla River. Toilets, sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins available. No shade. 21km N of Cooma, signposted from highway.

properties.name: Sheba Dams Reserve
properties.description: Large grassy free camping area high up the mountain. Toilets and picnic tables available, and is a nice spot for swimming and fishing. Shade from trees. Be aware of steep access road, can be difficult in a caravan.  Located on Barrys Rd, 10km SE of Nundle.

properties.name: Wanganella Weir
properties.description: Free camping area next to Billabong Creek. No facilities but it's a nice, quiet spot and you can fish in the creek. 1km SW of Wanganella via Cemetery Rd. Dirt road.

properties.name: Lake Benanee Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area in front of the Benanee lake, close to A20, Est of Robinvale. You can stay here for 96 hours maximum. Have some picnic tables, rubbish bins and toilets.

properties.name: Cowra Overnight Rest Area
properties.description: Large sealed rest area at the W end of Cowra, just W of Lachlan River. Toilets and sheltered picnic tables available, limited shade. SC only. There is a nearby dump point, 100m S. Located on Lachlan Valley Rd. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Edmondson VC Rest Area
properties.description: This spacious rest area is located close to the Rowes Lagoon. It is accessible from both sides of the highway via a 100m long sealed-turned-gravel track. Toilets, rubbish bins and picnic tables available. Plenty of trees provide shade and noise level is kept down to minimum. 27km SW of Goulburn.

properties.name: Bradley's Hutt
properties.description: Large rest area in Kosciuszko National Park. Drop toilet available, area can get cold. On Swampy Plains Creek Rd, 63km NW of Corryong via Alpine Way. Steep and winding access road.

properties.name: Lake Wyangan
properties.description: Free camping and picnic area next to the lake, Toilets, cold showers, picnic tables, rubbish bins and BBQs available. Also a nice area for swimming and fishing, and a nice area for kids. Located on Lakes Rd, 11km N of Griffith via Boorga. Signposted. Max stay: 72hrs.

properties.name: Cumborah Camp Reserve
properties.description: Quiet camping area located in the park at Cumborah. Toilet, picnic table and bin facilities available, as well as a playground. Some shade available.

properties.name: Jingellic Reserve
Warri Camping Reserve
properties.description: Large free camping area located just off Kings Hwy by the Shoalhaven River. Toilets, rubbish bins and picnic tables available. You can also swim in the river! Max stay:72 hours

properties.name: Lollback Rest Area
properties.description: Free camping on Gwydir Hwy, located just beside the Mann River Bridge. A small area but nice place to stay for a night. Drop toilet, sheltered picnic table, wood BBQ and rubbish bin facilities available. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: Florida Rest Area
properties.description: To locate this site, turn right just before the sign for Cobarshire with a moon cut out picture. Suitable for self contained and non self contained vehicles. Slight shade and not much grass for camping between the rail track and road. Gravel parking areas for self-contained vehicles. Other facilities include Toilets, bins and covered picnic areas.

properties.name: Chifley Dam Primitive Camping Area
properties.description: This waterside campground offers gated camp sites (for SC vehicles and tents) that open daily at 7:30am and close at 6pm or 9pm winter and summer time respectively. There are toilet, picnic table, rubbish bin and BBQ facilities available. Limited to 4 designated campsites, do not camp elsewhere in the area. To get here, follow Lagoon Rd S from The Lagoon, turn left onto Chifley Dam Rd and follow to the end. Max stay: 3 days.

properties.name: Anderson VC Rest Area
properties.description: Located just off the highway, this fantastic rest stop has toilets, BBQ, sheltered picnic areas, bins and a dump point. From the highway turn W onto Hadlow Dr (opposite Lookout) and then take the first right. This road leads to the rest area.

properties.name: Blacksmiths Inn Tavern and Cafe Park Area
properties.description: This is a basic stop roadside campsite. Use the tavern toilet during opening hours or go across the road to the nearby public toilet. There are some nice shady spots behind the log carved into a crocodile.

properties.name: Jerrys Plains Recreation Ground
properties.description: Large grassy parking area with good toilet facilities. Drive past the kids playground and tennis court and find a spot.

properties.name: Lions Lookout Rest Area
properties.description:
Lions Lookout Rest Area is a popular spot for travellers to take a break and enjoy the stunning views of the surrounding countryside. Located in the Capital Country region of New South Wales, Australia, the rest area is just a short drive from the city of Canberra.

From the lookout, visitors can see for miles in every direction, with rolling hills, farmland, and forests stretching out before them. On a clear day, it is even possible to see the snow-capped peaks of the Snowy Mountains in the distance.

In addition to the views, Lions Lookout Rest Area also offers a number of other amenities, including picnic tables, barbecue facilities, and a playground. There is also a toilet block and a small information centre.

properties.name: Majors Creek Recreation Reserve
properties.description: Large camping area in Majors Creek, with toilets, rubbish bins, tank water, picnic tables and a playground. Lots of space to park. Donation requested, can be left in donation box. Entry to area is off Hill St.

properties.name: Red Gum Campground
properties.description:
Red Gum campground is a beautiful riverside camping area, just a short drive from Batemans Bay, or a scenic trip on the river by boat, canoe, or kayak. This back-to-basics campground is perfect for a weekend escape or a day trip away from the holiday crowds.  Suitable for Tent, Camper trailer site, Camping beside my vehicle
2 tent sites and 2 camper trailer sites (unpowered)
There are no camping fees at this campground but a $6 booking fee applies

properties.name: CMCA RV Park Gunnedah
properties.description: Relaxing Gunnedah RV park! Self-contained rigs, BBQs, fire pit, water & dump point. Walk to town.

properties.name: Slim's Rooftop
properties.description: Whether its the weather, sunsets or the sushi, this lively rooftop bar is one of the best Sydney has to offer

properties.name: Narrandera Destination and Discovery Hub
properties.description:
## Narrandera Destination and Discovery Hub

Discover Narrandera in the heart of the Riverina on the crossroads of Irrigation Way, Newell and Sturt Highways. Located in Marie Bashir Park, offering ample parking for cars, buses, trucks and caravans, a beautiful location for a picnic or lunch break and an all-abilities adventure playground to allow the younger folk to wear off their excess energy or let the fur baby out for a stretch.  

Conveniently located along the Newell Highway just a block from the main street, East Street, the Narrandera Destination and Discovery Hub is your one stop shop for discovering the Riverina region.  With guides, maps, National Park information, koala, and wildlife spotting advice, free wi-fi as well as locally produced goods and souvenirs. Immerse yourself in Narrandera’s natural surroundings on the Murrumbidgee River, Flora and Fauna Reserve, Rocky Water Holes, and Narrandera Wetlands. Be intrigued by the historic sights of the town and admire the cultural and artistic offerings of Narrandera Shire.

We look forward to welcoming you, your family, and friends to the friendly town of Narrandera.

## [Leisure](https://narrandera.nsw.gov.au/tourism/leisure)

## [Accommodation](https://narrandera.nsw.gov.au/tourism/accommodation)

## [Events](https://www.narrandera.nsw.gov.au/events)

properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Merimbula Visitor Information Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Kiama Visitor Information Centre
properties.description: Nestled along the stunning coastline of New South Wales, Kiama is a hidden gem waiting to be discovered by adventurous road-trip enthusiasts. Known for its breathtaking landscapes, including the iconic Kiama Blowhole and the mesmerizing Kiama Coastal Walk, this charming town is a haven for those seeking a perfect blend of nature and adventure. The Kiama Visitor Information Centre serves as the ultimate gateway to this coastal paradise, offering a treasure trove of local secrets and travel tips. Be greeted by friendly locals eager to share insider knowledge about the best surf spots, hidden beaches, and where to catch the most magnificent sunset.

properties.name: Hunter Valley Visitor Information Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Greenfield Beach
properties.description:
Tucked away behind Greenfield Beach, this picnic area is known for its family-friendly atmosphere. It’s named after Colin Greenfield who lived in the area from 1942 until the 1970s.

Set up a picnic table, sprawl out on the grass or take a seat in the shelter shed – with its informative panels it doubles as an outdoor classroom. You’ll also find free barbecues to cook your alfresco feast.

Try a spot of birdwatching, work off your lunch on the White Sands walk and Scribbly Gum track, or head to the beach, just steps away. There are showers to wash salt from your skin after a swim or sandcastle session.

properties.name: Seven Mile Beach National Park
properties.description: Seven Mile Beach (NSW 400) is one of the longer beaches on the south coast, at 12.5 km (7.8 mile) in length, and is part of the Shoalhaven River delta. The large river has been supplying fine sand to build out this beach and its 1.5 km wide low barrier. Because of the fine sand, particularly in the northern end, the beach has a wide low gradient.

properties.name: Caves Beach
properties.description: Beach that has some limited facilities onsite

properties.name: Yamba Lighthouse
properties.description: Yamba Lighthouse is an active lighthouse located on Pilot Hill, a hill in Wooli Park, Yamba, New South Wales, Australia, south of the entrance of Clarence River. The current lighthouse was built in 1955, replacing a previous lighthouse built in 1880.

properties.name: Wattamolla Beach
properties.description: When you’re pining for the feel of sand between your toes, take the family and head to Wattamolla picnic area in Royal National Park. With loads of options to keep everyone happy, this is a popular place to base yourself while you’re exploring the park.

properties.name: Treachery Beach
properties.description:
Treachery Beach is one of those secret surfing spots you always hear about but wonder where they are. 
The headland here sticks out further into the ocean than any other point, which means it catches a lot of swell and so offers great surfing in a wild location. The surf can be large at times. This beach is not patrolled.

properties.name: Terrigal Beach
properties.description:
One of the best-known beaches on the Central Coast, Terrigal Beach is a cosmopolitan seaside town, as popular with locals as it is with visitors.

The patrolled beach offers safe swimming all year round and has a small ocean rock pool tucked into the cliff at the southern end.

properties.name: Stockton Beach
properties.description: Stockton Beach is situated at the southern end of Newcastle Bight, where there is a sweeping expanse of sand and sand dunes, and views stretching back to Port Stephens.

properties.name: Silver Beach
properties.description:
Silver Beach is a stretch of beach on the Kurnell peninsula fronting Botany Bay. The public baths are netted in Summer months.



Silver Beach is off leash 24 hours a day between the third and fourth groynes (jetties) from the western end. Dogs are prohibited on Silver Beach at all other locations.

properties.name: Shelly Beach
properties.description: Shelly Beach is located in Manly and forms part of Cabbage Tree Bay, a protected marine reserve which lies adjacent to North Head and Fairy Bower. With a maximum depth of approximately 12 metres, Shelly Beach has become popular with Scuba Divers and Snorkelers alike with a large variety of marine life.

properties.name: Sandon Point Beach
properties.description:
Sandon Point Beach is extremely popular for surfing and many surfing tournaments have been held at this beach. 

There is plenty of parking and open reserve for picnics and gatherings. Sandon Point Beach is located at Bulli, 11 kilometres north of the Wollongong central business district.

properties.name: Rainbow Beach
properties.description: Rainbow Beach trends south-south west for 2.5 kilometres from the dolerite rocks at Middle Rock Point to the sedimentary rocks at Bonny Hills. The beach is backed by a fore dune, then two kilometres long Duchess Gully Creek that drains across the southern end of beach, where it is called Little Vinegar Creek.

properties.name: Port Kembla Beach
properties.description: Port Kembla Beach is regarded as one of Wollongong's most prestigious beaches. It is located approximately 11 kilometres south of Wollongong.

properties.name: Pilot Beach
properties.description: A calm beach at the mouth of the beautiful Camden Haven River, Pilot Beach is situated between the two break walls, keeping it protected from large seas most of the time. It is the ideal beach for families with young children. No dogs allowed.

properties.name: Nobbys Beach
properties.description: Newcastle's highest profile beach, with council Lifeguard Services provided Monday to Saturday year round and volunteer members of Nobbys Surf Lifesaving Club provide beach patrols on Sundays during the swimming season. It is a favoured swimming spot for family groups and those learning to surf.

properties.name: No.1 Beach
properties.description:
No.1 Beach is found when you first enter seal rocks and is situated directly across from the Seal Rocks Holiday Park.

The beach, views and water is beautiful. No.1 Beach faces north, providing sweeping views back towards Pacific Palms and offering protected swimming. It is also a good surf beach.

properties.name: Mill Bay Boardwalk Narooma
properties.description: The 350 metre Mill Bay Boardwalk from Apex Park (on the northern side of the inlet) is the perfect way to appreciate the natural beauty of Narooma and watch the many activities on its expansive waterway. Look out for large schools of fish and stingrays as you walk. Continue your walk over the bridge and wind your way along Riverside Drive past mangroves to the seafood eateries and cafés at Forsters Bay. Or follow the foreshore in front of the caravan park around past the jetty to Rotary Park, on to Australia Rock and the break wall at the Wagonga Inlet entrance.

properties.name: Manly Beach
properties.description: In company with Bondi, Manly Beach is Sydney’s most iconic strip of sand, named by the State’s first governor Arthur Phillip in 1788 for the impression made on him by “the confidence and manly behaviour” of the area’s Aborigines.

properties.name: Greenfield Beach
properties.description: Greenfield Beach picnic area in Jervis Bay National Park is perfect for a barbecue. After a tasty lunch, go for a walk or head down to the beach for a swim or snorkel.

properties.name: Grants Beach Coastal Walk
properties.description: The Grants Beach Coastal Walk starts at North Haven near the mouth of the Camden Haven River and ends at the cliffs of Grants Headland at Bonny Hills. It is well signposted and passes through heathland, rich in wildflowers during late winter and early spring.

properties.name: Grants Beach
properties.description: Grants (North Haven) Beach is located on the north side of the Camden Haven River mouth. The southern end is protected by the break wall which offers great 'right handers' with a southerly swell. The beach is home to the Camden Haven Surf Lifesaving Club, who patrol the beach throughout the summer weekends.

properties.name: Flynns Beach
properties.description: Flynns Beach, situated three kilometres south of Port Macquarie, is almost 500 metres long and nestled between a pair of rocky headlands to the north and south. It has good protection from westerly and southerly winds and suits learn-to-surfers most of the year. The Surf Club has a kiosk that serves meals.

properties.name: Fingal Head Lighthouse
properties.description:
Fingal Head Lighthouse is a heritage-listed active lighthouse located at Fingal Head, New South Wales, a headland about 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) south of Point Danger, which marks the Queensland border. It is one of the most easterly lighthouses in Australia. 

The lighthouse is open to the public for tours on weekends and public holidays. Visitors can climb to the top of the tower for stunning views of the coastline and surrounding area.

properties.name: Fingal Bay Beach
properties.description: A near-perfect C-curve of sand that faces southeast, Fingal Bay Beach has its own island connected by a sand-spit and is well protected from all but a hefty southeast wind. The spit at the north end which links Fingal Island to the mainland gets decent waves when the sand builds up.

properties.name: Cuttagee Beach and Lake
properties.description: Explore the sparkling blue waters of Cuttagee Beach and Lake, found south of Bermagui. The beach is popular for surfing, swimming and fishing. The lake, framed by one of the Sapphire Coast's iconic single lane wooden bridges, is the perfect spot for young children to play in the shallow, gentle waters when the lake is open to the sea. It is also a great location for canoeing, kayaking, fishing and prawning.

properties.name: Crowdy Head Lighthouse
properties.description: Perched on the mid north coast, 33 kilometres northeast of Taree, Crowdy Head Lighthouse is a historic architectural wonder erected between 1878-1879. Offering breathtaking panoramic views, this coastal beacon is an optimal spot for whale watching, May to Oct

properties.name: Crowdy Head Beaches
properties.description:
The beautiful area of Crowdy Head is located on a vast expanse of unspoilt beach which includes the North Beach and South Beach. 

The North Beach is a well protected beach, excellent for families. The Surf Lifesaving Club overlooks the beach and patrols operate during the summer months.

properties.name: Cronulla Beach
properties.description:
Cronulla Beach is the only beach patrolled all year round by Sutherland Shire Council's professional lifeguards together with volunteer lifesavers from Cronulla Surf Life Saving Club. 

The Cronulla Pavilion and Cronulla Surf Life Saving Club are two prominent buildings located close to the sand, along with a cafe and restaurant. Behind the beach is a large grassed area with plenty of shade and a playground.

properties.name: Cookies Beach Picnic Area - South Durras
properties.description: The Cookies Beach Picnic Area in South Durras is a secluded spot perfect for a beach picnic. It offers stunning views of the beach and the opportunity to see eastern grey kangaroos. One of the main attractions is the Wasp Head geological site, formed by volcanic activity millions of years ago. The area is great for beach activities like swimming and sunbathing. The best time to visit is during the summer months. To get there, visitors can drive and park at the nearby parking lot. Basic facilities like toilets are available, but visitors should bring their own picnic essentials.

properties.name: Caves Beach
properties.description: Caves Beach is well known for its namesake - a network of sea caves at the southern end of the beach, which can be explored at low tide.  Caves Beach has well maintained barbecue facilities and a picnic area. Bring the family down to Caves Beach for a great day out.

properties.name: Brooms Head Main Beach
properties.description:
This breathtaking, unspoilt, uncrowded beach is nestled in a pocket of heath land surrounded by Yuraygir National Park.



A relaxing place for families and visitors of all age groups to get away from the hustle and bustle.

properties.name: Blacksmiths Beach
properties.description: Blacksmiths Beach is a patrolled beach at the southern end of a nine mile stretch of coastline.  It is popular with families, as it is known as being safe for swimming.  The breakwall, which acts as the border between the beach and the Swansea Channel is also popular with walkers, cyclists and fishermen.

properties.name: Beach to Beach Riverside Walk
properties.description: Starting the walk at McLean Beach, follow the path along the banks of the Edward River past magnificent red gum trees and sandy beaches. Head past the hospital, police station, and medical centre to the Ute on the Pole.

properties.name: Batemans Bay Marina
properties.description:
Batemans Bay Marina is located close to the town centre which offers various service clubs and shops all within walking distance. 

With a focus on fresh seafood and other high quality local produce, the marina’s new ‘pop up’ restaurant services both Batemans Bay residents and holiday-makers alike.

properties.name: Balmoral Beach
properties.description: Beautiful houses and expensive yachts, and a beach that is postioned with views over Sydney Harbour National Park and through "the Heads" - the gateway to Sydney Harbour.

properties.name: Avoca Beach
properties.description:
A popular surf beach lined with towering Norfolk Island Pines, Avoca Beach has a relaxed atmosphere which is sought after by locals and visitors alike.

The beach area, which stretches almost two kilometres, incorporates both Avoca Beach and North Avoca Beach and is renowned as a fisherman's paradise.

properties.name: Aslings Beach
properties.description: Aslings Beach is central to the town of Eden, and flanks the northern part of Twofold Bay. Whales (October-November) and dolphins are often seen right along the shoreline, either feeding or sheltering in the Bay. A great family beach located opposite and very close to Eden's range of Caravan Parks.

properties.name: Sugarloaf Point Lighthouse
properties.description: Constructed in 1875, Sugarloaf Point Lighthouse boasts breathtaking Pacific Ocean vistas. This historic beacon illuminates maritime history along Australia's eastern seaboard, guiding ships with its radiant beam. Below the lighthouse, meticulously refurbished Lighthouse Keepers' quarters offer holiday lodgings. Grassy slopes near the lookout point host three memorials. Sugarloaf Point is an ideal locale for whale watching during their coastal migration and possibly spotting dolphins at Lighthouse Beach.

properties.name: Bronte Beach
properties.description: Another beautiful Sydney beach. Not as busy as Bondi beach, also go here if you don't want to pay the $8/hour Bondi parking fee. There are not too many parking spots though as it is a "roadside parking situation".

properties.name: Wollongong Backpackers Keiraleagh
properties.description: Wollongong Backpackers Keiraleagh is situated in a convenient location in the city centre, only a few minutes walk from the many golden sandy beaches - well known for their iconic surf breaks. They offer a unique experience with a range of accommodation to suit your needs.

properties.name: Lighthouse Beach Holiday Village
properties.description: Lighthouse Beach Holiday Village

properties.name: Barenjoey Head Lighthouse
properties.description: Barrenjoey Lighthouse sits at Sydney's most northern point - Barrenjoey Head at Palm Beach. Positioned 91m above sea level, the lighthouse can be reached by a couple of walks and offers outstanding views. It's an easy day trip from Sydney and a great place to bring overseas visitors - they may recognise the lighthouse from Home and Away and will find Summer Bay Surf Club nearby.

properties.name: Shelly Beach
properties.description: Shelly Beach is a coastal suburb of the Central Coast region of New South Wales, Australia, located east of Tuggerah Lake and bordering the Pacific Ocean south of The Entrance

properties.name: Coogee Beach
properties.description: Beach that has some limited facilities onsite

properties.name: Pebbly Beach
properties.description: A stunning beach where can often see kangaroos on a white sand. This beach is part of the beautiful Murramarang National Park.

properties.name: Bulahdelah Showgrounds
properties.description: Bulahdelah Showgrounds offers powered and powered sites suitable for self-contained vehicles, buses and motorhomes. Facilities include hot showers, drinking water, toilets and mobile phone service. Self-contained motor homes are allowed a max of 3 nights.

properties.name: Ebor Falls
properties.description:
Observe Ebor Falls as the Guy Fawkes River cascades 100 meters over two waterfalls. 

Three viewing platforms, each offering stunning perspectives of the rugged gorge terrain, are available: upper falls, lower falls, and valley view. 

A convenient walking trail connects the upper and lower falls platforms along the escarpment's edge, ideal for families. You can commence your walk from either end and return via the road.

properties.name: Glenhope Bush Camp Cobar
properties.description: Glenhope Bush Camping offers a friendly camp site, firewood for campers, a helping hand, local knowledge, and a beer with Budgie(Mark)

properties.name: Whites Beach and Sea Caves
properties.description:
Once voted as Australia's number 1 secret destination, Whites Beach has still managed to fly under the radar for many!

With its stunning coast and even a sea cave to explore, it's easy to see why this is a local favourite!

*Photo Credit -  Destination NSW*

properties.name: Parsley Bay Beach
properties.description: Parsley Bay is the perfect spot for a swim, picnic or a snorkel. It is family friendly and hidden away off the beaten path.

properties.name: Gaagal Wanggaan (Beach South) Tour
properties.description: Join Gumbaynggirr Tour guides for a fantastic 3.5 hour tour of the Aboriginal owned and operated National Park. This cultural experience is a must do if you are visiting the Mid North coast of NSW, including a bush and beach walk through the pristine protected area. Participate in traditional ceremony, engage with the local Gumbaynggirr language, taste traditional foods, learn about the cultural eco systems within the National Park and hear Dreaming stories.

properties.name: Newcastle Visitor Information Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.
